Property description: Located in a quiet turning is this large extended three bedroom 1930's home with space and natural light in abundance. On entry to this property, once you are through the porch, you are greeted by a large hallway with coving throughout leading on to a separate reception room, which the owners had separated from the original through lounge during their tenure.  A second sperate room offers the current owners a play room, whilst a large rear extension creates the open plan kitchen/diner, suitable for a large family or for when guests pop over to visit. To the first floor there are three bedrooms and a large family bathroom, whilst outdoor space includes a garden measuring in excess of 80 feet!! Located within a short walk of a number of local shops, whilst also being within a stone throw of Morrisons and Sainsburys, puts this home in a fantastic position for the new owners to enjoy. Our vendors have been at this property for over 30 years, and will truly miss the neighbours and the sense of community, demonstrating that this would make another family happy for many years. Call us today to arrange your viewing.

A characterful six bedroom double-fronted Victorian semi-detached house positioned on a popular tree-lined residential road. This generously proportioned (2295 sq ft / 213.2 sq m) property is arranged over three levels and has been improved and upgraded by the current owner to offer an ideal long-term opportunity for a young or growing family. A welcoming entrance hall leads to two sizeable reception rooms and a study which boast original period features such as fireplaces, coving, and sash windows. The rear reception has solid oak flooring, a working fireplace and French doors to the garden.  The remainder of the ground floor comprises of a WC, a modern kitchen with plenty of storage and a 17ft conservatory / breakfast room with under floor heating. This space provides a quiet sanctuary to enjoy sunny days and wildlife overlooking the garden. The first floor is made up of three bedrooms (with a complete wall of fitted wardrobes to the master), a family bathroom, and a separate shower room / dressing room. A large arched window floods the stairwell with light and leads to the top floor which houses three further bedrooms and includes eaves storage and exposed brickwork. Externally there is a mature walled rear garden with fruit trees, a patio seating area and sunny southerly aspect. Also, a 33ft detached tandem garage which could be perfect for a workshop, studio, or home office. This location offers access to nearby rail links such as Birkbeck, Anerley, and Norwood Junction (fast to London Bridge), as well as handy amenities and proximity to the popular Stuart Fleming Primary school. A viewing of this well cared-for property is essential to appreciate the accommodation.  EPC: E | Council Tax Band F

A rarely available Victorian double fronted home with four double bedrooms, three reception rooms, and two bathrooms.This well-proportioned home of circa 1450 Sq Ft. features stripped and polished floorboards and a lovely wide stairway leading up to a nice big landing area.The Zone 2 location will please the busy commuter with the choice of Brockley Overground or Nunhead Station for City Thameslink.For those thinking of schools, the choice nearby according to Ofsted is Outstanding.The home is offered chain free.What The Seller Says -"I fell in love with the house, for its handsome proportions, being symmetrically double-fronted with four bay windows. Location-wise, I chose Aspinall Road, in Telegraph Hill ward, for three reasons: The fact it is a quiet tree-lined road, Its close proximity to large open green spaces; Telegraph Hill upper park with tennis courts, and Nunhead Cemetery, one of the Magnificent Seven woodland Victorian cemeteries only a stone's through away.It also has great transport links, with very easy access to both Canary Wharf, London Bridge & the City, as well as Victoria & Belgravia."

Located within a quiet cul-de-sac moments from Caledonian Road Underground Station and adjacent to Caledonian Park, measuring approximately 1658 SqFt is this exceptional six bedroom, three bathroom end-of-terrace Freehold house with driveway.Newly refurbished throughout, this wonderful light filled modernistic house spanning four floors provides functionality and flexible living space. The PropertyNewly presented to the market, we have this magnificent family home which has been in the same ownership for the past 52 years.  Full of period features and both elegantly and effortlessly charming, this voluminous 3 storey house (with cellar) is now ready for a family to come in and write the next chapter in its history.  It has 2 reception rooms, 2 bathrooms and 4 bedrooms * as well as a roof terrace and a private garden. It could be moved into or expanded/developed/refurbished, subject to all the usual permissions.  A lovely home or a great opportunity - or an investment to the right buyer.But the best bit is the area - what a place to live!  Clapham High Street, Clapham Old Town in one direction and in the other direction you have Stockwell and Brixton with their own unique feel!! The location is great as it is close enough to Central London for commuting/entertainment etc and is situated in close proximity to a recently established 24/7hr gym.  The property benefits from very good transport links, being just a short walk from several stations including; Stockwell Underground Station (Victoria Line & Northern Line) and Clapham North Underground Station (Northern Line) as well as being  covered by several bus services.  Head towards the Wandsworth Road and you have a flagship Sainsbury’s, local restaurants and shops, and primary school are within a short walk as well as Central London/London Eye etc. This means it is suitable not just for those wanting to live in a great area, but also those needing to commute. There is plenty of green space, with Larkhall Park a stone's throw away, and Clapham Common nearby.In summary, a really good place to live and/or invest.( *Please note that bedroom 4 has been used many years ago as a kitchen but is being recognised as a bedroom on our floorplan)Disclaimer for virtual viewingsSome or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Element Properties & Co are proud to present this immaculate four bedroom detached house, set within a modern, private development in the Bounds Green / Bowes Park area.Boasting over c159 SQM (c1709 SQFT) of lateral space; this exceptional architecturally designed property is comprised of four double bedrooms, a large open plan kitchen/living room, three bathrooms (one en-suite), and landscaped front and rear gardens, all in addition to a media room. The property has a fantastic energy rating of B (assisted by the discrete solar panels on the roof).Exquisitely designed from top to bottom, this home offers a chic interior and finish throughout. Located in a secluded private estate with off-street parking, gates on each side of the development (allowing a cut through to Bounds Green), the property presents a unique experience given the wonderful bio-diverse woodland in which it resides and its detached nature both symbolically and physically from the busy London lifestyle.The key benefits London has to offer can all be found on this home’s doorstep whilst maintaining green surroundings. Bounds Green Station is situated only 0.3 miles away (Piccadilly Line) - offering links around North and Central London. Passing stops include Finsbury Park, Holborn, Kings Cross and Leicester Square alongside a variety of others. As a note, Finsbury Park Station is only a 15 minute train journey on the Underground. Moreover, Bowes Park (0.2 miles) and Alexandra Palace (0.4 miles) stations offer direct links to Highbury & Islington and Moorgate - in 15 and 25 minutes respectively.   The property is positioned around the corner from the community centred Myddelton Road, boasting a variety of shops and cafes. The vibrant offerings of Muswell Hill and Green Lanes can both be found only a short walk away and the colourful markets and parks of Alexandra Palace offer a great escape from bustling city life. Thereafter, Alexandra Park and Myddleton Road both provide Sunday markets offering a huge spread from local produce, groceries all the way to vintage gear! Both spaces are a must see for anyone looking to move in the area as the community spirit cannot be better reflected than taking a stroll through these colourful markets. Viewings are highly recommended to ascertain the uniqueness of this property.The property is offered with a Freehold title.

A four bedroom, three bathroom, Victorian house across four floors totalling over 1,400 sq ft. Within a gated mews in Walthamstow Village, setting a new benchmark for sustainable design. The homes are the result of five years of design development and are being built around three main pillars: to be carbon negative, with zero construction waste and net energy positive and so set to incur no utility bills. The homes are fully electric, powered by 198 solar panels all EPC A rated. The majority of the features in the homes have been designed bespoke for The Arbour and include compressed earth brick walls and lampshades made from site soil, worktops made from wood shavings from the timber frame, shower panels from recycled plastics and more. The interior design is by Rockett St George, who have carefully curated each space and fixture to align with the aspirations of the project and debuts their new sustainable furniture range. Materials have been selected to look good, to be low carbon and to require little maintenance.  The Arbour benefits from an abundance of communal landscaped spaces, including a central community garden that will include vegetable patches, foraging, outdoor kitchen and seating. The gardens have been landscaped by the award-winning London Glades, to be self-sustainable over time and to provide a safe and enjoyable space for families to come together. The development also includes a re-use centre, an electric car club vehicle, and electric and traditional bicycles all exclusively reserved for residents.

Within a gated mews in Walthamstow Village, setting a new benchmark for sustainable development. The homes are the result of five years of design development and are being built around three main pillars: to be carbon negative, with zero construction waste and net energy positive and so set to incur no utility bills. The homes are fully electric, powered solely by solar panels and are all EPC A rated. The majority of the features in the homes have been designed bespoke for The Arbour and include compressed earth brick walls and lampshades made from site soil, worktops made from wood shavings from the timber frame, shower panels from recycled plastics and more.IF YOU LIVED HERE The interior design is by Rockett St George, who have carefully curated each space and fixture to align with the aspirations of the project, which debuts their new sustainable furniture range. Materials have been selected portray a contemporary design, to be low carbon and require little maintenance. The Arbour benefits from an abundance of communal landscaped spaces, including a central community garden that will include vegetable patches, foraging, outdoor kitchen and seating. The gardens have been landscaped by the award-winning London Glades, to be self-sustainable over time and to provide a safe and enjoyable space for families to come together. The development also includes a re-use centre, an electric car club vehicle and electric and traditional bicycles all exclusively reserved for residents. WHAT ELSE?- Walthamstow schools are excellent and plentiful, within a one mile radius alone you have twenty eight primary/secondary schools, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted with eight deemed 'Outstanding'.- Your spoilt for choice when it comes to great pubs. The Queen's Arms is the closest, offering excellent food and a great choice of craft beers in a comfortable , traditionally sumptuous environment. - Amongst many other local highlights, Europe's longest street market runs down Walthamstow High Street, less than a half mile stroll away as well as Epping Forest and the Walthamstow Wetlands.While the perks of Walthamstow Village are a mere stone’s throw away, you’ll have your own community on your literal doorstep;....... Residents can ‘live, work and play’ within the space, with access to a covered community garden with an outdoor workstation and kitchen for preparing homegrown food, as well as a reuse centre for exchanging goods between residents.'For me, this development is watershed moment in British construction. The building techniques used have been groundbreaking and once I delved into the details, I was left inspired by the materials used and conscious of how our consumer choices can make a difference.  The project has been carefully curated over 5 years and studies embarked on by GS8 have unearthed issues associated with standard building techniques. With innovative ideas the GS8 team have set about to find solutions to assist this project and help move the industry forward, which in turn will benefit future generations. Purchasers have a rare chance to own a home that in years to come will be recognised as a masterpiece in construction, which challenges not only the way we build but also the way with live.'   Daniel MajeedHead of Land & New Homes

Built in 1832, 55 Beulah Road has always been a commercial building, once a piano manufacturer’s, with the business owners living upstairs & their shop downstairs. This pretty cherry blossom-lined road was Walthamstow’s original high street and continues to be a mix of commercial & residential properties, within a key area in the gentrification of Walthamstow.Extended over most of the plot with a small garden area at the rear, this is no ordinary refurb. The owners have run a successful business here since the 1970s, having always loved the village location. So when they decided to modernise they engaged specialist architects to design and extend the space to a contemporary finish, while preserving  the building’s historic character and attributes. And the result is gorgeous.It’s set over 2 floors, with a reception area at the front, open-plan desk space, storage space, kitchen area, 2 WCs with disabled access & shower room, and a new staircase leading up to meeting rooms.The pitched roof & exposed ceiling joists not only look incredible, they maximise the sense of space; and a glass divide over the party wall provides sound proofing, without compromising the flow of natural light. People love working here because of its homely atmosphere & village location. And the refurb reflects what people want in offices now. The state of the art ventilation system physically changes the air & a fully equipped kitchen gives people the means to make a good meal at lunchtime, with a comfortable space to sit or step outside.Located in the heart of the village, & a short walk from local cafes, restaurants and sports facilities, there’s easy access to transport links by bus, by tube and Overground from Walthamstow Central station, which is a 10 minute walk away or a 4 minute cycle. A detached double-fronted four bedroom family home in the southern portion of Nunhead just moments from Peckham Rye. In excellent condition throughout and with a superb layout this fantastic family home is absolutely ready to move in and is sold chain free. Step in though the central doorway an you'll love the balanced and expansive layout - perfectly geared for modern living so that the family can thrive whilst work-from-home options are happily catered for. There's a study on the ground floor, very generous reception, separate dining room addressing the garden, and a broad kitchen too. The whole ground floor enjoys multiple aspect natural light, comes with downstairs WC, and lends itself very nicely to versatile and modern living. Step into the garden and you'll find plenty of space for entertaining with family and friends - great facilities for outdoor cooking - and there's a separate annex for gym, spare room or additional home-office as you please. A lovely light and bright layout upstairs presents four bedrooms, family bathroom and separate WC, along with a large loft too.With easy access for bikes along with free on street parking the house is nicely set back from the road. And it's a quiet road too - Rosenthorpe Road stands just off Ivydale Road with excellent access to Zone One from Peckham Rye and Nunhead stations for seamless links to numerous Central London destinations. Very popular and reputable Ivydale School is just a few minutes' walk way, as well as several additional primary and secondary schools. For green space you are blessed with the leafy expanses of Peckham Rye, and the intrigues of the iconic Nunhead Cemetery. Food and drink aplenty on Rye Lane - seriously decent world cuisine - great fish at Sopers on Nunhead Lane, evening meals on Bellenden Road and more established outlets on Lordship Lane in East Dulwich. There are many local attractions.A superb four bedroom, double-fronted, detached family home. Great location, and chain free. Call haart of Dulwich to view.

Ref/JD0093 - CHAIN FREE & Excellent for Professionals, Couples and Young families in an excellent location! Wonderful Mews House with two large double bedrooms (one with ensuite) enjoying south east facing terrace,  is set in a pretty and secluded gated development, offers an opportunity not to be missed. The modern and attractive property is conveniently located around the corner from all the shops and amenities of the desirable South End Green. It is also within proximity to the green spaces of Parliament Hill Fields and Hampstead Heath, whilst Hampstead Heath Overground Station and Belsize Park Underground Station (Northern Line) are just moments away.The property has a crisp, stylish decor with wide wooden floors and double glazed windows throughout and is a peaceful place to relax in.The bright and sun-drenched reception room is open plan with a fully fitted modern kitchen and on the first floor. It benefits from an exceptionally high vaulted ceiling, adding depth and character to the living area and allowing space for larger light fixtures to hang from the ceiling should one desire. It also benefits from wall to wall sliding doors with bespoke shutters, opening to a large balcony. Sitting out on the private balcony with a coffee or glass of wine on a warm summer evening offers a wonderful way to unwind and entertain.The two bathrooms are recently refurbished to a high standard. The family bathroom is a very good size with a shower, whilst the other one is the ensuite with a bath. The two double bedrooms are large and proportionate. The one that has the ensuite is on the ground floor and is currently being used as a home office, perfect for people working from home. It can easily be used as a guest room too whilst the other bedroom on the split level enjoys floor to ceiling sliding doors, opening to a lovely patio. Spacious and well-maintained, this house offers everything you could possibly want to serve a busy lifestyle. Set within a desirable area, it is perfect for professionals, couples, young families and investors due to its excellent position for the tube station, all local amenities, and transport links to the city centre.NW3Some say that living in NW3 means you’ve reached the pinnacle of London life. This postcode is one of the most sought after (and affluent) in the UK. It offers peaceful, idyllic village settings just a few miles away from Central London and buzzy areas like  Camden and includes both Hampstead and Belsize Park within. Classed as the 'world's finest urban village', Hampstead is celebrated for its intellectual, artistic and musical associations.Affluent Belsize Park is home to cafes, delis, bakeries, and independent boutiques in the area around Belsize Village and England’s Lane, while smart bistros serve Spanish, Italian, and pan-Asian cuisine. The Everyman Belsize Park cinema shows classic and arthouse movies. Quiet, leafy residential streets are lined with quaint mews houses and Georgian and Victorian villas converted into spacious apartments.South End GreenSouth End Green is a pocket of Hampstead positioned next to the Heath, home to excellent shops, transport links and the Royal Free Hospital. Wedged between Hampstead, Belsize Park, and Hampstead Heath, South End Green is a place with a distinct, lively identity that's increasingly becoming a magnet for both locals and visitors, thanks to its many food and drink offerings and relaxed, friendly, welcoming atmosphere. The well regarded Daunt Books and one of London's oldest bakeries, Euphorium, contribute to an attractive shopping area,South End Green has Conservation Area status and consists of mostly late Victorian architecture. Hampstead Heath Overground station is located here, alongside a handy bus station.Hampstead HeathMillions flock to Hampstead Heath each year to explore the 800 acres of open space. The Heath provides sprawling countryside in a London setting with rolling meadows, scenic trails, rugged woodland and an abundance of local wildlife.Head to Parliament Hill for sweeping views of London or visit one of three public ponds where many go for a dip.

Beautifully Presented Three Bedroom Period Home in Popular Spot. You'll just love this perfectly placed three bedroom Victorian gem. Located within an easy stroll of the very best of Camberwell and Peckham, the property comprises a lovely double reception, contemporary kitchen/diner, three lovely bedrooms, bathroom and handy wc. The rear patio garden is well presented and low maintenance. The location is highly prized being within moments from Bellenden Village, Camberwell and Peckham. Even closer is the very lovely Lucas Gardens. Transport links abound with nearby Denmark Hill Station and Peckham Rye Station (both a 12 minute walk) and any number of bus routes on nearby Peckham Road. It is also a 25 minute cycle into town.A handsome exterior encourages you from the mature, peaceful street. Inside you meet high ceilings and ornate cornice work. The double reception sits on the right with more cornicing and marvellous matching fireplaces. You'll enjoy ample dining, lounging and entertaining space. Toward the end of the hall you find the top notch contemporary kitchen/diner which has a side bay window and oodles of counter space. Appliances include a four ring gas hob, oven, integrated dishwasher and fridge freezer. Glass doors open full width to the rear offering access to your pretty patio garden. Heading upward you find a spacious landing with laundry cupboard. The master bedroom fronts the street with a wall of fab fitted wardrobes and two windows. A second lovely double bedroom sits next door with a peaceful rear aspect. The bathroom enjoys delicious tiling over the bath and in the shower. There's plenty of shelf space for lotions, potions and towels and three side facing window for light and airiness. Your third and final bedroom, a well proportioned single room, will comfortably house a double bed. There's a handy local shop within seconds of your front door (great for milk and the like). South London Art Gallery and Camberwell College of Arts are minutes away for a spot of cultural activity. For those with small children, The Villa Nursery and Lyndhurst Primary are very close. Going to work? Reach Peckham Rye or Denmark Hill stations in about 12 minutes for frequent, fast services to central London and beyond. The London Overground further increases your connectivity to the tube network. You can get to Clapham High Street in a mere 5 minutes. Shoreditch and Islington are easy and Canary Wharf (via Canada Water) will take around 15 minutes. Grab one of the many buses running along Peckham Road (moments away); these will take you pretty much anywhere you want to go! Settle the weekly shop at Dog Kennel Hill Sainsbury's, just two minutes in the car. Bountiful Bellenden Road is an easy stroll for yet more social attractions.

This award winning development is set within a secure gated mews in South West London. This is a unique and spacious two bedroom family home, located only a short distance of Battersea Park, and, with easy access to Clapham Junction and direct lines into London Waterloo. Northcote Road is a short distance away with its array of shops, restaurants, cafés, bars as, an example of a few attractions. Central London can be accessed easily with a direct line in twenty five minutes. There are a range of schools including Thomas’s school, positioned within 0.5miles of the property, and Shillington park, situated outside the gates, hosts all the little leagues for Battersea and Chelsea.Inside the gates, the grounds are well maintained. The front door leads into a large entrance hall with double mirrored cupboards, storage/utility cupboard with space for a washing machine. There are two good size bedrooms, both with wood floors, bay windows, and fitted wardrobes with sensor lights that are activated when opened.   The larger of the rooms has and en-suite shower, wet room, cupboard which is light censored, including a cupboard with shelving for shoes. There is also a family bathroom comprising a bath, separate shower cubicle, WC, wash hand basin and heated towel rail. Both bathrooms have underfloor heating. The garage has an electric front up and over mechanism but is currently being used by the current owner as a study/storage area. There is potential to convert into a further bedroom subject to planning permission. The wood floors extend to the first floor which leads to large open plan room, with high ceiling and Velux electric windows, with blinds. There are floor to ceiling sliding doors to the courtyard area, which allows natural light into the rooms. The room is split into a living area, study area with a space saving wall bed and kitchen. The kitchen has a variety of base level and wall mounted cream gloss units providing ample storage, 4 ring ceramic hob, oven,  extractor hood, integrated dishwasher, and tall standing fridge freezer.The outside terrace area is private and well maintained, ideal for cosy nights and dining. The property is warm inside, offering a generous size living space, including double glazing, gas central heating and the property is offered by the owner with no onward chain. Viewings are highly recommended.

INVESTMENT -  A Freehold mid-terrace townhouse that has been converted into separate two and four bedroom apartments, in close proximity to Finsbury Park Station. Birnam Road is located within the vacinity one of Islington’s well-preserved Conservation Areas. The Tollington Park area was one of the first to be laid out in the northern part of the borough with many of the of the grand semi-detached Victorian villas from the 1830s and 40s still in place today.With the greenery, shops, bars and restaurants of both Finsbury Park and Crouch Hill within a 10-minute walk from your door, this area is truly perfect for everyone. Local transport is provided through Crouch Hill Overground Station 0.4m away and Victoria Line and Piccadilly Line services can be sought at Finsbury Park Station, just 0.5m away. There is also a fantastic amount of local bus services too into the City and the West End from Hornsey Road.

Berkeley are working in long term partnership with London Wildlife Trust to continually encourage biodiversity within Cator Park. Brand New 3 Bedroom Terraced Townhouse. This fantastic property features accommodation over four levels boasting 1798sqft of living space. The ground floor utilises a large study room, WC and a large storage area. Stairs lead to the first floor and the spacious living room, modern kitchen/dining room and a further WC, plus access to your landscaped rear garden. The second floor consists of a landing which leads to Bedroom 2 and Bedroom 3, both of which are double in size, plus the family bathroom. The top, fourth floor is where you will find the impressively spacious master bedroom, complete with walk in wardrobe, en-suite bathroom and doors that lead from your bedroom directly onto your sun terrace!Within your new home you’ll find; contemporary kitchens complete with integrated appliances, ample storage space, elegantly designed bathrooms each with heated chrome towel rails and showers, and additional features include energy efficient lighting, media points in the lounge and study plus a district heating system that supplies low carbon energy efficient heating to your property! Externally there is a private landscaped garden to the rear of your home, and an enclosed Millbrook Square courtyard giving you and your neighbours an additional welcome open space. At the front of the townhouse, you will find the first of two parking spaces, the second of which is located in the secure underground parking of Millbrook Square with an optional EV charging point. Off-road and secure parking, plus your own outdoor space – in London – a fantastic addition to an already fantastic property!Dimensions*Living Room – 5.00m x 3.10m Kitchen/Dining – 4.99m x 3.00m Study Room – 4.02m x 2.94mBedroom 1 – 5.44m x 2.75m Bedroom 2 – 5.00m x 3.00m Bedroom 3 – 5.00m x 3.33m Bathroom - 2.34m x 1.90mEn-Suite – 2.14m x 1.3m W/C – 1.59 x 1.05m*All dimensions are approximateMillbrook Square is in Mill Hill, which itself is nestled in the brilliant borough of Barnet, sitting largely in the Metropolitan Green Belt. The area has an abundance of green spaces to complement your London home, surrounded by woodland walks, picture postcard parks, conservation areas and local reservoirs for riparian rambles, making it obvious why it’s known for being one of London’s greenest boroughs.From your new home at Millbrook Park, you are just a few minutes’ walk away from the stunning Bittacy Hill Park while the popular Arrandene Open Space and the Dollis Valley Greenwalk are both within a mile and a half of your doorstep.For those looking for all-year round indoor pursuits, Virgin Active is located at Mill Hill nearby while the Barnet Copthall Leisure Centre is less than half an hours’ walk from Millbrook Square, offering an exciting and extensive range of sport and fitness clubs, including swimming. Rugby fans will also note that it is the location of the StoneX Stadium, home to Premiership Rugby team The Saracens.Of course, you are within easy reach of the city of London and all the attractions it has on offer via the underground with Mill Hill East underground only 2 minute walk away, but also you are best placed for other attractions too. The BBC Elstree studio tours are just a 10-minute drive from Millbrook Square, while the Warner Bros. Studio Tour is just half hours’ drive northwest on the M1 for Harry Potter fans. Heading east on the M25 for half an hour will also bring you to the equally magical Epping Forest.** typical interior images and may not depict actual house type **

An excellent three-bedroom property positioned on a well-regarded street in the heart of the Shaftesbury Estate. Architecturally-treated three bedroom Victorian terrace (built 1908) of 1194 square feet, on a quiet residential back street with unrestricted parking.  The house was fully renovated in 2017; it's been sensitively and artfully-extended both out and up, and boasts both bath and shower rooms. Paint and professional colour consulting impresses throughout (March & Son of Lewes, Sussex), and a well-established rear garden extends over 25 feet (accessed from large folding doors from your dining area).   You're really close to Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres, the beautiful green space of Nunhead cemetery, and also to volunteer-run Aquarius Golf Club. Your local stations are Nunhead, Peckham Rye and Brockley; all are circa a mile from the house (and Fare Zone 2).  From the hall, your formal through-reception rests to your left. Beautifully-laid oak herringbone flooring runs through here - reclaimed from a school in north Wales. Further treats include cast iron radiators, a gas-fuelled stove in woodburner style, and an original fireplace reinstated (not functional); both with slate hearths. The large kitchen/dining room - of over 18 feet by over 11 feet - is accessed from part-glazed timber double-doors (yet another lovely feature). What a room! Marrying old and new harmoniously, you've got a large roof light over the dining area, and a dreamy fitted kitchen from British Standard by Plain English, teamed with Carrera marble and reclaimed Iroko hardwood worktops. Other welcome features include a fitted larder, a boiler cupboard, storage, laundry space for washer/dryer, and a polished concrete floor (with clever water underfloor heating system). At the foot of the delightful room, you have a full-span, narrow-frame sliding glazing system, which fully opens for inside-out dining in the summer months.  Up to the first floor and from the half-landing, you'll find the main bathroom (which was renovated in 2019) to the rear of the house, with sash window, neat and modern white suite, and large built-in cupboard - which is great for towels and such.  From the main landing, find a large and twin-sashed master bedroom across the front of the house (this is over 12 feet by over 11 feet), and your second bedroom's next door (of over 11 feet by over 7 feet). Both rooms have original feature fireplaces, and wool carpets were laid in 2020 (sanded and treated floorboards with 'white wash' are beneath the carpets - if that's more your thing). At the top of the house is a very lovely large loft bedroom, of over 19 feet by over 12 feet. You have Velux and casement windows, and custom-built wardrobes plus accessible eaves storage. A neat and windowed en suite with large walk-in shower completes the house tour.  Green space? Peckham Rye Park & Common is your most local green space (walk five minutes) - comprising a Victorian Park and historic common; a pleasant refuge for both the local community and wildlife. It's home to ornamental gardens, streams, woodland and a lake, playgrounds and a cafe, plus outdoor gym. The park has been awarded Green Flag status and has a long, rich and engaging history - it was recorded as being cultivated before the Norman Conquest in the 11th Century! At the tip of the common you have a host of cool eateries like Mr Bao, Good Neighbour and Banh Banh, and trendy hairdressing salon (Blue Tit).  Bellenden Road, Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane are also close for yummy restaurants (we love Levan, Ganapati, The Begging Bowl and Artusi), cool bars and pubs, Peckham Levels, and The Bussey Building.  You're a short stroll from Nunhead and East Dulwich's town centres too. In Nunhead we like Kudu Grill and El Vermut, plus Ayres bakery and FC Soper wet fish shop. Brockley's also close for more options, and for pubs - The Ivy House, The Waverley, The Herne and The Angel Oak are all strong locals.  Local schools are all good; your most local is Ivydale Primary.

Superb six-bedroom home in the heart of Ladywell. The property is split over four levels and is immaculately presented with a comprehensive refurbishment just completed in a stunning Farrow and Ball colour scheme. Veda Road is a picturesque and quiet residential road, with a close-knit community, backing onto Hilly Fields Park, and is located in Ladwell, Lewisham which has been aptly named Ladywell Village. It is a family friendly area with a constellation of well-regarded nurseries and an abundance of green space including Ladywell Fields and Hilly Fields where you can find free tennis courts. There is a weekly famers' market nearby selling fresh groceries (Brockley Market) and soon to be a three-screen cinema in the converted Grade II listed Ladywell Playtower. The property is a two-minute walk to the high street which has an abundance of amenities including a butchers, deli, patisserie, post office, coffee shops, Ladywell train station and a popular gastro-pub. Ladywell Station provides fast and frequent services into London Bridge, Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Cannon St. For anyone wanting to get to Canary Wharf, Lewisham Station is a short walk, where you can pick up the DLR and arrive in 13 minutes for as little as £1.

The AreaForest Gate has a history of offering a mosaic of woodland and grazing (it's in the name!), forming part of Wanstead Flats and wider Epping Forest. Not many know about this hidden green oasis in the far reaches of the East End. This one-of-a-kind home was recently completed on a plot in the heart of Forest Gate. Finding a plot of land of this size and potential in London is becoming an increasing rarity, but for Mr C who designed and developed the property, it was an opportunity not to miss. The site was just a post-war gap between houses, left to the elements for too long.  Planning was achieved for a 3-bedroom house on the site, with a split lower and upper-level layout, creating almost a hidden home in residential Newham.Architecture and property'The internal face of the house is all clad in waterproofed cork sheets, perfect for retaining heat and acoustics. It also has a subtle wood bark smell, which defined our relationship with the house', Mr C explains as he walks me through the process of build & eventual design. The soil was of solid clay ground when preparing the site, thus foundation works were smooth, great for the lower floor's concrete 'basin'.  Pink-hued facing bricks are used for the exterior, alongside low-carbon blockwork to form cavity walls, where exposed Douglas Fir roof joists sit on and form the flat green roofs. Mr C explains how they had to use a 'contrasting' material for the taller volume of the roof, so went for corrugated metal sheets to clad the upper level of the house. The house is surrounded by gardens on all sides, which ensures that all the courtyards are visually and physically connected. Skylights are consciously positioned throughout for daylight to stream into the house. Natural materials are used throughout to give a harmony to the aesthetic, with cork sheets lining the cavity walls, treated plywood panels used to line the ceiling and breathable lime render on all internal partitions. The floor is finished with poured resin over underfloor heating; a wonderful treat for barefoot living. Brass kitchen cabinetry is used to bring drama and to reflect light in the centre of the house, a bold statement for a home with otherwise organic finishes. BackgroundMr C talked to me about how he wanted to build beautiful sustainability into the house, which is why they opted for cork sheets.  This sustainable awareness is echoed in the low-carbon blockwork and lime render. The house achieves a blend of being visually attractive whilst retaining the all-important sustainability creds. The level of thoughtfulness brought to the materials throughout the house also delivers cheaper energy bills!As an architect, Mr C has always wanted to build his own house and came across the plot online by chance. Having been living in North London, with no prior connection to Forest Gate, he and his partner suddenly realised what could be achieved, in this exciting location.  In order to achieve planning requirements, the house could not be too tall, so they opted for a half-sunken lower-ground floor level for the principal bedroom and ensuite bathroom. This resulted in a shorter flight of stairs with no landing to reduce the flow around levels, consequently opening up an additional room in the stairwell itself. The windows in the central courtyard also connect the level visually from room to room.As the internal face of the house is cork clad, this keeps heat in and provides additional natural insulation and a textured approach, creating an almost cocoon-like feel to the house.Out and AboutAs this is a genuine East End residential area, it has an obvious energy for regeneration given its proximity to the Elizabeth Line. This area has become increasingly popular with young families, benefitting from a great school network and rapid access to City, Stansted and Luton airports. Close by are Forest Gate Arches, recently regenerated to include an array of great local businesses. Some choice pickings include, Wild Goose Bakery, an artisan bakery, an authentic Italian delicatessen and Pretty Decent Beer Company, an independent brewery just at the end of the road!  The Holly Tree pub just around the corner has been refurbished and is perfect for a Sunday roast.Hackney Wick and Stratford are close by as well, with a vast array of pubs, bars and restaurants, and the Westfield shopping centre is a short drive. A real asset is the proximity to the huge natural areas of Wanstead Flats, and the close proximity to Epping Forest. "Whenever we want to take a break from working at home, we go for a walk in the Flats trying out different paths. It is massive, full of ponds and lakes teeming with nature. Wellies are a must though " said Mr C. Transport LinksForest Gate overground is a 9 minute walk, connecting straight through to Liverpool Street for the City, and linking up with Stratford for the Central Line. Wanstead Park overground is also a 7 minute stroll, linking West to East, and is only two stops to Barking for the district line. An array of 24-hour buses from Forest Road take you straight into Stratford Westfield and the Olympic in under 30 minutes.

Rare to market, 1132 square feet, 2/3 bedroom upside down mews house with south facing patio garden. The house was designed by Julian Cowie Architects and was originally a factory. This substantial property is located on Monsell Road which was previously called Kings Road and later renamed in honour of John Samuel Bewley Monsell who was a prolific Victorian hymn writer, best known for “Fight the good fight” hymn.  The original bay window remains to the front of the property offering a cottage like look to the house. This unique mews house is arranged with three meter height ceilings to the ground level where two main bedrooms and two bathrooms are situated, the main bedroom also benefitting from French doors opening up to a beautiful and south facing patio garden which is demised to the property. Further, neighbouring patio gardens are demised to other mews houses and are interlinked with a communal pathway creating a feeling of a rare London community feel. An extremely spacious living room sits on the first floor which is flooded with light via double aspect windows and skylights to the mezzanine level which is currently used as a library/study but can also accommodate an occasional bedroom, if needed. The ceiling in the living room extends to just over five meters to the front. The kitchen is separate to the living accommodation but can also be opened up if required. This property is extremely flexible to suit any individual needs and is currently designed with modern living in mind. This property is being sold chain free and with a Share of Freehold. Monsell Road is a popular residential road in leafy Highbury and benefits from excellent transport links to the City via the Piccadilly and Victoria lines. It is walking distance to the green open spaces of Highbury Fields, Finsbury Park and Clissold Park..

FULL DESCRIPTION  This quirky and interesting house offers generous accommodation arranged over three floors, boasting two generous double bedrooms with en suite to the main bedroom, with living accommodation spread over the top two floors.The main living area is on the first floor, with separate kitchen complementing a large double aspect living room. To the rear, the Juliet balcony overlooks the private patio leading out to the communal garden of this trendy little London enclave.Stairs lead up to a versatile area on a mezzanine level, great as a home office and occasional third/ guest bedroom. LOCATION AND TENURE  A quite street, Monsell Road is convenient for Victoria, Piccadilly and Overground lines via Finsbury Park Transport Hub, or Drayton Park for a 10 minute journey to Moorgate. Clissold Park, Highbury Fields and Finsbury Park are all within walking distance. There are plenty of amenities nearby with Waitrose on Holloway Rd, The esoteric shops of Highbury Bran including La Fromagerie, Godfrey's butchers, Da Mario's deli and Bournes fishmongersThis property has a share of the freehold, set up to manage the communal areas with a healthy sinking fund.

This house was converted from a factory in the ‘loft style’ by the award-winning Julian Cowie Architects, and retains its original 1890 bay window. It has all the benefits of a terraced house, including its own front door, while offering all of the benefits of the Monsell Court development. There is a reason why these properties rarely come to market: the last one was sold over ten years ago.The ingenious design maximises the space and light throughout the house, with 3m ceilings on the ground floor and a vaulted living area above, giving a huge space to entertain.The mezzanine gallery at the top of the house could be used as a third bedroom, but is currently set up as a library and study for two people, making it the ideal place to work from home.There is a private garden in the south-facing courtyard at the back of a house, and a Juliette balcony which looks out over the palm trees. Monsell Road is a tree-lined street in Highbury West that connects to the ‘Blackstock Village’, with its traditional butcher, greengrocer, bookshop and vintner, along with cafés and restaurants including Fink’s, Beam and Top Cuvée. Gillespie School is around the corner. Clissold Park, Gillespie Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields are all nearby, and the whole of London is within easy reach on the Victoria and Piccadilly lines.Ideal for young families, those looking for something unusual and professionals too. An early viewing is highly recommend.

A very rare opportunity to acquire an Edwardian Home in excess of 1410 sq. ft. Situated on a tranquil tree lined cul-de-sac which has a walkway leading to Alexandra Palace Rail Station and the Park itself. Wood Green High Road and its amenities are a short walk away, also in locality is Muswell Hill with all its restaurants, bars/ pubs, and an array of independent shops.Whether it’s the green outdoors or social functions you are looking for, rest assured they are all close by in this popular and diverse location.THE PROPERTYThe property has period hallmarks all throughout such as a fireplace, cornices, coving, ceiling roses, dado rails and wooden floors. The first-floor hosts two spacious double bedrooms, a charming single bedroom, and the family bathroom. All bedrooms are furnished with wooden floors. The Palace formerly known as the ‘The People’s Palace’ is one of North London’s true Jewels. With long stretching history to when it was first built in 1873 it has now firmly stamped itself with a reputation as one of London’s premier venues. With its beautiful setting and panoramic views of London, it’s a perfect place to spend the day or simply take a stroll through. With a vast number of additional facilities such as the Ice Rink, Bar & Kitchen, Boating Lake, Animal Enclosure and Conservation Area. There is with no doubt something for everyone. The amenities do not stop there with this property, within 10 minutes you can reach Wood Green Underground (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) which is found connected to the main shopping district of the patch. As well as the Underground you have an array of different shops which include a Shopping Mall along with a range of diverse restaurant’s offering a variety of cuisines. When it comes to shopping and dining the Wood Green High Road is bound to meet all requirements, whether you are looking for clothing, household goods or groceries, there is nothing missed here. In the catchment area are many desirable schools such as, Trinity and Bounds Green primary schools, St Thomas Moore and Hartlands Secondary School.Imminent interest is expected, do not miss your chance to view this impressive home based in an astounding location.Call Property Inc today to arrange a view. Think…Property Inc!

The kitchen area itself comprises a high quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances.  A separate utility provides additional work/appliance space.  To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles, with access to a balcony/terrace and luxury four piece en-suite from the rear room, plus a single/study.  A family bathroom completes the first floor accommodation.  To the second floor, there is a further inviting double bedroom with ample inbuilt storage and access to another luxury four piece en-suite bathroom.  To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.LocationThe property is conveniently located within easy access of Hendon, Hendon Central and Colindale stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing excellent cross-London links. There are a variety of shops and amenities within a short distance on The Hyde, as well as a selection of pleasant open spaces including nearby Sunny Hill Park.  Additionally, the site of the Middlesex University is close-by, as well as a number of excellent local schools. A fantastic balance of living space and bedrooms with period features and character throughout. On the ground floor the accommodation comprises a large double reception, downstairs WC and spacious kitchen/diner filled with natural light leading to the wonderful mature garden. The first floor offers a family bathroom and three bedrooms (the pick being the double bedroom at the front of the house with large bay window). The loft has been expertly converted to create the principal bedroom and additional shower-room. Also an abundance of storage throughout the house.South Ealing, Northfields & Ealing Common Stations all within one mile of the property. A range of well regarded schools to choose from locally including Mount Carmel & Little Ealing Primary. Gunnersbury Park is a fantastic local amenity for the whole family to enjoy.

This modern townhouse provides balanced and versatile family accommodation over three floors. On the ground floor the property has a stylish kitchen with space for dining, which leads to a South West facing garden. There is also a garage and off-street parking.On the first floor there is a large reception room and a large main bedroom and a WC. There are three bedrooms  and a modern bathroom and shower room.SituationSituated within 0.5 miles of East Putney Underground Station (zones 2 and 3) on the District Line and within 0.6 miles of Putney overground station (to Waterloo) and also Putney High Street, with a comprehensive selection of shops, bars and restaurants, and Putney Bridge over the River Thames beyond. Putney Heath is 0.6 miles to the south and Wimbledon Common one mile.

A three double bedroom, semi detached Victorian house, organised over two floors. Brought to the market with no onward chain, there is huge opportunity to extend the house to the back, side, loft and even the first floor.South Park Road is a popular tree lined road within the South Park Gardens area. This area has highly sought after schools and a fantastic selection of High Street brand shops, popular restaurants and excellent transport links.

A stunning four-bedroom, chain free Victorian semi-detached family home situated in one of the most sought-after roads in the area close to Hither Green train station and Manor House Gardens.Tucked away on a quiet residential street, this property is part of small collection of properties that have direct views of Manor House Gardens. Measuring 1478 sqft internally, this double stacked bay-fronted Victorian semi has a sunny south-west facing 104ft garden that backs on to Manor Park.This property has undergone a full refurbishment and includes, new double glazed sash windows to the front and back of the property, along with a full rewire, brand-new boiler, kitchen and bathroom.On the ground floor is double-reception room which benefits from high ceilings, two feature fireplaces and lots of natural light. To the rear is the brand-new kitchen/diner, the kitchen units are modern in style, in matt grey, teamed with a white subway tile splash back. Additionally, there is a guest WC, access to the large cellar, and the garden via French doors to the side of the kitchen.The property has four bedrooms and a family bathroom with contemporary white sanitary ware, and an over bath shower. The back bedroom could be a home office and has a unique sunny balcony with views across Manor Park Gardens. A real gem!Hither Green has a variety of local amenities, including popular independent shops, cafes, and restaurants. Blackheath Village is a pleasant 15-minute walk away with an array of fabulous amenities and Blackheath Common. St Margaret’s Primary is a 5-minute walk away from Aislibie Road (rated Outstanding by Ofsted) along with a selection of other 'Good' and 'Outstanding'  Ofsted rated primary schools.With Hither Green and Blackheath stations both equidistant from Aislibie Road (approx 15 minutes’ walk away), there are plenty of options for transport links with trains to London Bridge, Canon Street and Charing Cross. There's also the DLR from Lewisham with services to Canary Wharf and Bank.

An outstanding newly rebuilt and refurbished 1860's freehold live/work warehouse on Havelock Walk, a vibrant, artistic cobbled mews in the heart of bustling Forest Hill. The property, which occupies over 1700 sq/ft, has been completely refurbished throughout to an exemplary, bespoke finish.  This great mews house benefits from spacious, flexible accommodation, dramatic high ceilings, beautiful reclaimed fittings, as well as private outside space. Havelock Walk is an incredibly sought-after private, no-through mews, home to a wide-variety of creative businesses ranging from jewellery-making  through to theatre set design, making this the perfect proposition for a creative, or merely for someone who wants a very unique family home. Forest Hill is a well-connected, leafy enclave with a great choice of independent cafes, bars and restaurants and excellent transport options (London Overground, Rail and bus).

A simply stunning four bedroom terraced house on Lansdowne Road.Modern and minimal this brand new renovation by the current owners has been carefully and lovingly designed to the very highest of standards.  Entering the hallway you are faced with a view of the kitchen extension - a brick archway revealing crittal style doors and a glimpse of the garden. It’s a truly impressive space, wide skylights framing the pitched roof overhead with smooth poured concrete floor below and endless work tops finished in dappled grey with fitted matt white units. The brick wall boasts wide zinc shelves and a rustic zinc cooker, giving a wholesome and industrial feel to the kitchen.  Features such as underfloor heating and a boiling hot water tap ensure this room is kept toasty, even including a wall mount for hanging up your bike on arrival.  It’s a multi-functional and fluid space, perfect for brunches and drinks with friends, spacious and bright for yoga and study time as well as cosy for those rainy afternoons snuggled up inside.  Upstairs the quality of presentation continues, with four spacious bedrooms and two bath/shower rooms evenly spread over the upper floors.  On the first there are two double bedrooms, with wooden floorboards and french style white shutters. The family bathroom is generously proportioned, with a three piece suite including a rainfall shower over the large tub, and solid brass fittings.  The underfloor heating keeping the tiles warm at all times. Then up to the second floor, with a large exposed brick wall and bright skylight overhead.  This floor houses another two double bedrooms, a principal suite comprising double aspect bedroom and shower room.  Both have sash windows looking out over the garden glimpsing the lovely church spire in the distance. Outside, the garden has two seating areas: a paved patio adjacent to the house and decking at the far end, together with lawn and raised border planning.Living Here... - The location of this property is fab - ideal for the morning commute, with Walthamstow Central station a hop, skip and a jump away – Oxford Circus is less than half an hour from the front door, as indeed is Hampstead Heath via Queens Road station.  And if you’re meeting friends, then where better than to head into Walthamstow Village, where there are more bars and eateries than you can shake a stick at, and up to Ravenswood, where the neon is always glowing at God’s Own Junkyard and is home to several breweries where you can sit and drink outside.  The house is right by Hoe St with exceptional pizza at Yard Sale and SoDo and also in proximity to the St James St area with all the culinary experiences at Crate.  If it all gets a get too much, the house is also within a stone’s throw of Thomas Gamuel Park (if you have any canine or feline members of the family they are going to love this house too!), so just relax on a bench in the park and watch the world go by…!In The Owners Words... - “We’ve loved living in this beautiful home in this little pocket of Walthamstow.  Just a 10 minute walk to the Village, with close access to both the Hoe St and St James St areas it's right in the middle of things.  It also only takes 8 minutes to walk the tube, which provides a fantastic balance of life in London.  We enjoy just being in the house: both the bright, open, spacious feeling of the extension and the snuggly hygge vibes in the living room and bedrooms.  Then also the garden with barbecues on the patio, lying out on the grass and gardening, eating, reading or doing yoga out on the decking.  We've also been blessed with a friendly neighbourhood, which has a real community spirit.  We love walking up to the Village with great food at Eat 17, getting the best fish n chips on Orford Rd, and all the other options for eating out; then up to God’s Own Junkyard and all the breweries for a night out, and so many great pizza places with Yard Sale, So Do (Hoe St), and The Italian Bakery (St James St).  Due to the many transport links the whole of London feels at your fingertips.  We regularly swim at Parliament Hill Lido and walk on Hampstead Heath and door to door it only takes 25 minutes from Walthamstow Queens Rd (a huge bonus because of our position in the area).  We enjoy running up to and around Hollow Ponds, the mysterious park where Alfred Hitchcock grew up and also Wanstead Park with it’s lake and grotto, only 10 minutes drive away."Dimensions: - Entrance - Via front door leading into:Entrance Hallway - Staircase leading to first floor. Are you looking for a family home with lots of space?A sizable 1930's link detached family home situated on a great size plot in the residential location of Lee. The property is arranged over three floors, on the ground floor on entering the home is a hallway with doors leading to the main reception rooms. The lounge is of a great size with a bay over looking the front of the home, a feature fireplace provides a focal point to the room , large double doors lead through to the dining room which is an equally good size. Double doors from the dining room lead out to the rear garden.  A hub of any home is the kitchen/ breakfast room, a modern range of units with an arch leading through to a sizable breakfast room. A useful addition is the separate utility room and also a downstairs shower room complete with a steam room.On the first floor there are two double bedrooms, a good size single bedroom and a family bathroom. In addition there is a fourth bedroom which is on the second floor complete with staircase and a view over the rear garden.At the front of the property is a garage and also ample parking for at least four vehicles. At the rear of the home is an enclosed south facing garden mainly laid to lawn with a patio area perfect for BBQ's or lazy weekends in the sunshine. The south facing garden is surrounded by mature trees, shrubs and fencing, fruit-bearing fig, quince, apple trees and raspberries, there is also a greenhouse perfect for growing fruit and vegetables.This property is also being sold with no onward chain.Upwood Road is within easy reach of Lee Station, Grove Park Station and Hither Green Station providing great access links into central London, perfect for commuters. Lee station is within a couple of minutes walk from the property, providing direct access to London Bridge, London Cannon Street and London Charing Cross. Green spaces include Northbrook Park, Sutcliffe Park and Chinbrook Meadows all within easy reach, perfect for those Sunday afternoon strolls.

An immaculately presented home forming part of the landmark Marine Wharf development, which comes complete with residents' gym, 24hr concierge service and onsite parking.  The property is kitted out with the contemporary features you would expect from this development, as well as many features added by the current owners including Rako smart lighting system, in-built speakers to the main rooms and a relaxing Jonathan Mark designed rear garden.  Accommodation is spread over three floors and provides four well proportioned family bathrooms (two being en suite), open-plan kitchen/diner, separate living room and downstairs wc.  Further benefits include a convenient and economical heat recovery ventilation system, 900Mb Full Fibre broadband, CCTV and ADT alarm system.

An exceptional four bedroom, 1930s end of terrace gem, this immaculately presented home is close to great transport links and nestles in the greenery of sought-after Upper Leytonstone. You also have an expertly landscaped rear garden.   You're on a quiet residential street, in a sweet spot for accessing the best that East London has to offer. Enjoy speedy access into town, while having the tranquil greenery of Wanstead Flats at your fingertips. The perfect place to leave the City bustle behind.IF YOU LIVED HEREYou'll be delighted by your light, inviting hallway welcoming you to your breathtaking, open plan, ground floor. Your double reception offers around 245 square feet of contemporary living space where authentic details give a nod to this fine home's origins. A gorgeous 1930's style fireplace teams with sumptuous herringbone parquet flooring for a high-end aesthetic.  Your rear reception area leads to your split-level garden, perfect for entertaining at summer socials.In your splendid kitchen, pristine ivory tiles and matching ceramic flooring contrasts with a wood style countertop that offers a wealth of culinary space. A further rear door offers alternative garden access. Your first three bedrooms are situated on your fabulous first floor. Here, luxurious biscotti carpet gives a cosy feel, while muted ochre, cornflower blue and almond white give a relaxing vibe. Your first of two bathrooms has jade highlights with sleek metro tiles and a chrome tower radiator.Your top floor is a masterclass in expert loft conversion. Here your 190 square feet master suite dazzles with light flooding in from two generous skylights. Copious undereaves storage makes for a tidy and fuss-free space. Your impeccable en suite shower room has crisp white fixtures, with a separate rainfall shower and the palest of pink highlights for some marvellous me-time pampering.Your charming new locale is a destination for high-end restaurant and cafe culture. Five minutes away, heavenly haunt Filly Brook offers draught beer and Japanese snacks for mellow downtime listening to records in their lush outdoor seating area. Famed Francis Road is fourteen minutes stroll for sourdough bread, smoked artisanal meats and bespoke beers. Towards High Road Leytonstone, Luna Lounge is you new destination for live music and local indie shops meet your every need. ??WHAT ELSE??- You're ten minutes from Leytonstone tube for the Central line, whisking you directly to Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes, putting the City around a half hour away door to door. Leyton Midland Road is eight minutes on foot, should you fancy a promenade in the sea air at Southend.- Your new local is the welcoming Heathcote & Star, just four minutes away, with its dog-friendly outlook and leafy beer garden, offering a carefully curated cocktail list and ravishing roasts from the kitchen team at Root Hoof & Claw.- Parents have the choice of no less than fourteen schools rated  ‘Good' or ‘Outstanding' within a mile.Garden - 8m x 7m  (26'2" x 22'11" ) - Hall - Reception Room - 4.17m x 3.60m  (13'8" x 11'9" ) - Reception Room - 3.50m x 2.87m  (11'5" x 9'4" ) - Kitchen - 4.41m x 2.80m  (14'5" x 9'2" ) - Bedroom - 2.38m x 2.33m  (7'9" x 7'7" ) - Bedroom - 4.17m x 2.92m  (13'8" x 9'6" ) - Bedroom - 3.52m x 2.92m  (11'6" x 9'6" ) - Bathroom - 2.36m x 2.31m  (7'8" x 7'6" ) - Bedroom - 5.41m x 3.53m  (17'8" x 11'6" ) - Eaves Storage - Ensuite - A WORD FROM THE OWNER...."We love that we're close to the shops of Francis Road and yet can easily take a walk up to Hollow Ponds and have a beer on the huge outdoor terrace of the Alfred Hitchcock Hotel. Even closer to home are the Heathcote and Star, Solway Society, Gravity Well and an okonomiyaki with a great glass of wine or a craft beer at the Fillybrook. Both the Central line and the Overground are close by for easy access into the centre. Sometimes we'll walk a bit further and buy a fantastic steak from the Ginger Pig and some amazing fruit and veg from Harveys up in Wanstead. It's a great place to run; as well as Hollow Ponds, you can easily run through the Olympic Park and along the canal to Victoria Park. In Leytonstone itself we'll probably miss the excellent dim sum at Panda and the great Sardinian food at Mora the most of all."

A charming Grade II listed Georgian three storey townhouse located in the picturesque Arbour Square. The square is currently laid out as a formal garden with mature trees and planting and is surrounded on two sides by elegant early 19th Century townhouses. Comprising three bedrooms, one family bathroom, space to dine, a light-filled living room and a west facing garden.  The property has been fully extended to the rear creating more internal living space but still benefits from a good size garden. This elegantly presented family home offers period features such as sash windows, high ceilings and a wood burner. The property and square ooze character and the house would be an excellent purchase for a professional couple or family seeking a peaceful location but with quick access to local transport links and amenities. The ground floor comprises a large kitchen to the front of the property leading into the dining area, fantastic for entertaining, to the rear a wonderful full width extension adding to the ground floor living space.  The extension has glass doors that open fully onto the good size west facing low maintenance garden. To the first floor you’ll find the master bedroom with fitted cupboards and a huge family bathroom accommodating a separate bath and shower. The top floor of the property houses two further bedrooms and additional storage.  Within easy reach of Brick Lane and Shoreditch's bars and restaurants, both the City and Canary Wharf are equally accessible. Whitechapel Station (Hammersmith & City, District, Overground, National Rail) and Limehouse (closer) Shadwell DLR are a short walk away and transport links will improve even further with the impending Crossrail extension.

**UNEXPECTEDLY AVAILABLE** If you are looking to house a large family, perhaps with different generations living under one roof then look no further. The current owners extended this 4 bedroom property around 15 years ago to add a 2 storey, self-contained 2 bedroom annexe with its own kitchen-breakfast room, living room, bathroom and entrance. The two sections of the property are connected via a door on the ground floor making it ideal for occupiers wanting independence or perhaps even an Airbnb. We feel there is scope (subject to consent being obtained) to extend and remodel the property further, perhaps with a large kitchen extension to the main property or a loft conversion like the next-door neighbours. The large rear garden is well screened by mature trees, being utilised by both parts of the property. There is space to park 2 cars to the front with the potential to create more parking subject to the usual consents being obtained. It is around 10 minutes (0.5 miles) walk to Eltham station that has frequent services to Charing Cross and Victoria in around half an hour so is ideal for those needing to commute into central London but who want to live in a leafier location.Eltham is located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich, around 3 miles to the east of Blackheath village and just over 4 miles to the south of Greenwich town-centre. There is plenty to do in the vicinity with Eltham Palace, former home of King Henry VIII around 1 mile away. It is described by English Heritage as one of London's best-kept secrets, boasting 19 acres of award-winning gardens. Severndroog Castle is around 1.3 miles away and offers 360-degree views of the city from the Gothic tower. Keen golfers can enjoy the private members-only Royal Blackheath Golf Club just 6 minutes (1.2 miles) away by car or Eltham Warren Golf Club - one of England's oldest 9-hole courses is just 2 minutes away (0.6 miles) by car. Eltham High Street and Westmount Road boast numerous cafes, restaurants, and independent shops. Your young ones' educational needs are well served with a Catholic Primary and Secondary School just 0.2 miles and 0.7 miles away respectively, and an Ofsted outstanding primary school (Eltham C of E ) around 0.4 miles away. Commuters will enjoy the short 10-minute walk to Eltham train station which has frequent services to London Charing Cross and London Victoria in around 30 minutes.Owners Remarks:-This house has been a fabulous family home for over 40 years. We fell in love with it the minute we viewed, with the size of the rooms, high ceilings and general character. Its versatility has worked so well over the years, enabling family and friends to stay over within their own space. We love that the garden offers all day sunshine, seclusion and an array of wildlife. It's a lovely area to live in with a great community spirit. We will be sad to leave and shall certainly miss living here, but in our later years we are now in need of a property that better suits our needs.

We can't get enough of sunny south-facing gardens (and there simply aren't enough of them!); find this low-maintenance one attached to a beautifully-presented two bed bay-fronted Victorian terrace with a separate study. Welcome features throughout the property include stripped floor boards, stripped doors, sash windows, and bespoke shutters to the front windows. We like the wide side return too - an obvious extension project once-in if you fancied it. You could also rework the layout upstairs if you wanted three bedrooms.  The lovely home rests on one of Peckham Rye's principal tree-lined streets within Holly Grove Conservation Area, just a few minutes by foot from Peckham Rye Station (Zone 2), Warwick Gardens, Bellenden Road and Rye Lane. Permit-parking is on-street.  From the hall, it's a right into the double-reception room which stretches over 24 feet. Catch pleasing sight of the garden from the second reception's sash window. Alcove shelving and a period fireplace further impress.  At the foot of the hall you've got your double-aspect kitchen/diner (running over 16 feet) with a generous bank of modern fitted gloss-white units, and a tiled floor. At the foot of the room, painted timber-framed French doors open out to your sun trap status garden. This is decked and paved on two levels, with well-established borders and clever built-in timber seating (which incorporates storage for garden bits/cushions).  Up the stairs and you'll first reach a neat study space with sash window and ceiling-high built-in cupboards/utility to the opposite wall.  Beyond, you've got a classy bathroom with traditionally-styled bathroom suite, over bath shower, on-trend brick-style tiling and recessed lighting.  From the main landing find your twin-sashed master bedroom to the front of the house; it's over 13 feet by over 11 feet. Adjacent is a second double (over 11 feet by over 8 feet) with big sash window to garden views.  Getting around? Walk three minutes to Peckham Rye Station for Overground and regular train services. City-bound buses are also local on nearby Rye Lane (cut through Choumert Grove Car Park for your easiest route here).  Good shops, pubs, cafes and restaurants surround the house. We really like Petitou (for coffee and people-watching) and Review (for a fine read plus a nice chat with Katia). Flock & Herd is a great local butcher too, and The General Store has treats galore!  Local restaurants include some of the tastiest and freshest offerings in London. Some of our favourites are The Begging Bowl, Artusi, Tonkotsu, Peckham Bazaar, Levan, The Coal Rooms, Ganapati, Mr Bao, Good Neighbour and Miss Tapas. Local pubs include The Montpelier, The Prince Albert and The Victoria Inn.  Trendy Peckham Levels, The Market Building, and The Bussey Building & Copeland Park complex are also a brief stroll; Rye Lane also has fruit and veg stalls and handy high street shops, banks and supermarkets.  For more options, central Camberwell and East Dulwich's Lordship Lane are close.  Local schools? Include The Belham (run by Dulwich Educational Trust) and Bellenden, and also The Villa Nursery and Pre-Prep. on Lyndhurst Grove.  Your closest green spaces are Warwick Gardens,  Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres and Goose Green. For more options, Burgess, Ruskin and even Brockwell Parks aren't far.

Located on a quiet residential road in the heart of Tooting Bec, an end of terrace three double bedroom family home with potential to extend STPP.Langroyd Road is one of the most popular roads in Tooting. This award-winning house has such wonderful design details throughout, that you really need to watch our property video to fully appreciate all the care, attention, and quality and then arrange to view this property.You will see that everything throughout this house is designed to fit perfectly making practical use of every space and giving it a sense of flow as you move from room to room and floor to floor.A three-storey dual aspect town house with a sun trap roof terrace on top, open plan second floor living space with fitted double bedrooms and well-appointed bathrooms on both the ground and first floors and a utility room.The architect Adam Howard has created a stylish house, the facade has a projecting section over three floors, oversized high performance feature windows and a huge wooden plank finished door. Internally he has used a pallet of materials, natural oak, light tones of grey and raw steel along with bespoke joinery solutions throughout. Lots of light from large windows and a retractable glass roof, that provides access to the roof terrace on top of the building. The sliding glass rooflight box is motorised controlled be a secure pad and has a rain sensor, which closes when it starts to rain.Wooden floors throughout, a bespoke fitted open plan kitchen that has a perfectly designed window in place of a worktop splashback which slides open to provide access to the bespoke window box herb garden and wider views of the treetops beyond. Full height interior doors with stylish ironmongery fittings that add to the overall quality of the design and feel and compliment the relentless joinery.Both bedrooms have extensive fitted wardrobes and storage space, wall mounted flat screen televisions and reading lights as well as recessed fitted night and day curtains.Both bathrooms have white sanitaryware, good quality tiling complemented by bespoke joinery vanity units and lighting.The three oak staircases have downlit handrails, the top staircase leads via the impressive glass opening onto the third-floor roof terrace of 10 square metres. The deck has panoramic views as well as up lights and downlighting so great for entertaining or relaxing day or night.Carefully located subtle and versatile high quality modern LED lighting which highlight architectural features with recessed strip lights and spotlights and high-quality fittings.Some other unique features include the three-story window that provides light in the entrance the first-floor landing and forms the back of the fitted desk in the open plan living room. The cantilevered piece of furniture that floats above the living room floor providing a shelf for your television and a little screen to the fitted desk and staircase beyond.On the ground floor there is a utility room complete with appliances, the boiler, more storage shelves, and cupboards.This building is constructed in blockwork with some parts in a steel frame and benefits from a Professional Consultants Certificate, it was completed in 2019.A well-insulated dwelling with solar heated hot water and an EPC rating of B. This town house is in a private gated community, once entirely commercial, now a mix of residential property and commercial units. This location and the area have lots of links to the art world. The immediate area is a mix of Hackney Wick with its new apartments, businesses, restaurants, and bars and the three wide open spaces of Victoria Park, Hackney Marshes and The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, with Here East and numerous sporting and leisure facilities.

Occupying an attractive corner plot, next to the beautiful square, this lovely home is in immaculate condition throughout, having been refurbished by the current owners to an exceptional standard.  The ground floor has a bright  living space with a separate seating and dining area.  The kitchen has a wealth of built-in units and quality appliances. There is a very useful cloakroom/utility room tucked under the stairs.
