An impeccably appointed five double bedroom Victorian mid terrace in central Leyton. Here you're located on a tree-lined street with the social hub of Francis Road minutes away and the transport links of Leyton tube within easy reach. Your rear garden's south-east facing for a sunny disposition, and that's not the only natural space around. Coronation Gardens are a seven minute stroll, with Leyton Jubilee Park a stretch further. Head in the opposite direction for Wanstead's endlessly explorable great green expanse and you'll forget you're in London.IF YOU LIVED HEREYou'll be dazzled by the unequivocally exquisite and expertly realised interior design at play here. From the strikingly stained dark timber floorboards and intricate ceiling moulding that greet you in the hallway, to the beautiful exposed brick design nestled in the penthouse, this is a home with attention to detail poised to delight at every turn. Your 135 square foot front reception's a fine introduction with its bay window framing a leafy street vista and glossy wooden boards underfoot.Next door, past a WC with an on-trend luxury wallpaper feature wall, and you'll find the heart of your new home - your impossibly refined 500 square foot kitchen/diner. The kitchen comes with a chef's oven and contemporary black and brass suite of cabinets with matching pendulum lights over the breakfast bar. Deeper into the dual aspect space and a lightwell plus recessed spotlights in single file illuminate the room, while bi-folding floor to ceiling patio doors throw open the entire space to the garden.Step out here for natural effect Trulawn dotted with mature, ivy-adorned foliage; an ideal spot for soaking up the sunshine. Back inside, past the hallway (and access to the eighty five square foot cellar) and up the stairs you'll find three impeccable double bedrooms, the largest just as suitable for use as yet more sociable space. The family bathroom's an elegant affair with a rainfall shower over the clawfoot tub, gorgeous jade tiling and vintage fixtures and fittings, while head up to the second floor for another immaculate double bedroom to the rear. Lastly, your 230 square foot principal bedroom, a vision in exposed brick, rooftop views and a boutique chic en suite, is frankly a residence in itself.Outside and Leyton tube station is seven minutes on foot to whisk you into central London in less than half an hour door-to-door via the Central Line. Here you're also just one stop away from Stratford for the mega mall that is Westfield. Or hop on to the Overground at Leytonstone High Road for the Gospel Oak to Barking line, a mere thirteen minute walk away. Just around the corner is our go-to spot of Francis Road, a popular part-pedestrianised destination bursting with independent stores and eateries, while our up-and-coming Grove Green Road hub is half a mile away. Look out for newcomer Arch Deli.WHAT ELSE?- Kids have a choice of twenty primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Newport Primary is five minutes' walk.- Your new abode is chain free, so we can get you in with minimal fuss.- Fancy a filling breakfast or leisurely brunch? Head to Figo around the corner on Leyton High Road for a Full English, a toasted salmon bagel or mushrooms and fried egg on toast. All washed down with a strong coffee served in fine China crockery.Garden - 11.6m x 5.5m (38'0" x 18'0") - Side Return - 4m x 1.45m (13'1" x 4'9") - Utility/ Storage - 1.79m x 5.44m  (5'10" x 17'10" ) - Hall - Reception Room - 3.34m x 4.15m  (10'11" x 13'7" ) - Wc - Kitchen/ Lounge/ Diner - 4.80m x 10.70m  (15'8" x 35'1" ) - Bedroom - 5.10m x 4.15m  (16'8" x 13'7" ) - Bedroom - 3.35m x 3.45m  (10'11" x 11'3" ) - Bathroom - 2.54m x 1.72m  (8'3" x 5'7" ) - Bedroom - 3.48m x 3.35m  (11'5" x 10'11" ) - Bedroom - 4.08m x 5.21m  (13'4" x 17'1" ) - Eaves Storage - Ensuite - Bedroom - 3.22m x 3.17m  (10'6" x 10'4" ) - A WORD FROM THE EXPERT......."Leyton is a well-hidden gem that people haven’t yet fully explored. Francis Road is one of area’s most celebrated spots and it never disappoints. It’s buzzing with cafés, delis, shops and restaurants — the perfect afternoon or weekend destination. The Olympic Park is just around the corner, great for all the amazing concerts, sporting events and festivals that are held there all year round.Getting into central London couldn’t be any easier, with Leyton Midland overground station as well as the Central underground line both right on the doorstep.KENAN KRKICE10 SENIOR SALES ADVISOR

Uniquely Charming Three Bedroom Victorian Home With Pretty Garden and City Views - CHAIN FREE.Over three delightful floors, this elegantly presented three bedroom period home is awash with sympathetic styling, quirky features and wonderfully bright accommodation. The current owners have lovingly augmented the house over 30 years to include a spectacular open plan first floor living area, three double bedrooms (two of which can be made into one huge space), a super slick shower room and wc. A cute, sunny rear garden and tiptop flat roof with electric skylight access and stunning views of the city are the cherries on the cake. We're sure you're going to love it! Fielding Street, whilst supremely convenient, boasts numerous, similarly quaint period homes. The area leaves you within easy walking distance of Camberwell, Walworth Road and the very lovely Burgess Park.Freshly painted period railings introduce the property. There are entrances on the upper and lower ground floor levels. Heading upward you meet an original door in vibrant pink, with frosted panes and brass knocker set . The inner hall greets you warmly with pretty cornicing, wooden flooring and some stunning designer wallpaper on the risers of the original staircase. The hall leads left to a handy spot for coats and brollies. A seamless laundry cupboard enjoys some particularly dishy floral designs. The front facing double bedroom has a wide original sash window, coving and more quality wooden flooring. A recessed sliding door saves on space. Opposite this, facing rear over the garden, is the salubrious shower room where funky teal flooring and a swanky double shower make for the perfect pamper parlour. The fixtures and fittings are matt black and there's a trough-style wash hand basin and contemporary loo. Heading upward to the first floor you find a most wonderful open plan reception/kitchen which enjoys light from all directions. Twin sash windows to both front and rear and four contemporary skylights create a magically airy and bright space to lounge, dine, entertain and cook. The kitchen is well stocked and contemporary with composite counters and dark brown cabinets. A bespoke steel staircase with oak treads leads daintily upward to the flat roof which is accessed through a nifty electric vertical glass door. From there you can spy the pretty local chimney pots and fantastic sweeping views as far as Canary Wharf! The lower ground floor hosts two further double bedrooms, ingeniously separated by a floating mirrored wall. The front room has direct access via stairs that lead up to the street. The rear room, presented in burnt Mexican Orange, offers garden access through double doors. A neat wc completes this level and there is further garden access on the lower return. Transport options are numerous with a multitude of buses whizzing up and down Walworth Road to all corners of town – you can catch a bus to Victoria, Whitehall, West End, Euston and Kings Cross, City, London Bridge and Borough Market. Trains to the City are a mere 6 minutes and the tube at Elephant & Castle or Kennington will take you direct to the city and into the West End. Head down Camberwell New Road for more options at Oval Tube. There's a host of shops within easy walking distance including a Marks & Spencer’s - that's dinner sorted. Walworth Road has a number of convenience stores for fresh fruit and veg, a post office and numerous banks – that’s everything covered. Camberwell has a host of bars and eateries - we love the Crooked Well, The Hermits Cave and The Camberwell Arms. Burgess Park is a short walk if you fancy a stroll.

Set in a popular turning off Nether Street, within easy access to local amenities, West Finchley underground (Northern line) station and Outstanding Ofsted Rated Moss Hall Primary School, we are pleased to offer this well-presented semi-detached family home which has been extended throughout to create ample living space. Dishy two double bedroom Victorian terraced house, with a low-maintenance west-facing part-walled garden, directly opposite Lucas Gardens; lovely views of which can be lapped up from the property's master bedroom. There is clear potential to extend the characterful property - either up in the loft (which currently offers lots of storage space), over the side return, or both!  The location's a desirable residential street which is close to central Camberwell and Peckham too - walk just 10 minutes to Denmark Hill Station, and 14 to Peckham Rye Station. Permit-parking is on-street.  The house has been carefully renovated and improved over the current owner's long occupancy, delivering many welcome features, including stripped floors, period fireplaces and custom-made storage.  A walled front garden fronts the house. In the front door and your wooden-floored double-reception rests to your left. This extends over 22 feet. The front sash window has plantation shutters, which offer privacy (and look great as well!). There's built-in storage to one alcove and a delightful period fireplace. The second reception space has pro-papered walls, and glazed double doors which open out to the side-return area of the garden.  Back to the hall and past the handy under stairs cupboard and you'll find the double-aspect kitchen/dining room, with a practical tiled floor, and which stretches over 21 feet. The timeless fitted kitchen leads to a natural dining space - with delightful garden views and a sunny orientation. Designer wallpaper again features, plus a back door out to the garden.  The easy and established garden has been professionally landscaped and has a handy little outhouse off the back of the house.  Up to the half-landing and you'll find a large and double-aspect full bathroom, with both bath and independent walk-in shower. Built-in storage further impresses, as does a stylish heated towel rail. A couple of welcome storage cupboards (one a large boiler room; the other a slim cupboard) are found on the half-landing outside the bathroom.  From the landing proper, you have your first double bedroom, of over 10 feet by over 9 feet, with a cute original feature fireplace.  Finally, find the master bedroom to the front of the house. Twin sash windows provide leafy park vistas over Lucas Gardens. What a treat in Zone 2! Generous built-in closets, another fireplace and alcove storage tick more boxes.  St. Giles Church and Churchyard are utterly lovely local landmarks, and you're also close to South London Gallery, plus Camberwell's iconic art college buildings. It's a very nice part of town. Beyond Lucas Gardens, you've got lots of other green spaces around and about - Brunswick, Ruskin and Burgess Parks for example, and Lettsom and Warwick Gardens too. Peckham Rye Park and Common and Brockwell Park and Lido aren't far either.  Local schools include Lyndhurst Primary and The Villa Nursery and Pre-Prep. School.  Restaurants, cafes, pubs and bars are strong and varied round this way. We particularly like The Camberwell Arms (more than a pub - the restaurant offering is delicious), Grove House Tavern, The Crooked Well, Silk Road and Theo's. Walk to Peckham's Bellenden Road and Rye Lane for other excellent offerings - including Artusi, Ganapati, Levan, Peckham Levels and The Bussey Building, plus handy high street shops, pop-ups and markets.  Butterfly Tennis Club and Zen Yoga studio are also nearby, on Camberwell Grove, as well as the Victorian leisure centre with big pool, gym and classes. You are close to two Fare Zone 2 stations as previously mentioned, and also to a host of day and night bus routes at the foot of the street, from Camberwell Church Street. For more options, Peckham, Herne Hill, Dulwich Village, East Dulwich, Brixton and New Cross are all easily reached. Fascinating fact... interestingly, the pioneer radiologist Dr F S Pepperdene once lived in the house - feel free to ask us for more details.

This Victorian mid-terraced home has been renovated to an exceptional standard and features three double bedrooms, an elegant family bathroom, cosy living room, separate formal dining room, and a gorgeous open plan kitchen/diner with solid oak parquet flooring, concrete worktops, and exposed brickwork. Three enormous skylights and bi-fold doors open out to the west-facing garden, which receives sunlight throughout the day, in the unique, architect-designed side return extension. The inside has been tastefully designed that match the house's vintage charm with a modern twist. This peaceful, tree-lined neighbourhood is just a short walk from Queens Road, which has recently seen a lot of redevelopment. Under the arches at Queens Road Peckham station, a new selection of restaurants, pubs, cafes, shops, and convenience stores has opened, including the Michelin-starred Bib Gourmand restaurant Kudu and its sister bar Smokey Kudu. Your closest hangouts are Beer Rebellion, Peckham Cellars, The Prince of Peckham, and the new restaurant Naifs. Sainsbury's is also right around the corner. Every day, new places open their doors. Notting Hill Trust is currently working on a number of regeneration and infrastructural projects, including the construction of 300 new houses, which will be completed in 2021. The proposed Bakerloo line station at Asylum Road is soon to improve the area. Queens Road is one of the local transportation options. Peckham Station (Zone 2), which provides rapid, direct connections to London Bridge, Canada Water, and Clapham Junction, is less than a half-mile away, as is Peckham Rye Station (also Zone 2), which provides direct connections to Victoria, the City, and Kings Cross St Pancras.There are also excellent bus connections to Central London, the City, Waterloo, Elephant & Castle, and Greenwich - as well as to surrounding shopping, entertainment, and other amenities, which are made even easier by the proximity of Rye Lane and Camberwell. The Peckham Library, Peckham Levels, and the Peckham Pulse Leisure Centre are all within walking distance. Bright and welcoming three double bedroom flat-fronted Victorian terrace, with a deep south-west facing rear garden (hello sunshine!) - which extends over 55 feet. Parking is unrestricted on the street. Freehold.  Find the handsome home on a quiet, tree-lined residential street in Nunhead, close to Nunhead's high street and Nunhead Green Conservation Area. You're also close to all things Peckham.  Station-wise... you have Queens Road Peckham, Nunhead and Peckham Rye all within easy walking distance (walk eight, nine and 12 minutes respectively). All are Fare Zone 2.  A neat front garden graces the front of the house. You open directly into an opened-up double reception room of over 22 feet by over 15 feet. Wooden floors and alcove storage, plus plantation shutters to lower window panes (in the front reception space) all impress. There's an under stairs cupboard for coats and such, and next to this you open into the generous double-aspect kitchen/diner - which runs over 22 feet with a fully-tiled floor. The fitted kitchen is a modern style with plenty of units and worktop space.  Access the garden via a back door here (extension potential alert), onto a paved area - ideal for al fresco meals - which leads to a generous lawn. Beyond is a raised deck with shed (which is staying).  Up the stairs and from the half-landing, find your windowed bathroom and separate w.c. (modern white sanitary ware in both) to your left, and at the rear of the house is your first double bedroom, of 8 feet by over 8. Garden vistas are enjoyed from the window here.  From the main landing, you've got your second bedroom on your left - of over 10 feet by over 9 feet, and a delightful master bedroom of over 15 feet by nearly 11 feet - with built-in closets running one entire wall, two double-glazed windows, and a dark green hue to the walls.  What's local? Central Nunhead has excellent independent staples: Ayre's bakery and FC Soper wet fish shop, for example. Strong establishments to eat include Four Hundred Rabbits, The Old Nun's Head and Kudu Grill (all are on Nunhead Lane itself). And Peckham Bazaar on nearby Consort Road is close for pan-Balkan cuisine and a wonderful wine list.  The Bussey Building & Copeland Park complex, plus Peckham Levels and Market Building are also just a short walk from your door - for the trendiest of eateries, drinkeries, plays, exhibitions and the like (don't miss the rooftop bars in the warm months). We like Tonkotsu for Ramen, and Forza Wine particularly. The triangle at the end of Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres is also awash with places to eat, drink and hang out; Good Neighbour, Mr Bao, Banh Banh and Voodoo Ray's being a handful. Bellenden Road, Choumert Road, Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane dish up more food and drink options; we especially like Miss Tapas, Artusi, Levan, Il Giardino, The Begging Bowl and Ganapati. Camberwell, New Cross and Deptford are also no great distance by bus, cycle or foot.  Kids or thinking of? Local schools include Edmund Waller, Ivydale, Oakdale, Rye Oak and St Mary Magdalene C of E primaries. Banana Moon Day Nursery on Machell Road is also close.

A superb two bedroom apartment with shared garden on Milner Square. Oxford Circus can be reached within 4 stops, National Rail links to Old Street and Moorgate, and London Overground connects to East and South London. Canary Wharf can be easily accessed by taking the London Overground towards Stratford International and changing onto the Jubilee line.Angel Station is approximately 1km walk and on the Bank Branch of the Northern Line. Moorgate, Bank/Monument and London Bridge are all within 4 stops, and Kings Cross, with its extensive links to the rest of London, is one stop away.Square Footage: 10,204 sq ftLeasehold with approximately 85 years remaining.

This spacious and elegant Edwardian terrace has just under 1,700 Square feet of internal accommodation. The current owners have lived there for many years and maintained it in good order. The rear garden measures 61ft long and is comprised of a lovely patio area leading to lawn, providing a great space for the family to enjoy.

This delightful four-bedroom home offers a vast amount of space which has been tastefully developed into the loft, allowing plenty of room for a larger family or those needing extra areas for hobbies or work.Bay windows offer lots of natural light to all rooms, while the stained-glass feature windows and fireplace add style and character to main reception and bedrooms.Situated in a popular residential the house is beautifully decorated in clean, neutral, colours with wooden flooring throughout, allowing room for any new owners to put their personal stamp on their home while showing off its traditional hallmarks.With plenty of kerb appeal, thanks to a large driveway suitable for parking up to three cars and an arched porchway, this house invites any visitor with its sense of space.The large downstairs reception areas provide everything needed for family meals or entertaining friends.  The modern kitchen opens into the mature and secluded gardens, which benefit from a covered patio and outdoor cooking area.  A large outhouse/shed and detached garage add further flexible use opportunities. The next two stories offer four large bedrooms, three on the first floor with a family bathroom - complete with freestanding roll top bath and separate shower - and a loft bedroom with its own en-suite wet room and capacious loft areas for storage and seating.This is a property with plenty to offer any home buyer looking for character, style and ease of maintenance alongside the perfect location for almost any purpose. LOCATION  Sheringham Avenue is a popular location in a prime residential area with plenty of choice when it comes to excellent schools, transport, restaurants, supermarkets, leisure facilities and much more.Oakwood Tube Station is a few minutes' walk away and offers regular trains on all routes along the Piccadilly line. Winchmore Hill is nearby and on the Great Northern Railway Line offering further transport links to the capital and beyond.Further transport links include the A110, A10 and A1 which are within an easy drive while bus routes travelling regularly to and from the area are within easy access.There is also an incredible selection of schools including nursery, primary and secondary - all within easy access thanks to the excellent transport systems.Osidge School has also had good ratings with high scores for creating a harmonious community while St Andrews Southgate, with a maximum roll of 210 pupils, prides itself on its close, supportive and inclusive community.Ashmole Academy is an unashamedly academic secondary school, with a proud record of excellent GCSE and A-Level results.  Similarly, nearby Southgate School provides a strong, dynamic education offering state-of-the-art facilities for the Arts, Sport and IT, as well as a vibrant Sixth Form centre.Denominational schools include Wolfson Hillel - a Jewish Primary School which originally opened in 1992 and is now a two-form entry nursery and primary academy with a maximum pupil roll of 480. Also nearby is West Grove Primary School - a multi-cultural, multi-faith school is situated in a new building which has been purpose designed with colourful, bright, classrooms as well as a library, art, music and drama rooms. It has received a 'good' provider rating from Ofsted.Outdoor space in the location of this property is also readily available, with a selection of parks offering a range of areas to explore all year round. Oakwood Park offers its own playground facilities making it ideal for families with children while Grovelands Park is popular for all ages.Add the choice of shopping and leisure facilities available within a short distance, there is something for everyone in this area - probably why houses that become available in this postcode are rarely on the market for very long.

A well-presented and recently rennovated Grade II listed, two-bedroom house situated on the Duchy of Cornwall estate, overlooking the prestigious Courtenay Square and in the heart of Kennington. The house is situated on the edge of the square and the entrance is on the side. As you enter the house you will find the reception room on the right, and the kitchen and dining room on the left.The reception room is a charming space enjoying views of the square. There is space for an L-shaped sofa, coffee table, and additional free-standing storage. The dining room enjoys French doors leading out onto the garden and a smart tiled floor. There is space for a large dining table and chairs, and there is also a large storage cupboard in the corner. The kitchen is extremely modern and stylish in design, with white gloss cabinets and plenty of worktop space. There is also an integrated double oven, electric hob with extractor fan above, dishwasher, fridge/freezer and washing machine. At the back of the kitchen is a shower room and W.C.  The first floor consists of two double bedrooms with storage. Between the two bedrooms is a beautifully finished bathroom with a large walk-in shower, W.C., sink with storage below and vanity mirror above, and a heated towel rail.It is worth noting that the dining room, kitchen and downstairs bathroom all benefit from having underfloor heating.The garden, accessed from both the kitchen and dining room, is a charming space enjoying complete privacy, offering the perfect place for relaxing and alfresco dining.Location:Courtenay Square is a delightful square located just off Kennington Lane. A good selection of local shops, bars and restaurants can be found nearby.Directions:Vauxhall Overground /Underground Stations are approximately 0.6 miles away (Victoria Line & National Rail). Kennington Underground Station (Northern Line – both branches) is only 0.5 miles away. In addition, there are numerous bus routes nearby, which offer easy access to Central London and beyond.

A beautifully presented Four Double Bedroom, Two bathroom 1930's Blay house with off street parking, South Facing Garden and views towards the All England Tennis Ground. This is an ideal family home, perfectly positioned for Cannon Hill Common and transport links from Raynes Park, Motspur Park and Morden.  As you enter the property there is a spacious entrance hall, superb open plan kitchen/dining/family room with bi folding doors on to a South facing garden.  On the first floor there are three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The loft has also been converted creating a fantastic master bedroom with balcony and en-suite shower room.

Enjoying its position on this desirable road located within the sought-after ‘Salmon Street’ Estate is this lovely and attractive residence. Charming three bed Victorian Freehold terrace with south-facing garden plus roof terrace (which sits off the third bedroom), on one of Peckham's loveliest - and most requested - streets, within Holly Grove Conservation Area. Walk just four minutes to Peckham Rye Station, and you're closer still to Bellenden Road. Chain free.  A walled front garden sets you back from the pavement. Once in, a generous reception room sits to the right of the hall. In here, find a big bay window, pale walls, an opened-up fireplace, and stripped floors. Adjacent is a dining room of over 11 feet by over 8. It's currently used as a fourth bedroom (this works well as you've dining space beyond the kitchen). Passing the neat under stairs w.c. to your left, the kitchen and breakfast room lie ahead. The fitted kitchen area has white units and windows to the side return area, and is 16 feet by over 7. Beyond this is a casual, double-aspect dining space of 9 feet by over 7, with French doors onto the delightfully-sunny and split-level rear garden. The part-walled garden's relaxed and low-maintenance by design.  Up to the first floor and to the rear of the house you have a small double bedroom with French doors onto a generous and paved roof terrace. Next door is the property's bathroom, with simple white suite, over bath shower, and large square window. Up to the main landing area and you have a double bedroom off to your left (over 11 feet by over 8 feet, with sash to garden views), and the master bedroom across the front with two sash windows (this room's nearly 14 feet by over 11). Stripped floors feature in here, and a Victorian feature fireplace looks great between the alcoves.  Walk just a couple of minutes west to meet with Bellenden Road for cute and useful shops alongside restaurants and cafes. We like Flock & Herd, Review, Artusi, Ganapati and The Begging Bowl especially. This locale is well-loved by locals and visitors alike. Local pubs include The Montpelier, The Victoria Inn and The Prince Albert. Loads more social and shopping options are found on Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane - including The Bussey Building and Copeland Park, Peckham Levels, Levan and The Coal Rooms. Local green spaces include Warwick Gardens, Lettsom Gardens, and Peckham Rye Park and Common. Local schools include The Belham and Bellenden Primaries, and The Villa Nursery and Pre-Preparatory School (ages 2 through to 7) is local - on Lyndhurst Grove.  Peckham Rye station is a mere and pleasant four minute walk, with direct services to Victoria, London Bridge and Thameslink stations. You've also got London Overground trains, so all London commutes and adventures are easily achieved.

To the rear of the garden, accessible via side access, is the garage which is ideal for storage or off-street parking.To the first floor we find three bedroom and family bathroom. Both double bedrooms provide mirrored built-in wardrobes.Finally, to the second floor, within the converted loft space is the 230sq ft master bedroom, accompanying bathroom complete with walk-in shower, WC and hand-basin. There is also a plethora of storage within the eaves.Wanstead is well served with quality local schools; you have twelve primary/secondaries in a one mile radius alone, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Wanstead Church School is less than a quarter mile on foot.The wild wide open green space of Epping Forest is just a third of a mile on foot. Stroll through the greenery and you come to Hollow Ponds, where you can hire row boats and explore the waterways in the company of friendly ducks.Heading to the West End? Wanstead station will whisk you to Tottenham Court Road in twenty five minutes.

This fantastic 4-bedroom period family home, with a generous west facing garden is located in the heart of Honor Oak, moments from the high street, Honor Oak Park station and popular primary schools .Providing just under 1500ft2 (150m2) of flexible living space, you enter through the front door and there is a private front reception room to your right with squared bay window. Behind this you have the rear reception room and double doors leading out into the garden. There is also a downstairs WC and then a good sized modern fitted kitchen with units down one side and a fabulous bay window to your right. The garden is generous, extending to 36' and is west facing.  There is also a 24' cellar providing ample storage space.On the first floor there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom/WC. There is a further double bedroom on the second floor. The loft void has been partially redeveloped to provide eaves storage. The property can be extended on both the ground floor and into the rear roof slope on the second floor to provide further accommodation if required and create an even larger house, STPP and the usual consents.Honor Oak Park is much sought after due to is community feel and great transport links into all parts of London. The station is a mere 5-minute walk from where there are services into London Bridge (in around 12 minutes) as well as Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington, and southwards to Croydon. The area's amenities include coffee shops, a deli, a beauty salon, and several highly-rated restaurants including a hip pizzeria (Mamma Dough), an award-winning Indian (Babur), a popular Italian (Le Querce) and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For groceries, there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local along the high street. There are several places for an evening drink including Grounds and Grapes and the Brockley Jack where there is also a small theatre. The nearest primary school is the highly-rated Stillness. The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields at the top of which are panoramic views of the London skyline.

NEW TO THE MARKET is this well presented Edwardian terraced property, offering a total of 1301 sq ft of internal living accommodation that is situated on a quiet, tree-lined residential road within the Dollis Hill Estate.  The property presents a fantastic opportunity to acquire a substantial family home moments from Gladstone Park. The Ground Floor offers a pragmatic and spacious arrangement, comprised of a double reception/dining room at the front and a spacious kitchen/diner area at the rear. Owing to a skylight, this space is abundant in light throughout the day. There is a downstairs W.C/shower room on this floor. The double reception room retains a number of original Edwardian architectural features, including ceiling cornicing and an ornate fireplace frame. The entrance hallway also boasts original ceramic tessellated tiling. The First Floor is comprised of three bedrooms. The first and second bedrooms are sizeable, whilst the third could be used as a home office space. These rooms are all serviced by a family bathroom on this floor. The Second Floor offers one further bedroom, in addition to an abundance of eaves storage. Geary Road is a quiet, tree-lined residential street nestled within the coveted Dollis Hill Estate. The house is moments from Gladstone Park and ideally positioned to access the amenities of Willesden Green. Local transport links include Dollis Hill (Jubilee). Early viewing is highly recommended.

If someone was asked to build a property for a thoroughly modern occupier, this would be the ultimate design.Turning into the large gated driveway, flanked by an attractive storage area, there are few people who could deny a very positive first impression.Aluminium frame windows and external doors and floor to ceiling glass either side of the main entrance on the ground floor, give an immediate taste of good things to come - and a dramatic impact from the outset.Access to this very desirable property is through a large driveway which is flanked by a modern and secure storage area. Once inside, choose to go down to the lower ground floor with its massive 800 sq ft of space, which houses a large open plan kitchen and living area, ensuite bedroom, utility area guest WC and two outdoor private patios - or up, to two large bedrooms, also both ensuite with the master encompassing a large balcony.Downstairs, the clean, grey steel, lines of the kitchen units are neat, tidy and exceptionally efficient. Coupled with the utility area, this space houses everything that is needed for day-to-day household chores. Bifold doors from the reception area lead out to a stylish patio area, entirely secluded thanks to high end walls and fencing, retaining the luxury of total privacy! Flexible spacing allows for a choice of use and ease of maintenance thanks to the clean lines and understated but classy décor.The en-suite bedroom on this floor also has access through bifold doors to a similarly secluded patio area, offering an opportunity for a completely different outdoor experience. A restful start to each morning with coffee and breakfast in the open air perhaps?Moving up to the first floor and two further double bedrooms, also complete with high-end en-suite facilities, offer equal desirability.  One provides access to a 25ft wide balcony, again through bifold doors, with the other room offering different qualities with a large eaves space.The floor to ceiling glass in the rooms bring nature into the home, providing exceptional light and space to create a very special ambience.This unique property is a one-off and provides a chance for a discerning purchase to own something truly unique and eye-catching. Situated in one of Bounds Green's most popular residential areas, this home exudes style and charisma. It has a personality of its own; bright, light, clever and perfectly considered in all aspects. LOCATION  This property is situated in a location that is ideally suited to all kinds of needs - from transport links and shopping facilities to schools, open spaces and leisure opportunities.Travelling to and from the capital is straightforward as both Bowes Park BR station - on the Southern Railway service - and Bounds Green tube (Piccadilly line) are within a very short walking distance. There are also plentiful bus routes with regular services in and out of the area and the A406, North Circular Road, is also nearby.A variety of schools for all ages are easily accessible from Goring Road. Bounds Green and Bowes Primary schools within a half mile. Both have excellent ratings with parents and students alike and good ratings from OFSTED.St Martin of Porres is a one form entry Catholic school, having one class of children for each of the seven year groups in the primary range of 5 - 11 years.  It also has a nursery class of 3 - 4 year old children.  Trinity Primary Academy, Garfield Primary and St Michaels are also very accessible and all claim to offer a safe, stimulating and supportive atmosphere where children can succeed.When it comes to secondary education, Broomfield School is very close to this property. It is a small community school with a family atmosphere, dedicated to helping children to reach their full potential.St Thomas More Catholic School is rated as outstanding by OFSTED and is a mixed, independent Academy within the Cardinal Hume Academies Trust.  Although it is a church school, it welcomes applications from those of other faiths or no faith who share the school's ethos and values.  With a capacity of 1200 students, including Sixth Form, it claims to be large enough to be able to offer a diverse curriculum whilst maintaining a focus of the progress of the individual.For those seeking the outdoors there are plenty of open spaces within short distances including Bluebell Wood, just across the A406, White Hart Lane recreation ground and Bromfield and Arnos Parks.There is also no shortage of restaurants, pubs, leisure facilities, supermarkets and shops to ensure all lifestyle needs are met in the local area.To organise an accompanied viewing, please contact our sales team at your earliest opportunity to avoid potential disappointment.

Strike is pleased to present this LARGE, FOUR BEDROOM Victorian property in a sought-after location!  This spacious bright property offers plenty of light and space with high ceilings and period features. Spanning over three floors with four double bedrooms, there is natural hardwood floors throughout and feature fireplaces that can be used! You will not be disappointed upon entering the property with the abundance of space and a pleasant garden with a green park across the road at the front of the property for walking and enjoying sunny days.  Comprising of an entrance hall, a large living-dining space with a bright bay window, a fully fitted kitchen with tiled flooring and access to the rear garden. The first floor accommodates three double bedrooms and the main bathroom that has a claw foot tub for soaking. On the top floor, there is a larger than usual fourth bedroom that can be changed into two bedrooms as it was before and an ensuit. The property is conveniently located within a short walking distance to Stratford International, West Ham and Plaistow Underground Stations providing overground, cross rail, DLR, Jubilee, District, and Hammersmith & City lines. There are also convenient bus routes located within the proximity of the property with the A12 and A13 short drives away for links into London and the rest of Essex and surrounding areas. City Airport is also close by with Stratford Westfield Shopping centre a stones throw away. The property further benefits from on-street parking via residents permit. Viewing highly recommended to appreciate the potential on offer.

GUIDE PRICE £900,000 - £970,000A well presented three bedroom family home offering two reception rooms, kitchen, downstairs cloakroom, three bedrooms and a bathroom. Outside provides a detached garage, off road parking, side and rear access to spacious rear garden. The building has planning permission for a two story side extension and a single story rear extension. West Norwood mainline station is located less than 0.5 mile and Streatham Common and the Rookery is just under a mile.

A beautifully presented and unique two bedroom, three storey house with gated access located just off Merton Road, SW18. This fantastic house benefits from spacious accommodation throughout and access to a private patio garden and private roof terrace. Arranged over three floors the property is approximately 1300 sq ft and is in excellent condition throughout. The ground floor comprises of a large kitchen diner, an extensive reception room which opens onto the South-West facing patio garden and a guest cloakroom. There is a spacious lower ground floor room to the property which could be used a second reception, study or cinema room. On the second floor you have two double bedrooms with large built in wardrobes and two bathrooms (both en-suite), as well as access to the substantial west-facing roof terrace. The property is accessed through a gated private shared driveway on Merton Road. It is well situated for all of the amenities of Wandsworth and the excellent selection of shops, bars and restaurants of the nearby Putney and Southfields. It is served by the District Line tube stations of Southfields and East Putney as well as the overground station of Wandsworth Town. For the motorist there is easy access to the A3 making it an ideal location for getting into central London and the South. An early viewing of this unique property is highly recommended.

Enviably located in this peaceful street, is this charming Victorian house with accommodation spaciously arranged over two floors. Offering elegant proportions and huge potential to extend. Composed of a reception hall, two reception rooms, a fitted kitchen and dining room, access to a tranquil good-sized garden. The upper floor traditionally is comprised of three bedrooms and family bathroom with the current owner installing a kitchen in the rear bedroom for their own needs. Located close to vibrant Chatsworth Road, transport links including Homerton Overground station and the leafy green spaces of Millfield’s Park and the Marshes. Excellent choice of primary and secondary schools. Offered with no forward chain.

We are delighted to offer to the market this four bedroom family home set over three floors with off-street parking and south-westerly garden.The accommodation is filled with natural light throughout, on the ground floor comprising separate reception room, large dining room/kitchen and WC. Stunning landscaped south-westerly sun trapped garden to enjoy. The first floor affords three bedrooms (two doubles and a single) and family bathroom. The principle bedroom is in the loft.Ideally located for many stations including South Ealing, Northfields & Brentford all within walking distance. Well regarded schools to choose from including the Ofsted outstanding Gunnersbury Catholic school.

James Pendleton are delighted to offer to the market a well proportioned four bedroom modern townhouse set within a quiet gated mews. The development is set back from the road and accessed via a secure gate. Once through the front door of the property you are greeted by a large entrance hall which leads through to a generous open plan reception room/kitchen breakfast room with integrated appliances and offers great entertaining space. Sliding doors from the reception room lead out to a patio garden and off the hallway is a downstairs guest cloakroom. There is also access to the patio garden via the hallway. On the first floor there is a master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, and a second double bedroom with access to a balcony. The top floor comprises two further double bedrooms and a main bathroom. The property has an allocated parking space and there is also visitor parking available. This fantastic property further benefits air conditioning and underfloor heating throughout the ground floor. Adams Mews is located just off Trinity Road, within easy reach of Tooting Bec Underground station and close to the amenities and transport links local to Balham and Wandsworth Common.

VIEWING DAY SATURDAY 12TH MARCH. Offering plenty of potential is this charming 4 bedroom, 1930's semi detached family home benefitting from an additional loft room, a rear conservatory, double glazing throughout, off street parking and a good size private rear garden. The house raised from street level and set well back offering plenty of privacy, also has off street parking for one car. A path with steps leads up to the house which is bordered by mature plants and shrubs.  Through a front porch is the main entrance that leads into a good size hallway housing the staircase that has a storage cupboard underneath. At the front of the house is a good size reception room that has high ceilings and a large bay window that fills the room with natural light. The back of the property has been opened to create a generous kitchen dining room. The kitchen wraps around one side of the room in an ‘L’ shape with plenty of wall and base mounted cupboards with an integrated oven and grill. There is a white tiled splash back and a worktop that houses the sink and hob. A patio door to the side and a sliding door from the kitchen both lead out to the conservatory. The conservatory offers access to the side return via a door to the side and there is also a shower room with toilet and wash hand basin. Windows look out to the garden and a patio door offers direct access. The garden is a good size extending to 41 ft (12.5m) with an array of mature plants, shrubs and trees along the left-hand side and there is a large workshop and shed to the right with a pathway down the middle. Upstairs on the first floor there are 4 bedrooms and a shower room. The largest of the bedrooms is at the front of the house, it has fitted cupboards along one side of the room and a large square bay window mirroring the reception room below. Adjacent is the smallest bedroom which would make a good child bedroom or a study. The two other bedrooms are located at the back of the house overlooking the garden and are of equivalent size. The shower room is in the middle of the house off the landing, it has a walk-in shower enclosure, a wash hand basin and a toilet that sits beneath a frosted window that offers natural light and ventilation. The loft space has been converted to create an additional room. There are skylights in the roof offering natural light and there are large eaves storage cupboards around the room, one of which houses the boiler. The loft space has potential to add a dormer to maximise the space in the room, subject to the normal planning consents.Overhill Road is twixt Dulwich, Forest Hill and Honor Oak Park, providing easy access to all the amenities these areas offer. Nearby is Lordship Lane with all its wonderful shops, bars and restaurants as well as Forest Hill Road which has a great parade of shops etc inc The Watsons General Telegraph Pub. Green open spaces of Dulwich Park, Sydenham Woods, Horniman gardens and Brenchley gardens are also nearby. There are plenty of buses to take you to central London and you have the choice of East Dulwich, Peckham Rye, Honor Oak or Forest Hill stations nearby. There is also a good selection of highly rated primary schools, the closest of which is Goodrich Primary which is only 320 meters away. This house has been a fabulous family home for decades and is looking for a new family to take care of it for years to come.

A home with plenty of period charm. This huge three-bedroom Victorian house with South Facing Garden, offers a space of circa 1700 sq. ft. The property boasts traditional Victorian hallmarks such as high ceilings with intricate cornicing's, ceiling roses and fireplaces. Convenience is also a big factor here, within Minutes, you have Turnpike Lane Tube Station (Piccadilly Line – Zone 3), Hornsey BR, and the numerous bus links along Green Lanes.THE PROPERTYThe home is presented with a through lounge, built with stunning high ceilings. The first reception room is furnished with large bay windows with a front aspect allowing the sunlight to shine throughout.  The dining area is spacious in size leading straight into the kitchen which is built with ample storage and worktop space and equipped with a gas hob and oven. The kitchen area provides direct access to the south facing private garden which has mature lawn and with some love can be something very impressive. This is the perfect place to test your gardening skills. The first floor of the property holds the first bedroom which is a large double and you have the family bathroom on this floor as well. The family bathroom is fitted with a panel bathtub and even a bidet. On the top floor you have two large double bedrooms both built with large windows adding to the brightness of the property, radiating from top to bottom. If all that was not enough, the property holds a full width cellar free for the new owner to use how however they wish. THE LOCATIONTo get around town, you have a host of transport links. Situated within walking distance of Turnpike Lane Underground Station (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) and Hornsey BR providing direct access to London Liverpool Street and most major parts of the City. Local to the property is the renowned Harringay Green Lanes, which has no shortage of local stores selling fresh produce, bars/pubs, restaurants and quirky coffee shops. Providing perfect spots to shop, dine and relax. Not forgetting the selection of green spaces surrounding the area such as Duckett’s Common Park and Chestnuts Park. Please call us to arrange a viewing.‘Think…Property Inc!’

Stepping into the entrance hall, (with underfloor heating) you get a sense of space which runs throughout the home, (1765.28 Square ft.)The property features an  original stained glass window in the hallway and half moon double glazed windows in the front lounge and bedroom too. The front lounge benefits from a Faber Ease gas fire.The dining room has a "Wessex” wheelchair lift from the ground to the upper floor which is controlled by panel units on the walls and also within the lift. (This can be removed)The dining area which is a very good space for entertaining, is a bright room and has two separate glazed entrances to the kitchen/diner with underfloor heating and which also benefits from many Integrated "Neff" appliances and two remote controlled, rain detecting Velux Skylight windows which flood the kitchen with natural light.Moving on to the first floor landing are three bedrooms and a bathroom/wet room with electric underfloor heating which has wheelchair access to the shower. A further bedroom and bathroom with electric underfloor heating is located on the top floor with plenty of storage in the eaves and further "walk in" storage space. The garden is laid to lawn with a patio area and access to an out building (which we have been advised needs some structural/maintenance work The property needs to be viewed to be appreciated and would make the perfect family home in a great location close to schools, transport and amenities.

Price Guide £900,000 - £950,000Set within the Fairfield Road Conservation area and forming part of this charming residential enclave, is this impressive red brick, double bayed, Edwardian house. Spanning over 1237 Sq Ft this house has been developed to create a bright and expansive living space. Combining an eclectic décor and a wealth of original period features, this property provides the perfect mix of charm and style.Entering the front door you are greeted with exposed floor boards which run through the entirety of the ground floor arrangement and an eclectic décor with bright colours and patterns which would uplift anyone’s day. Heading into the front reception room you immediately acknowledge the hand finished white Marble fireplace with matching hearth which complements the additional period features of the stripped floor boards, sash windows, column radiators, picture rail and cove cornicing. Via French doors you can then head through to a lavishly sized dining area which is full width of the house allowing the perfect setting for dining/entertaining friends and family.  Entering into the back half of the home the sleek and streamlined kitchen blends beautifully with a contemporary edge with its clean lines, organic work top and uncluttered vibe. Finishing off the downstairs is a cloak room.Upstairs the charm and character continue, the main bedroom boasts exposed floorboards, high ceilings, bay window and the added benefit of an en-suite. The second bedroom is a comfortable double size boasting a beautiful feature fireplace and the added benefit of a door leading to a roof terrace. Completing the first floor there is a family bathroom which combines up to date stylish looks with a hint of traditional characteristics that are in keeping with the age of the home.Fairfield Road is an area of particular special architectural and historic interest, illustrated by its rich history, significant architecture and mixed character all dating back from the 19th century. This sought after location is well-positioned for the shops, cafes, market and amenities of the Roman Road whilst the open green spaces of both Grove Hall Park or the award winning Victoria Park are just moments away. Nearby transport links include Mile End tube station (Central Line) and Bow Road tube (District Line) and Bow Church DLR, all offering swift and direct links to The City, Canary Wharf and West End.

Adjacent to Brick Lane, nestled within the ever sought after Shoreditch, this spacious and stylish house is ideal for anyone seeking their first home within a creative corner on the fringe of The City.Built in 2014, this modern home was sympathetically constructed not only to suit the immediate setting, but also modern living standards and with social dynamics and comfort in mind. A mechanical heat recovery system and solar panels on the roof ensures running costs are low, whilst the vendor has installed air conditioning to the bedrooms. Integrated speakers are set within ceilings throughout. The addition of remote controlled electric blinds on all floors makes for an enviable smart home.Floor to ceiling window openings flood the living spaces with natural light, with a double height ceiling and mezzanine level opening up the ground floor kitchen / diner space to the first floor living area. The open plan kitchen features Corian surfaces, Smeg appliances and a breakfast bar adjacent to the dining area. The first floor provides a generous living area and an ideal corner for a study area if working from home, with both this and the second floor finished with an oak hardwood floor.The second floor houses both double bedrooms. The principal has been upgraded to include bespoke storage beneath the vaulted windows with fitted wardrobe opposite. The second bedroom offers a further double with fitted wardrobe. A small, enclosed courtyard area to the rear opens into a shared communal yard, with bike and bin storage and right of way access.SituationGrimsby Street is located in the heart of Shoreditch, within yards of Brick Lane, nearby a vast array of vibrant bars, restaurants, boutique shops and galleries. It is also a short walk to both Brick Lane and Spitalfields, sought after enclaves for culture, food and crafts.This central location provides excellent transport links with Shoreditch High Street (Overground), Old Street (Northern Line and National Rail) and Liverpool Street (National Rail, Underground with the future prospect of Crossrail) stations all within walking distance.

A spacious Warner villa on one of the most sought-after streets in the area with its ornate Victorian frontage and bold front door, this home looks appealing and welcoming from the get-go. The spacious reception room off the main hallway to the left, combines a cosy lounge area to the bay window, with a whole extra space where the light is maximised by the patio doors leading out to the garden.  The kitchen forms the heart of the home with room to play, dine and relax with Crittal doors opening out to the garden, a natural space with a seating area surrounded by established shrubs and treesThere’s plenty of natural light in the kitchen-diner and good practical lighting too. And lots of open green space at Springfield Marina and the Marshes and Wetlands, which are all within walking or cycling distance. It’s got the lot.Shall we take a look?In The Owners Words... - We had always wanted a house on Pretoria Avenue, and were so delighted to have the opportunity to make this house our home. It's really perfectly located for transport being so close to the Victoria line and St James St Overground too, which has made it easy for work. We're always out and about on our bikes and it's been wonderful to be able to cycle down quiet streets to the Wetlands, Marshes and Springfield Park. Our daughter's brilliant primary school is on the same road and there's a lovely community feel with many of her friends walking past our house on the way to school. We are so sad to leave our home and the area, if we could take it with us of course we would!Entrance - Via front door leading into:Entrance Hallway - Staircase leading to first floor. This house immediately draws the eye with an attractive frontage, large, paved drive with space for many cars and clever use of space throughout.An appealing property, it has a number of delightful features including a well-designed loft conversion which provides a very large master, en-suite, bedroom. Whether you are seeking plenty of space to accommodate visitors or have a growing family to accommodate, this is a prime area that provides a variety of facilities.Local transport is plentiful and provides easy access to train and tube stations for a daily commute or just to get out and about, there's plenty to choose from.Grange Park station is a short walk and is within Travelcard Zone 4 and offers straightforward journeys for those needing to get in and out of the city. Winchmore Hill and Enfield Chase are also close by while there are a huge variety of buses travelling across a wide area of the local vicinity from the Grange Park bus/coach station.There is also a huge variety of educational options through primary to secondary schools.The Raglan Schools, a Federation of Raglan Infant School and Raglan Junior School, is less than two miles away and has 930 pupils and 120 staff based on a large site in Bush Hill Park.Highfield Primary is close by and an inclusive three-form entry school with a population of around 690 children. The school has a vast amount of field space, including a mini farm, sports area and outdoor gym, which makes the site a very special place within the heart of London.Secondary schools are similarly successful. Winchmore School is within four miles and is often fully subscribed, mainly down to its reputation for academic success and commitment to being 'truly comprehensive', celebrating diversity of students and full respect for everyone's heritage, religion and culture. Further options are available at Edmonton County School - also within easy access thanks to good public transport connections. It is a 4-18 mixed, community, comprehensive school with a long history of providing a high-quality education across a dual-campus structure. There are many other education options within very close proximity including prep and denomination schools.When it comes to free time, there are few areas in London offering so much in terms of open space and sports opportunity.  Bush Hill Park, Grovelands Park and Oakwood Park are close by while a variety of leisure facilities offer a wide variety of activities for all ages and interests.As for the weekly shop, there are plenty of supermarkets close by, a choice of household stores and lots of local independent retailers of all kinds.This area offers something for everyone and has a close knit and vibrant feel, suitable for those seeking to live their best lives. A MESSAGE FROM THE OWNERS   "A lovely family home built on love and laughter. We've put our heart and soul into this home and have raised our children here. The lovely big reception rooms have seen many large celebrations during our time here. Chilling out in large log cabin with friends and family over the years has been amazing. We feel privileged to have lived here and have many amazing memories. The move from here will be both exciting and heart breaking. We hope that the new owners will create their own special memories here, just as we have."Please contact one of our property consultants at your earliest convenience to avoid potential disappointment.

It is famous for hosting popular festivals and events and has a lovely Sunday food market with stalls selling a wide variety of tasty dishes. This 1930's property features well-proportioned and spacious accommodation arranged over three floors whilst still retaining a homely and welcoming feeling throughout. The ground floor comprises a large through lounge/dining room with bespoke built-in storage either side of the chimney breasts, ornate feature fireplaces, beautiful shutters to the front bay window and French doors providing access to the rear garden. A contemporary kitchen leads onto a bright and airy breakfast area flooded by natural light and affording views overlooking the beautiful and low maintenance garden which offers a patio area to laid lawn, box shrub borders either side, decked area perfect for entertaining in the summer months and a useful garage to the rear which can be accessed via the adjoining Rodney Road. On the first floor there are two generous double bedrooms with the main offering ample built-in wardrobes and bay window with shutters mirroring the reception below, third single bedroom or study/office ideal for working from home and a sizeable four-piece family bathroom with separate free standing shower. The extended loft now incorporates a spacious fourth bedroom with a modern en suite shower, Juliet balcony and eaves storage remaining. Ideally positioned within close proximity of the highly regarded and Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated Nightingale Primary School, along with Wanstead High Street and Central Line station (0.8 miles) only a short walk from your doorstep. For more information or to arrange an appointment to view, please contact the office at your convenience.

A unique dual-aspect live/work mews house tucked behind Hackney Road, offering tranquillity in a prime East London location with the flexibility of being able to run a business from the premises if desired.The property is currently configured as a 3 bedroom house with a large 260sqft master suite on the ground floor with ensuite shower room. On the outside, it’s a traditional, bay-fronted Victorian property with imposing front and period detail. But inside, it’s a breathtaking contemporary home, renovated with a singular vision and so much care.The reception room is simple and cosy, a lovely spot to relax in the evenings, and the original stripped wood floors are dark stained and create a deep contrast to the white walls. You can feel an easy flow of natural light throughout the home as we pass the downstairs WC and enter the kitchen diner, which has enough room to sit and relax as well as dine and cook; with overhead skylights increasing the sense of scale even further. It’s cosy despite being a large space, due in part to the underfloor heating; and it’s designed for a family to be comfortable together, while doing their own things.The dramatic Crittal doors open out onto a natural garden with established shrubs and borders, and a pergola in the garden adds interest and privacy.  Upstairs begins with a bright, open hallway. There’s a family bathroom both on the first floor and in the loft conversion. The bedrooms are doubles, and feel fresh and airy with room for storage. Nothing is flash here, it’s just simple and modern and built for comfort.You’ll be living in an area of Walthamstow, where everything you need is within walking distance. There’s a variety of local schools in the area and you’re just a few minutes walk from the village, with its local shops, great pubs, cafes and restaurants. And to get away from it all, you’re only a short cycle away to acres of natural green space at Hollow Pond.Transport is on your doorstep too, whether you need Overground, tube or bus, with both Walthamstow Central and Walthamstow Queens Road stations within a 10 minute walk. An impressive and spacious four bedroom, three bathroom, modern townhouse with off street parking and a 45ft west facing garden set within the prestigious Blackheath quarter of Kidbrooke Village.This stunning house has been finished to a very high standard and is in excellent decorative order throughout. The accommodation is arranged over three floors, spans 1,540 sq.ft. and comprises to the ground floor; a large family/dining room with an open plan modern kitchen with integrated appliances and breakfast bar, a downstairs cloakroom, laundry/utility cupboard and a coat cupboard. The first floor provides a 15’1 x 12’1 living room and large 15’1 x 11’6 double bedroom with extensive built in wardrobes and a luxury ensuite bathroom. Finally there are three bedrooms on the top floor including a large double with ensuite shower room and a modern family bathroom. To the rear is a 45ft west facing garden with terrace and lawn with off street parking to the front drive and bin storage.Situated just 50 yards from the property is a 24 hour concierge, a gym, swimming pool, business centre and cinema room.  There are beautifully landscaped gardens and ponds with local shops and Sutcliffe Park nearby. There is no chain and your immediate viewing is essential. Handley Drive is part of the exclusive Blackheath Quarter of Kidbrooke Village - a new and vibrant London community which offers an outstanding choice of quality, sustainable new homes.  As well as high end apartments and houses, it will offer new parks, shops, bars, restaurants, schools, sports, healthcare and community facilities. Within 200 yards is a Sainsbury’s local, a newly opened restaurant, pharmacy, convenience store and coffee shop. Sutcliffe Park with beautifully landscaped wetlands, sports facilities and ponds is just a few hundred yards away as is the new Cator park which has been created as part of Kidbrooke Village, including a large children’s adventure play area and a multi-use games area. Blackheath Village, with its array of boutique shops, bars and restaurants, is also close by. Transport links to central London are excellent with travel to London Bridge in just 15 minutes from nearby rebuilt Kidbrooke station. Direct trains to Victoria, Charing Cross, Waterloo East and Cannon Street also run from here.

Charming Two Bedroom Period Home With Loft Room. GUIDE PRICE £900k to £945k This handsome Victorian two bedder will effortlessly command your attention with its numerous charms. Tasteful styling, original features, a pretty patio garden and a super attic/study space means you're more than well catered for. You've also got every conceivable amenity on your doorstep - including the wonderful Bellenden Road! Peckham Rye station, in addition to unbeatable services to London Bridge, hosts the fab London Overground line - it'll whisk you to Shoreditch, Islington, Hoxton or Clapham in no time at all!Enter off the winding, leafy and tranquil Elm Grove in through a neat front space with high mature hedging. An arched recessed portico presents a period door in Farrow and Balls' 'Green Smoke'. This leads into an inviting hallway with high ceilings, timber flooring and an original carpeted staircase. The double reception welcomes you with an open log fire to the front - a real joy come winter. There's an aspect to both front and rear, low level fitted storage and a further feature fireplace with good-looking mantel. Toward the end of the hall you find a handy understairs storage space. The dining space comes next with fitted storage and plenty of space for the family dining table. The bright, well stocked contemporary kitchen adjoins to the rear of this boasting sleek white cabinets, one and a half bowl sink, four ring Induction hob and oven. This and the dining space each face directly over the patio garden which plays host to a healthy array of plants and shrubs. Your guests can easily spill out and mingle at the house warming bbq!Heading upstairs you'll find a beautifully presented bathroom still has the original feature fireplace. A lavish roll top bath, period style suite and walk-in shower make for the perfect spot for the morning ablutions. The insatiably bright master bedroom fronts the grove with two large sash windows. The room is carpeted and has a neatly placed staircase with open risers that leads to the attic room. Here you've got space enough for any amount of endeavours - begin writing those memoirs or alphabetise that shoe collection. The second bedroom is back on the first floor with a rear aspect and another feature fireplace.The locale really leaves you within a stroll of anything you might need. Rye Lane offers its unique London bustle and all the high street shops. Transport wise you're equally well catered for with nearby Peckham Rye Station - which in addition to London Bridge services supplies the fab London Overground Line. Further services include Blackfriars and Victoria (all between 9-14 mins). Buses head into town from Rye Lane and Peckham Road, night buses included. Bellenden Road offers some exciting places to eat and drink. Bar Story is close for a cocktail on the patio, and East Dulwich or Camberwell are near for a change of (local) scene.

Century 21 Heritage are thrilled to be offering this gorgeous four bedroom, double fronted house with off street parking, and rear private garden in one of the most sought after location in Forest Gate E7.The property benefits from two large reception rooms, fitted kitchen, additional dinning / reception room, large ground floor bathroom, spacious rear garden. Set on a popular tree lined Victorian avenue within trendy Bermondsey, is this exceptional, mid terrace, period house. A wonderful, three double bedroom home that has been lovingly maintained and upgraded throughout, sympathetically combining original period features and character with contemporary fixtures and fittings. Stylish with a genuine sense of charm, the living space extends to an impressive 1112 Sq Ft. Naturally bright with a wonderfully calm ambience you are immediately drawn to the substantial 21ft reception room. Offering ample room to relax and dine in style, exposed floorboards and a period feature fireplace reflect the period and style of the house. Further to the rear you discover a lovely kitchen diner. Also generous in size, with space for a small dining table if you wish, an ideal breakfast room and a real hub for the house. From the kitchen to the side return is a conservatory Lean-To. A delightful garden room that provides a real sense of inside-out living. The modern, four-piece bathroom sits to the back and is just lovely. Beautifully tiled and bathed in natural light from windows to the rear and two large skylights, the freestanding roll top bath and a large walk-in shower complete the sense of luxury. Upstairs you have the bedrooms, all three are generous doubles, quiet and again immaculately presented with ample built-in wardrobes. The master extends to 15ft and the bedroom to the rear conveniently offers a separate WC and sink. Outside, the garden is larger than most at 55ft at the longest point. Established borders and a paved terrace complete the look. Further benefits include a small front garden and residents permit parking.Lynton Road itself is centrally located within SE1 and very much at the heart of a rich, community driven area and perfect for those looking to enjoy the bars and restaurants of nearby Bermondsey Street, Borough and Shad Thames. Further delights on your doorstep include the food markets of ,Maltby Street, Borough and Spa Terminus while transport links via nearby Bermondsey and London Bridge stations offer easy access into the West End, City and Canary Wharf. Bus links are excellent too, with the day and night routes number 1 and 78 moments away and for those that prefer to cycle the Quietway is literally on your doorstep.The area also offers great potential for capital growth with the proposed Bakerloo extension due to place a station just a short walk away. A house of real distinction.Energy Efficiency Rating D.

Stunning three bedroom double fronted Mews house situated in a gated development in the heart of the Ashburnham triangle in West Greenwich. The PropertyForming part of the riverside Sovereign View development, this end of terrace mock-Georgian townhouse offers a rare taste of character against the backdrop of Canary Wharf over the water. Arranged over three floors, the property boasts a split-level open plan living area with full-height, fan-light windows offering views across the square towards the river.This end of terrace house affords good, adaptable, well planned accommodation. On entering through the front door comprises of a hallway with storage cupboard and leads to the integrated garage that offers a wealth of additional storage and currently also used as a utility room helping keep laundry out of the kitchen. Leading up the airy and bright stairs to the first floor you are then led through to the large open plan living area which boasts an abundance of natural daylight and plenty of space for comfortable and practical living. A door leads directly out onto the private terrace that looks straight out to the Thames. The kitchen itself, recently done to a high standard, comprises a range of matching wall and base units, quartz work surfaces  incorporating an inset sink unit and induction hob with overhead extractor next to two electric ovens. To the second floor you have the master bedroom with views of the Thames, plenty of fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room. The second double Bedroom offers south facing views and airing cupboard storage, there is also a lovely family bathroom to this level and access to the solid floor loft from the Landing. The property has been superbly updated, offering light and spacious accommodation and neutrally decorated throughout.The property is within walking distance to both Canada Water and Rotherhithe stations. There is also a Thames Clipper ferry port just moments away (with direct crossings to Canary Wharf) and the property is also serviced by a number of buses too. Rare to the market is this grand and imposing Victorian double fronted corner property with five bedrooms, garage and garden offering potential to split into two dwellings (STPP) having a front door in Warwick Road and one in Reginald Road (at present not in use).  It's all located just off West Ham Park, and a short fifteen minute stroll from Stratford.While the property would benefit from updating it will make a fantastic opportunity for a large family or developer to make their mark. Viewing is advised to appreciate the potential that this unique property has to offer.IF YOU LIVED HEREYou'll be stretching out in these stately Victorian proportions, with over 1700 square feet of living space and high ceilings to make your own. Your vast 300 square foot through lounge is a vintage treat in its own right. Dual aspect,with glazed internal doors to the rear opening up to yet more hosting space, and with that double bay window to the front, you have lashings of natural light throughout.There's a timber panelled statement wall, a gorgeous vintage stone surround atop the hearth, original cornicing overhead. Step into your timber panelled rear sunroom and you have leafy green views of your garden via wall-filling windows. It's quite a courtyard; with patio, flower borders and beautiful eighty year old apple tree.Back inside and your kitchen's a bright, lengthy space of 150 square feet,  with a sky blue paint job and matching cabinets. You have yet another reception and the ground floor bedroom behind the second flank of your double frontage, both generous spaces of around 150 square feet, each finished with the property's signature vintage character.Upstairs all four bedrooms are superbly balanced doubles ranging from 120 to 160 square feet, each with its own character and fittings. The fourth bedroom acts as a second kitchen, that can be converted back into a bedroom. Your family bathroom completes the interior, while in your garden you have that wonderful double height barn of a garage. A wealth of private parking space or an exciting development opportunity? It's up to you.As noted Stratford is within easy walking distance, for all the many and varied shopping and leisure delights of Westfield, the world famous post-2012 landmarks of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and the incomparable underground, overground, international and, soon, Crossrail transport links of Stratford station. Even closer to home, the vast green space of West Ham Park, site of the first FA Cup goal in history, is just a few steps from your front door. Ideal for morning jogs, evening strolls or exercising furry friends.WHAT ELSE?- You have no fewer than thirty two schools rated 'Good' or better less than a mile away on foot, with an impressive twelve deemed 'Outstanding'.- As well as that tempting garage, you have a vast cellar to turn to all manner of uses whether that be a home working space or simple storage. You may even be able to develop the untouched loft space into your own whole new storey, subject to the usual permissions.- The former Olympic Athletes Village, now dubbed East Village and reimagined as 'London's Coolest Postcode' is well worth the twenty minute stroll or short hop by Uber. It's packed with independent, artisanal wining and dining establishments. You're sure to find a favourite.Garden - 5.5m x 6.2m (18'0" x 20'4") - Garage - 3.80m x 5.87m  (12'5" x 19'3" ) - Cellar Room - 6.14m x 3.60m  (20'1" x 11'9" ) - Cellar Room - 5.55m x 3.58m  (18'2" x 11'8" ) - Hall - Reception Rooms 1 & 2 - 3.57m x 7.94m  (11'8" x 26'0" ) - Reception Room 3 - 3.57m x 2.32m  (11'8" x 7'7" ) - Bedroom - 3.78m x 4.20m  (12'4" x 13'9" ) - Reception Room 4 - 4.38m x 3.62m  (14'4" x 11'10" ) - Kitchen - 6.50m x 2.14m  (21'3" x 7'0" ) - Bedroom - 4.49m x 3.50m  (14'8" x 11'5" ) - Bedroom - 3.54m x 3.69m  (11'7" x 12'1" ) - Bedroom - 4.49m x 3.50m  (14'8" x 11'5" ) - Bedroom - 2.95m x 3.55m  (9'8" x 11'7" ) - Bathroom - 1.86m x 2.61m  (6'1" x 8'6" ) - A WORD FROM THE OWNER....."This house has been a happy and comfortable home for over fifty years for our big Italian family.
