An immaculate five/six bedroom semi detached family home within close proximity to sought after schools.Arranged over three floors the property comprises a generous entrance hall, large main reception room with feature bay window, downstairs shower room with marble tiling, utility room and a spacious open plan kitchen reception room with integrated appliances, breakfast peninsular and sliding glass doors opening onto the 61ft rear garden.Across the first and second floor is a four piece family bathroom, five bedrooms and home office which is currently used as a guest room.Notable features include hard wood flooring throughout the ground floor, vaulted kitchen ceiling, integrated garage and a large 228 sq ft outbuilding which is currently set up as a home gym.Located within 0.9 miles of New Eltham station the property is also within close proximity to Montbelle and Edgebury primary schools.Energy Efficiency Rating C.

An exceptional gated mews development of five freehold houses in leafy Hither Green, South East London - created, in part, from a former carpentry workshop. This is so much more than just another new housing scheme. Every aspect of the design and architecture has been a collaboration between designer Matthias Felsch and sculptor Jeff Lowe. It represents their belief that new homes absolutely can combine style, functionality, and individuality. Jeff was keen to ensure that the houses all had dedicated creative spaces, while Matthias saw to it that, whilst there is an extraordinary amount of floor space on offer, each one is a practical home as well. Number 3 is one of three town houses and is slightly larger at 150 square metres. As with number 2, accommodation is arranged over three spacious levels but the twist lies in its outdoor space. Rather than a top floor terrace, this house has a walled rear garden which becomes an extension of the large living area once those oversized bi-fold doors are thrown open.On the first floor you will find two double bedrooms and two bathrooms; the minimal, clean lines balance well with the natural tones Matthias has used. Spanning the top floor is a cavernous studio with high, beamed ceilings whose cool limed finish create a gently industrial feel. As will the other houses in the mews, this space lends itself to all sorts of activities: a gym, further reception space, vast bedroom or a studio/office that would hold a serious-sized business.The focus of the design is very much the consolidation of home and work. the integral tech is thoroughly up to date, with Cat 6 cabling and local fibre broadband should you want it, while clever internal lighting options give total control over your environment.This quiet corner of South East London is something of a hidden gem. It is a desirable residential location but with Hither Green Station more or less on the door step, it is a gateway to London and beyond. Trains to London Bridge, Charing Cross or Cannon Street are frequent and take around ten minutes. There is also the option for a change at New Cross for the Overground to Shoreditch and North London or head to Lewisham and grab the DLR for Canary Wharf, Stratford, or The City.Lewisham's constantly evolving town centre is close by. You can take a train or bus there, but it is an easy walk. There is lots on offer here in terms of shopping and eateries but, closer to home and on either side of the tracks, there is an equally impressive selection of coffee houses and places to eat and drink. Found Hope Store on Hither Green Lane offers some fine artisan fare, coffee, and wine. You could also take cocktails at, Bobs just a few doors down. On the other side of the railway you can enjoy the food, drink, and atmosphere at the Station Hotel - something of a local landmark these days. It sits in what feels like an urban village, very quiet and also close to the green spaces at Mountsfield Park, Manor park & Manor House Gardens.

Pretty three bedroom Victorian terraced house of 1012 square feet, on a quiet residential street with unrestricted parking. The house incorporates a large loft extension, and potential remains to extend on the ground floor. A lawned garden of 35 feet completes the package. Freehold.  You're really close to Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres, the beautiful green space of Nunhead cemetery, and also to volunteer-run Aquarius Golf Club. Your local stations are Nunhead, Peckham Rye and Brockley; all are circa a mile from the house (and Fare Zone 2).  Open directly into the open-plan reception room - with the stairs dividing living and dining areas. It's a generous space at over 24 feet by over 12 feet, and welcome and characterful features include a wood-burning stove and stripped original boards to the floor.  The kitchen lies beyond: a timeless Shaker-style one, with wooden worktops, and double-glazed French doors out to the low-maintenance garden.  Up the stairs and you've got the property's bathroom to the rear - with a tiled floor, sash window, neat white sanitary ware, and an over bath shower. Next door is a double bedroom with sash window to garden views, and the second (twin-sashed) double bedroom takes the width of the terrace (over 13 feet), to the front of the house, with a feature fireplace. Both bedrooms have stripped floors and white walls.  Up to the second floor and you've got an impressive large third bedroom - an obvious master - of over 18 feet by over 11 feet. Wooden floors, skylight windows, a Juliet balcony and accessible eaves storage tick even more boxes.  Green space? Peckham Rye Park & Common is your most local green space (walk five minutes) - comprising a Victorian Park and historic common; a pleasant refuge for both the local community and wildlife. It's home to ornamental gardens, streams, woodland and a lake, playgrounds and a cafe, plus outdoor gym. The park has been awarded Green Flag status and has a long, rich and engaging history - it was recorded as being cultivated before the Norman Conquest in the 11th Century! At the tip of the common you have a host of cool eateries and such - including Mr Bao, Good Neighbour and Banh Banh, and trendy hairdressing salon (Blue Tit).  Bellenden Road, Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane are also close for yummy restaurants (we love Levan, Ganapati, The Begging Bowl and Artusi), cool bars and pubs, Peckham Levels, and The Bussey Building.  You're a short stroll from Nunhead and East Dulwich's town centres too. In Nunhead we like Kudu Grill and El Vermut, plus Ayres bakery and FC Soper wet fish shop. Brockley's also close for more options, and for pubs - The Ivy House, The Waverley, The Herne and The Angel Oak are all strong locals.  Local schools are good; your most local is Ivydale Primary.

This substantial 3 bedroom freehold house offers over 1300 sq ft, has off street parking and has a rear garden. The ground floor comprises of  a studio room, w/c with hand basin in white and eat in kitchen. The kitchen has a range of high and low units in beech effect, with integrated hob, extractor fan and double oven.  There is a tiled splashback and tiled flooring. There is a door leading to the rear garden, which has a brick storage unit and rear gate to allow access through the rear of the property. The first floor has the large reception room, which is bright and airy. There is a double bedroom and the family bathroom. The bathroom has a white suite and mosaic tiles, with  blue tiled flooring. The second floor comprises of two further double bedrooms and storage cupboards in the hallway. Victorian Grove is in the heart of vibrant Stoke Newington between Stoke Newington Church Street close to boutique shops, pubs and restaurants and trendy Dalston. There are excellent transport links including Rectory Road Station into Liverpool Street, Dalston Kingsland Station, Dalston Junction Station and a wide variety of local buses into The City and West End.  For recreation Clissold Park and Hackney Downs are within walking distance.

A 4 double-bedroom, 2 bathroom townhouse with integral garage in a highly regarded, gated development with well-maintained communal gardens.Prospect Place offers the best of both worlds, a secluded environment in the City.  A safe place for the family in a quiet residential area with beautiful well-maintained communal gardens, yet it's ideally placed for local amenities, St Peters School, riverside restaurants, pubs, delis, local shops, parks, and the market.  All the things that make Wapping a unique and attractive place to call home.  When one has to go to the office the station is just 5 minutes walk and the City or Canary Wharf an easy commute; a rather pleasant one if you decide to walk or cycle.This lovely home comprises of 4 good-sized double bedrooms all with plenty of space for storage.  There's a shower room on the ground floor and bathroom on the top floor.  An open-plan kitchen dining room and a 4.3m long integral garage.  It's a versatile property, currently set up for room by room letting with an income of over £3000 per month, but can easily be converted to a more conventional family home.    Priced with a quick sale in mind this is a great opportunity for a family home or a turnkey investment in our wonderful neighbourhood.

This immaculately presented four bedroom family home is ideally located in a quiet enclave close to the many attractions of Winchmore Hill and just a 15 minute walk from the station. The property has been sympathetically extended by the addition of an extension over the former integral garage and the conversion of the loft space to create a generously sized double-fronted property. With four double bedrooms, a study, utility room, and gym in addition to two large entertaining spaces, a thoughtfully designed garden, and extensive off-street parking, this house caters to all the needs of modern living.The ground floor main living room is light and spacious extending to over 25ft. It has a large bay window to the front and a second bay with glazed double doors to the rear garden. This flexible space is currently configured with sofas and a TV in the front half of the room, which features an ultra-modern electric holographic fireplace with Venetian plaster surround, and a dining area to the rear.The kitchen/dining room to the rear of the house is a first-class entertaining space, with views and easy access to the garden via large glazed double doors, an extensive well-equipped kitchen, a wraparound bar seating area, and plenty of space for a dining table or sofas. The adjacent utility room houses an additional sink and hob in addition to laundry machines. This west-facing room has good natural light, with windows along two walls and a lantern roof light. Internal glazed doors and windows, the kitchen skylight, and downlighters maximise light throughout the ground floor, which also has a gym and WC. The second floor has three double bedrooms, a family bathroom, and study. These are arranged around a central stair, emphasising both the lateral space and natural light. All bedrooms have charming bay windows, feature lighting, and laminate wood floors and the main bedroom has a bespoke storage wall. The hotel-style bathroom is recently updated, with a contemporary freestanding bath and a walk-in double shower. The small study which overlooks the rear garden is currently used for storage. The top floor suite comprises a large double bedroom with an en-suite shower room, dressing area, and bespoke built-in storage. A Velux window on the landing and additional window with garden views optimise light levels.The property has a large block-paved front garden with space to park two cars and a thoughtfully designed west-facing rear garden which is an ideal outdoor living space. With a large paved patio, raised beds, artificial turf, pergola, and outdoor kitchen it has been designed with maximum enjoyment and minimal maintenance in mind. Every detail has been considered in this property and great care has been taken to create an ideal environment for work, play and rest.

FULL DETAILS  A charming and modern three bedroom mid terraced family house situated within 0.1 miles of Rokesly Junior School and 0.3 miles of Hornsey Station.The house has been beautifully refurbished and boasts a large ground floor area with eat in kitchen, downstairs W.C. a large sitting room that leads to a dining room with double doors out to a private patio garden. Guide price £850,000 to £900,000The house is FREEHOLD, offered CHAIN FREE, split over three floors and offers flexible accommodation with over 1100 sq ft of space. What the owners say:‘We adore this lovely family home boasting spectacular panoramic views across London - in clear sight are the Houses of Parliament, the London Eye, St Pauls Cathedral, the Gherkin, the Shard, Canary Wharf, Battersea Power Station and more. Offering a downstairs cloakroom, semi-open planned kitchen, dining area and lounge, opening onto a patio/outdoor eating area overlooking a large private, low maintenance garden the house offers a lot to enjoy. The property has four double bedrooms, two bathrooms (one on-suite) and the added bonus of having off street parking which is ideal in London. We found the house to be well situated for close transport links leading into central London and a short walk to a diverse café culture, popular restaurants and impressive range of independent shops and good schools - including the impressive Dulwich College and St Francesca Cabrini Catholic School. A large Sainsbury’s supermarket is a short drive away which is super handy.  The house is in the quiet, leafy suburb of Honor Oak with excellent nearby local amenities include riding stables, cricket clubs, swimming pool. It is a short walk to Honor Oak Gardens, Brenchley Gardens, Horniman Museum and Gardens, Dulwich Park and more’Both Forest Hill and Honor Oak come under the SE23 postcode and have become increasingly popular in recent years hence they’ve been featured on the popular TV programme “Location Location Location” several times.  SE23 has much to offer from boutique shops, thriving independent businesses on the high street, a great selection of green spaces and recreational facilities to great transport links and highly regarded schools.  If you're seeking a family home in proximity to well-regarded schools and a local train station with travel times to central London of approximately 15 minutes (to London Bridge) you should certainly consider this house.  Some of the best known public schools include: Ofsted rated "Outstanding" Fairlawn. Ofsted rated "Outstanding" Stillness. Ofsted rated "Outstanding" Rathfern. Ofsted rated "Good" Dalmain. You will also find a selection of independent schools locally one of which is a Montessori and the other is the highly acclaimed St Dunstan's which is also ranked in Ofsted's top 10%. Transport to central London station from Honor Oak train station includes some of the following travel times: London Bridge in approximately 15 minutes London Victoria in approximately 35 minutes  Canary Wharf in approximately 24 minutes Some of our favourite local eateries include Mama Dough (a sour dough pizza restaurant) and the award-winning Babur Indian restaurant. There’s also the Honor Oak gastro pub and a selection of boutique cafes and shops.  There's also the popular Le Querce which is run by a Sardinian family serving traditional dishes.  Local attractions include One Tree Hill which is just at the top of Honor Oak Rise and offers some of the most breath-taking views across London and the city skyline.  You will also find nature reserves in proximity of the property on Devonshire Road and Garthorne Road.  The Honor Oak sports ground is also close to the house. It boasts a great children’s playground and is highly rated on Google reviews. Forest Hill Library and pools have both undergone complete renovation in recent years. Forest Hill pools has fantastic swimming facilities but also has a well equipped gym and exercise classes.  Blythe Hill Fields which is approximately 0.9 mile away and is known by the locals for its recreational facilities and regular events. One such facility is the Trim trail which is an exercise trail and we mustn’t forget the yearly Blythe Hill festival that brings local business and the community together for a day of fun.  You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:   The Horniman gardens and museum is another well-known local point of interest. With regular events such as a farmers market and live music, we believe this will be of interest to many buyers.  You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens via the below link:   We look forward to answering any questions and arranging your viewing.NOTE: Images are for illustration only as tenants currently occupy the property

Guide Price £850,000-£885,000. A superb and larger than usual, three/four bedroom, three reception room, semi-detached period home with a large garden located on within the popular Charlton Slopes. The property is in very good decorative order yet still offers scope to enhance. The accommodation comprises; entrance hall with under stairs storage, downstairs cloakroom (WC), large 15’7 x 14’0 front reception room, 14’3 x 10’4 rear reception room with doors to the garden, a good size modern kitchen with wooden worktops and range style oven and that leads to a dining room. The property is conveniently located just 450 metres from Westcombe Park Station and 1.54 miles from North Greenwich Jubilee and the O2.  Blackheath Standard with all the daily conveniences is 430 metres away, Blackheath Village with its array of boutiques, bars and restaurants is 1.2 miles and the shops at Greenwich Peninsula are within easy reach. Large modern-build terraced house of 1355 square feet with four double bedrooms and two bathrooms. Live in or let out - it's great for either setup. And with so many rooms it can be used really flexibly for working from home, accommodating guests or a growing family etc.  A low-maintenance south-west garden (with access from the dining space) completes the package.  The location's strong as well! Walk just four minutes to Brixton Station (and Overground), and nine to Loughborough Junction Station. Brixton Recreation Centre is also but a few minutes away.  In your front door and you've got a large hall space with under stairs storage for coats and such (a downstairs w.c. in here too). The large wooden-floored reception room is set to your right. This is nearly 25 feet by over 11 feet - providing easily for generous seating and dining zones, with period-style central fireplace in the front reception space. Double doors open at the foot of the room onto the sunny garden.  A neat kitchen completes the floor, with modern wall and base units, a tiled floor, and large sash window to garden views.  Up to the first floor and you've got two big double bedrooms (these are the same size: over 12 feet by over 11 feet apiece), and a modern windowed bathroom with white suite and over bath shower.  The second floor hosts two further generous double bedrooms; the one to the rear boasting its own (windowed) en suite bathroom.  Coldharbour Lane is close and has delights such as Three Eight Four cocktail bar (plus small plates) and Tim Anderson's Nanban restaurant. Brixton Village has all the street food outlets you could possibly desire. Central Brixton is home to many established greats such as The Brixton Academy and The Ritzy Cinema.  Camberwell is close too and has a respectable and growing offering of places to eat and drink for all budgets, alongside useful shops, banks and supermarkets. Some of our favourite restaurants are The Camberwell Arms, Silk Road, The Crooked Well and Theo's.  Ruskin and Myatt's Fields Parks are your local Victorian parks, both have bandstands and community events, and Brockwell Park with popular lido is an easy bus ride or cycle.

INVESTMENT -  A Freehold mid-terraced property that has been converted into a large four bedroomed apartment and a commercial unit on the ground floor. Covering in excess of 1,850sqft overall and divided into a four double-bedroom apartment and separate commercial unit. A substantially statuesque semi detached four bedroom family home, with a vast flowing ground floor, driveway and rear garden. Wanstead High Street, the bustling heart of this much loved East London village, is just moments away.Home to cafes, gastropubs, fresh produce merchants and restaurants, as well as speedy transport connections and open green spaces, Wanstead Village is a firm favourite with families and City workers alike.IF YOU LIVED HERE...You'll be enjoying the mansionesque proportions, recently extended by the current owners, with more than 1450 square feet of living space across two floors. Step into your open plan, ingeniously zoned ground floor and your initial space comes in at over 200 square feet, with pale timber floors flowing underfoot and clear sightlines from front to back.It all blooms out into a beautifully bright twenty four foot wide reception across the rear, with a generous bank of sliding patio doors offering swathes of natural light and garden view. Out here you have a secluded mix of decking, patio, gravel and lawn. Back inside and your reception flows on into your kitchen where you have a breakfast bar, plus a sleek suite of white cabinets with a striking canary yellow backsplash.Your ground floor is completed by a devoted, dual aspect study and the first of your thee bathrooms – a sleek fully tiled shower room. Upstairs and all four of your double bedrooms have their charms. The rearmost sleeper features a luxurious en suite shower room while your 180 square foot principal bedroom is pre-plumbed for another should you desire. Across the hall yet another bathroom ensures that hectic mornings will be a thing of the past, while two more double bedrooms conclude the sleeping arrangements.Wanstead High Street is just a half mile on foot, and a fine detestation in its own right. There's a wealth of independent cafes and meeting spots, with The Larder doing itself proud in the hotly contested categories of Finest Homemade Treats and Best Coffee. Former coaching inn The Cuckfield offers a diverse menu in historical surroundings, while The Bull is a luxurious gastropub the equal of anything you'll find in the City.  WHAT ELSE?- Wanstead central line station is less than ten minutes walk away and will get you to Liverpool Street in fifteen, putting the City less than a half hour away door to door. Heading to the West End? Tottenham Court Road is just nine minutes further. You also have front facing parking for 3 cars, and space to add another 3plus parking spaces- Parents will be suitably impressed with local schools, you have five primary/secondaries rated 'Outstanding' all less than a mile away on foot. A further six are deemed 'Good' and just as close.- Nature's never far away here, the great green expanse of Epping Forest starts just two minutes from your front door. Endlessly explorable, you can head for Perch Pond and walk for miles without ever seeing a road.Reception Room - 4.57m x 3.93m (14'11" x 12'10") - Kitchen/Breakfast Room - 4.97m x 3.02m (16'3" x 9'10") - Study - 2.86m x 2.63m (9'4" x 8'7") - Shower Room - Reception Room - 7.32m x 3.10m (24'0" x 10'2") - Garden - 14m (45'11") - Bedroom - 4.97m x 3.58m (16'3" x 11'8") - Bedroom - 3.70m x 2.63m (12'1" x 8'7") - Ensuite - Shower Room - Bedroom - 3.87m x 2.49m (12'8" x 8'2") - Bedroom - 3.01m x 2.56m (9'10" x 8'4") - A WORD FROM THE EXPERT..."Being a country girl at heart, for me Wanstead is the perfect blend of village/city living. With excellent transport links into the city, I often meet up with friends to explore the wonders of London. But I also enjoy going for long, leafy walks with Hollow Ponds and Wanstead Park on my doorstep.I was first attracted to Wanstead by its charming High Street, lush green spaces and choice of excellent schools. Since moving here, I have discovered some new favourites — for breakfast La Bakerie, lunch at Otto and The Duke for the best roast around.I love to stay active, and here in Wanstead you have lots to choose from. From organised yoga at Christ Church Green, personal training sessions at Target Fit or jogging around the various nature trails of Epping Forest.There is a great sense of community here in Wanstead, with informative Facebook groups, street parties, a monthly farmers’ market and the local jumble trail. I have made many friends locally, there is a genuine community spirit here and I am proud to call Wanstead my home."KYLI CLAYTON E11 ASSISTANT MANAGER

A beautifully presented two bedroom terraced house located within the Dover House Conservation Area.Extended four bedroom family home renovated to high specification. Situated on a quiet residential road, just a short walk to the shops and restaurants of Putney.The large living room features French doors that open out onto a beautiful south facing garden. Post covid many purchasers have the option to work from home, this house does have the forth bedroom set up as a studio/office. The kitchen offers a full range of integrated appliances. The first floor comprises two generous double bedrooms with ample built in storage and a family bathroom. The top floor hosts a double bedroom with en-suite shower room and ample eaves storage.Dover House Road is located within the ever popular Dover House Conservation area, benefitting from the picturesque green and located a short walk (0.7 miles) from Barnes mainline station with frequent trains to Waterloo, plus with many excellent local bus routes nearby including the no's 72 to Hammersmith, 430 to Putney/Kensington and the 337 to Clapham Junction or Richmond.

This 3 bedroom semi-detached Victorian workman's cottage is a beautifully preserved example of why this road is so well known and desired amongst locals and visitors. Situated behind a white picket fence, this spacious house has a large kitchen/dining room with direct access to the lovely south facing garden. There are grass, borders and a patio, with a summer house to the rear and plenty of scope for a home/office or similar, if you desired one. The garden is not directly overlooked which is particularly rare in this location. The kitchen is contemporary and benefits from a 5- ring gas hob, a dishwasher and wooden surfaces. Off the kitchen, there is a downstairs toilet. There is also an excellent amount of storage in the cottage. There are also original wood floors throughout the property, with under floor heating in the kitchen and modern insulation in the living room walls and floor. In the front room, there is a high specification Douvre designer wood burning stove and double glazing. You will definitely be cosy in the winter in this cottage. On the upper floors are three bedrooms, one a light and spacious attic room, with ample built-in storage and shelving.  The bathroom has a fabulous massive shower and tasteful tiling. The master bedroom also has wooden floors and great light. Nestled between Brixton Hill and Brockwell Park, the location is just fantastic. With both Brixton Underground and Streatham Hill station being only 15 minutes walk or an even shorter bus ride away, this is a super-convenient spot.

Nestled is a peaceful cul-de-sac modern development is this impressive three bedroom/twobathroom house with off street parking on front drive and a lovely southerly aspect rear garden.Pendlewood Close is located just off Queens Walk, moments from the shops and brasseries in Pitshanger Lane that serve as the centre of activity in this community. Youwon't have to wander far to enjoy a coffee or to pick up some essentials.The beautiful wide open spaces of Pitshanger Park are close by, providing places forSunday afternoon strolls or picnics.What we suspect will tempt parents most, however, is that this home falls in the catchmentarea for North Ealing Primary. The property is well placed for prestigious private schools including St Benedict’s and Notting Hill & Ealing High, St Augustine’s Priory,Harvington and Durston House.

FOR SALE is this three bedroom, semi-detached 1930s property, currently offering 1316 sq ft of internal living accommodation. The property is in need of substantial refurbishment throughout but presents an ambitious purchaser with a unique opportunity to create something truly special. A reconfiguration of the Ground Floor, and an extension at the rear (STPP), would maximise the available square footage, and result in light-abundant and expansive open-plan living accommodation. The Ground Floor is currently comprised of a large double reception and a kitchen. A sizeable 40 ft lawned rear garden is accessible through the rear. The First Floor offers two bedrooms, both of which are serviced by a family bathroom at the rear. There is a third bedroom at the front that could also be used as a home office. There would be provision to extend into the loft (STPP) to add additional square footage. Fleetwood Road is a quiet, tree-lined residential street on the coveted Dollis Hill Estate. Situated within easy walking distance of the area's amenities including a selection of local delis, shops and cafes. Excellent transport links include access from Dollis Hill (Jubilee - Zone 2) Station, good bus routes & the M1 motorway not being far away. Brent Cross Shopping Centre is also a short drive away.  The area also has access to good local state schools as well as private schools.  The open space of the stunning 86 acre Gladstone Park is nearby with its outdoor gym, tennis courts & café. Viewing is highly recommended.

Set in a prime N15 hotspot this beautifully transformed four bedroom terraced home, which is situated on a peaceful residential street has been carefully restored offering access to a number of schools, restaurants, shops and number of transport links nearby.Set over three floors, this property provides elegant living accommodation with ample space. This attractive home has been re-modeled and refurbished to an exemplary standard with impressive interiors from top to bottom including restoring much of its original character.The property comprises of an entrance hallway, expansive through reception with original parquet flooring and high ceilings, a fitted kitchen with access to a peaceful garden. The garden provides an excellent oasis to relax and unwind and is a real sun trap during the Spring and Summer months.The first floors enjoys two double bedrooms both of which are nicely decorated and there is a spacious family bathroom with an extra large bath and separate walk in shower. Finally, on the top floor, there is the well-designed loft conversion which incorporates the master bedroom with ensuite. Woodlands Nursery & Chestnuts Primary School is also moments from the property.Book into our viewing day to appreciate what this property has to offer!

With a large front and rear garden this three bedroom family home has a lot of space and potential to make it your own. This property has a large cellar as well as garage and off-street parking. Set along a quiet residential street in the heart of Shoreditch is this 3/4 bedroom, 2 bathroom house spread over 3 levels. Includes a private rear garden.   Set over approximately 94.6 square meters,  the ground floor includes a modern and tiled shower suite, under stair storage, naturally bright open plan kitchen to reception room leading to private rear garden and patio area.1st floor comprises of a stylish contemporary fitted bathroom suite, two bedrooms (one of which can be used as a separate reception room) with wooden floors and large double glazed windows. The top floor features, two further double bedrooms, with plenty of space for furnishings. The property comprises to the ground floor, a 16'6ft light and spacious lounge, fitted kitchen, bathroom and 14 ft conservatory which opens out onto a picteresque garden. It is also close to Tesco superstore at Charlie Browns roundabout as well as offering easy access into and out of London via thre A406 and M11.

James Hayward are delighted to present a five bedroom, semi-detached family home,arranged over three floors, with off street parking, side access and complemented by a generous sized west facing garden, which backs onto Holtwhites Cricket ground.  The property affords bright and spacious living accommodation, including a fabulous kitchen-dining/family room, utility area, an en-suite shower room to main bedroom and family bathroom and is ideally situated, walking distance from Gordon Hill main line station, bus routes and a plethora of local shops and restaurants on Chase Side.  This prime location offers great schools for all ages and is close to Enfield Town, motorways links, green spaces, sports & leisure facilities. In our opinion, totally worth a viewing.

Located within easy reach of Brockley station is this spacious, four double bedroom, two bathroom period house.Arranged over three floors, this mid terrace property features two separate reception rooms (one of which is bay fronted), a shower room and a 14' modern fitted kitchen-diner, with integrated oven & hob and wooden work tops, on the ground floor. A spacious and well appointed four bedroom family home with garage and parking space, which has been entirely refurbished and substantially extended. This three-bedroom Victorian terrace is a well-located family home, offering great proportions along with one of the larger gardens available in the immediate area. Offered to the market CHAIN FREE is this beautifully presented house situated on a residential street nestled between Streatham Common and Norbury Park. This fantastic property benefits from spacious and modern living, off street parking for two cars, a garage and a landscaped garden.  Accommodation comprises a lovely reception with a huge bay window, allowing plenty of natural light into the room and a lovely feature fireplace alcove, a family bathroom and four double bedrooms. The large top floor bedroom is full of natural light from the charming Juliet balcony and skylights. It also features an ultra - modern en-suite, built in wardrobes and eaves storage. The property is enviably located only a short walk from Norbury Station providing great links into London Victoria & London Bridge and only moments from the green open spaces of Norbury Park and Streatham Common. Freehold.  A truly unique award winning two bedroom stable conversion located in a securely gated mews situated in the heart of London providing a quiet oasis of comfortable and elegant living. There is a spacious and bright, fully fitted open-plan kitchen and large reception room on the top floor with two bedrooms and a bathroom on the ground floor. The lounge area has a stunning vaulted ceiling with skylights flooding the space with an abundance of light from the large windows and Juliet balcony. Full of character in a mews with tons of charm, a one of a kind. The property is a Lifetime Award wining terraced house conversion which at the time was the oldest working stables in London. Situated in a fantastic location for leisure and  travel, within close proximity to the transport hub that is Kings Cross / St Pancras and Angel Station.

An exciting opportunity to secure this charming mid terrace three bedroom bedroom, one bathroom house located on a sought after road in the heart of Brixton.The popular amenities and eclectic shops, restaurants and bars Brixton has to offer are all nearby. Incredible transport links are accessible from this property via Brixton Underground and Overground stations, giving access to the City of London and you can be on Oxford Street in 15 minutes door to door.

A spacious 4 double bedroom ex-local authority house situated in this most convenient of locations, right in the very heart of Angel,  moments from the City Road canal basin and the delights of Camden Passage. Accommodation comprises master bedroom with built-in wardrobes, 2 further double bedrooms and a bathroom on the 1st floor. On the ground floor can be found the reception room with access on to the private courtyard garden, separate kitchen, dining room also with access out to the patio garden, guest WC and another good size double bedroom. The house would benefit from updating but provides superb space in a central location and an opportunity to buy a freehold house at the price of a flat. Theseus Walk occupies an enviable position right in the very heart of the Angel between the City Road canal basin and City Road, affording superb access to an absolute wealth of local shops, bars and eateries, with particular note to those on Camden Passage, Upper Street and Exmouth Market. Angel Underground (Northern Line) provides convenient access to the City, as do the buses on City Road, with the transport hub that is Kings Cross/ St Pancras International (Eurostar Terminus) just 1 stop on the Underground, providing superb links to travel around London and to mainland Europe. The canal provides some scenic walks East towards London Fields, with Hoxton, Shoreditch & the City all within easy reach.

Offered in excellent condition, the ground floor comprises of a delightful double reception room with bay windows that gives access onto a stunning 17ft fully fitted contemporary kitchen / diner and a guest WC. There are also access from the kitchen onto a superb private and mature 40ft (approx.) garden. The first floor boasts three double bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. Whereas the attic has been cleverly converted to a master suite with walk in wardrobe and great ensuite. Maple Walk and Leopold schools and Roundwood Park open space are only a few minutes walk from the property. The nearest station is Willesden Junction (Bakerloo line / Overground).

Comments from the owner:Top 3 things you love about your homeQuiet, no through road which feels safeGround floor has it all, with open plan indoor/outdoor living and a quiet place to relaxThe light, house feels really spacious and bright (sun on front in morning and back in evening)Top 3 things you love about the area... Excellent proximity to Hither Green, Lewisham and Ladywell train stationsWe are walkers and are in walking distance of 3 play parks/greens as well as Lewisham Town Centre (for when we regularly have no milk it comes in handy)The Station Pub - good outside space (and a very good burger)Property Details:Superbly renovated and significantly improved by the current owners, this beautiful semi detached home offers bright and spacious accommodation with high specification finish, stylish interiors and modern design. Enviably located in a popular no-through road, the property enjoys quiet aspect, set back from the road by a generous driveway for off street parking, with a well tended south west facing garden to the rear with large decked area, pergola and useful side access.  Accommodation comprises entrance hallway with access to guest WC, stairs rising to the first floor and attractive 'Amtico' flooring (evident throughout the ground floor).  To the front of the property, there is an inviting reception room with wide front aspect window, bespoke inbuilt storage and feature fireplace with tiled insert and ornate surround.  A further generous reception/sitting room opens through to the  impressive full width extended kitchen/diner, flooded with natural light from overhead orangery style skylight windows and near-full width bi-folding doors onto the garden. This superb room offers excellent additional living space - ideal for family life - with plenty of space for relaxing and dining.  The kitchen area itself comprises a quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and breakfast bar area, incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, and further integrated appliances.  A door leads back through to a separate utility for additional work/appliance space.  To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles, each with inbuilt wardrobes, and a further single - plus an elegant contemporary style family bathroom with modern free-standing bath suite, separate walk-in shower unit, and 'Jack and Jill' basins.  There is additional potential to extend further into the loft space, subject to the normal planning consents, and this work has been carried out to a number of similar properties in the road.The property is conveniently located within access of Ladywell and Hither Green stations, with Lewisham station and DLR connections also within easy reach.  The area provides an array of local amenities, with nearby Lewisham offering a wider variety of shops, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities, and fashionable Blackheath with cafes, bars and restaurants, also just a short distance away.  The area is also well served lovely open spaces including Manor House Gardens, Hilly Fields, Mountsfield Park and Lewisham Park, and excellent local schools.

SUMMARYOnly moments from the lovely open spaces of Tooting Bec Common, this delightful three bedroom end of terrace house occupies a broad plot towards the top of Topsham RoadDESCRIPTIONOnly moments from the lovely open spaces of Tooting Bec Common, this delightful three bedroom end of terrace house occupies a broad plot towards the top of Topsham Road. As soon as you enter the welcoming entrance hallway, you immediately acknowledge this house gives a wider than average impression which continues throughout the property. Unveiled to the SE19 market is this charming four bedroom DETACHED family home situated on one of Anerley’s most desirable roads.A simply stunning, rarely available detached Victorian family home with a handsome brick façade. Arranged over three floors, the property is bursting with character and period features. The ground floor comprises of a fantastic sized entrance hall and two receptions, which have been opened up to create a sociable family living space. An inviting 21” kitchen/diner with wood burning fire offers comfortable space for informal socialising. The first floor comprises two generous sized double bedrooms and a third good size single, and a huge four piece family bathroom with luxurious roll top bath and double shower cubicle. The top floor houses a further double bedroom with plenty of light flooding throughout due to the Velux windows.Excellent transport links, with Anerley station less than half a mile away, with access to central and East London via east London line or British Rail links to London Bridge (Jubilee and Northern line). Birkbeck, Kent House, Clock House, Penge East and Penge West are also all within easy reach, also providing direct access to London Victoria (17 mins approx). The area is very well suited for families, with Betts Park on your doorstep, and the famous Crystal Palace Park and sports centre in close proximity – one of London’s best parks! Popular nearby schools include Harris Academy, Alexandra, St Johns and Stewart Fleming. The local area also boasts a wide array of independent shops bars and restaurants, such as the popular Bridge House on the edge of the park between Crystal Palace and Penge, and numerous establishments on the Crystal Palace ‘triangle’.Energy Efficiency Rating F

Q&A- Why are you selling? Looking to move closer to our family- What's the area like? Very central, well connected. You can reach anywhere in Central London within 20 min. Quiet and with lots of walking paths on the river and the canals. Beautiful park with the best kids play area in the Limehouse and Canary Warf area.- What is parking like? Parking permit to park on Spert Street/Narrow Street. We always find a space opposite our main entrance.Is there bike storage? My husband parks his in the hallway- How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? It is quiet at night. No issues.- I'm currently working from home, how does that work in this property? Both my husband and I worked form work, the open space on the top floor is ideal- What's the internet like? We have Plusnet and it works well. There is the option to have Fibre with HyperopticComments from the owner:Top 3 things you love about your home:- Modern warehouse feel of the top floor, open plan with lots of natural daylight- We love the ground floor self-contained snug as it is perfect for when you have guests staying over, or for a live-in au-pair/nanny scenario- The very spacious ground floor hallway that allows you to store your child buggy and a bike without making it difficult to navigate to the upper floorsTop 3 things you love about the area:- The closeness to the river. You can go out for beautiful walks down the river promenade towards Tower Bridge or towards Canary Wharf/Isle of Dogs- Central Location, very well connected . You can be in Central London within 15-20 min (Soho/ London Bridge/ Shoreditch)- Although it is very central, it is a quiet area and it has that village feeling. You have your local pub where you get to see neighbours and familiar faces. The best thing is enjoying a glass of wine and   watching the sunset on the river at The Narrow. Nothing beats that view.Property Details:Enviably located in a secure gated development with attractive central square just off historic Narrow Street, this stunning property offers modern living space with stylish finish and contemporary appeal.  Arranged over three floors, with further potential to extend into the loft space, STPP, this beautiful home provides fantastic ready-to-move-into accommodation in a superb location just a short walk from the banks of the Thames and a variety of fashionable local shops and eateries.  Accommodation comprises entrance hall with plenty of space for storage and access to a versatile ground floor bedroom/studio/reception room with en-suite facilities - ideal for occasional guests or au pere/nanny.  From the hallway, stairs rise up to the first floor landing with inbuilt storage and access to two well proportioned bedrooms plus a stylish family shower room.  The second floor provides bright and airy, loft-style living space with open plan reception/kitchen flooded with natural light from dual front aspect windows.  This inviting room offers excellent space for relaxing, entertaining and dining, with kitchen area itself comprising a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and central island incorporating inset sink unit, hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances.The property is very conveniently located within a short distance of the Canary Wharf business district as well as an array of fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. Limehouse DLR is just moments' away providing excellent cross-London links, as well as numerous regular bus routes connecting the surrounding area.  The River Thames and neighbouring Limehouse Marina offer excellent views and vibrant waterside amenities.

A charming four-bedroom town house set within a popular and  well-kept gated mews development - with allocated parking.Set within a popular and quiet residential development, the house is arranged over three floors and offers versatile living. Saunter through a well-kept front garden. Internally you are presented with an open plan reception on the ground floor, that measures over eight metres and rolls out on to a good-sized back garden. The reception area has wooden floors and neutral décor, with plenty of space to relax and entertain. A modern fitted kitchen sits at the other end with a good range of wall and base units, an integrated oven and hob and plumbing and space for white goods. The rear garden has a large patio area with planting bays and some well-established plants and shrubs. There is a shed at the bottom for all your tools and garden furniture.On the first floor you have a large bedroom that could be used as second reception room, it enjoys views of gardens and has the same wooden flooring that graces the reception room on the ground floor. The second bedroom on this floor is being used as an office currently but is a decent size and a well-presented bedroom. On the second floor, you have the master bedroom with an en-suite and built-in storage. The fourth bedroom is next along the hallway finished to the same standard and also has built in storage. The family bathroom has a traditional bath for a relaxing soak and a shower over the bath for the morning dash, a pedestal sink and W.C.The property is in-between two fantastic parks - Myatt's Field with its tennis courts, state-of-the-art play areas and boutique community café and Kennington Park also has a café, tennis courts and sports facilities to enjoy throughout the year. On Saturdays, you can wander over to the popular farmers’ market at St Marks church. Kennington (Northern), Oval (Northern) and Elephant and Castle (mainline, Bakerloo, Northern) stations are all less than a mile away. There are a myriad of bus routes waiting to take you into central London in under twenty minutes. You have two of Southwark’s best parks in short walking distance and the River Thames is less than 1.5 miles from your doorstep. You will be amazed at how central the location is, with the added benefit of being so close to Kennington, Brixton and Camberwell for your choice of eateries, boutiques and lively bars.

A Victorian property with bundles of potential, located in the heart of East Dulwich, available for sale freehold with vacant possession. A three bedroom Edwardian Period house set in the heart of Leytonstone on the tree lined Ferndale Road, close to both the hustle and bustle of the High Road and the tranquillity of the green open spaces of Wanstead Flats.Offered with no onward chain, this well-proportioned property has an impressive exterior, displaying characteristics typical of its era but once inside its true benefits are unveiled.Stepping into the hallway, high ceilings with details such as the cornicing still present, leads to the two reception rooms. To the front of the house the first sizeable room features an original wrought iron fireplace and large bay window, an ideal room to relax of an evening. The second reception also includes a character fireplace, as well as an easily accessed cellar, handy for additional storage.To the rear of the property, the kitchen is of a size to be able to include all the essential appliances with also enough space for a small table should you wish, with access directly out to the mainly paved courtyard garden.Upstairs, the master bedroom to the front is of a generous proportion, stretching the full width of the property. The second double is also of a good size, with the remaining bedroom a single, and finally to the rear the three piece bathroom. There is also loft storage, with the main boarded loft space accessed via a fitted pull down ladder.The property is within easy walking distance of both Leytonstone Central Line Station, and even closer at hand Leytonstone High Road Overground Station which is only a few moments away. Leytonstone High Road provides a pleasant mix of restaurants, cafes and pubs to socialise by day or of an evening, as well as some useful retail outlets including a Tesco Superstore. For those looking for a more full-on retail experience Westfield is only a short journey away, so too the iconic Olympic Park.The owner commented 'I have owned the property since 2006 and have really enjoyed living in the house and area. I have friendly neighbours and there is a good community spirit. The local residents association has regular meetings and organises events such as street parties and an annual spring clean of Wanstead Flats. Transport links are on the doorstep and my partner and I regularly cycle across Wanstead Flats to feed the ducks. The garden is small, but due to its south-facing direction it receives the sun of a morning and from 1pm onwards as well - one of my favourite things is to put my feet up and enjoy a good book in the afternoon sun. I will be moving to Bristol but in the interim, I will be renting, so the property will not have an onward chain. I am sure the next owner will enjoy their time here as much as I have'.To view this property, please get in touch with one of our friendly and helpful property experts.Room sizes:Hallway: 11'4 x 5'1 (3.46m x 1.55m) narrowing to 9'5 x 3'0 (2.87m x 0.92m)Lounge/Dining Area: 25'4 x 11'4 (7.73m x 3.46m)Kitchen: 19'8 x 8'6 (6.00m x 2.59m)Landing: 18'4 x 5'3 (5.59m x 1.60m)Bedroom 1: 14'8 x 11'2 (4.47m x 3.41m)Bedroom 2: 10'9 x 9'3 (3.28m x 2.82m)Bedroom 3: 12'9 x 8'8 (3.89m x 2.64m)Shower Room: 9'1 x 4'3 (2.77m x 1.30m)Bedroom 4: 8'8 x 8'5 (2.64m x 2.57m)Bedroom 5: 17'4 x 8'4 (5.29m x 2.54m)En Suite The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. Offering fantastic kerb appeal, this four bedroom mid terrace Victorian home is ideal for a growing family. The  Current vendors have spent the last year extending and modernising the property throughout to create one of the best homes that we have seen for a while.  The lounge to the front has original stripped wooden flooring, a cast iron fireplace, original covings and the double glazed sash windows are framed perfectly by the plantation shutters.  Having extended to the rear and the side return, the current vendors have managed to create a ground floor cloakroom and a truly stunning 27ft kitchen/diner to the rear.  The kitchen is fully fitted with integrated appliances and stone worksurfaces and the huge skylights and Crittall style doors to the rear bath the space with natural light.  The first floor certainly doesn't disappoint with a large bedroom to the front, a second double bedroom just behind and a large and luxurious family bathroom to the rear.  On the top floor you'll find a large master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and the smaller fourth bedroom that is currently used as a dressing room.  To the rear is a fantastic South facing rear garden that is a real sun trap and is perfect for hosting Summer BBQ's! The location is great with Blackhorse Lane just around the corner which a is currently part of a HUGE redevelopment programme and Blackhorse Road station is just over half a mile away.  ‘The Brew Mile’ is a great place to hang out and a visit to the ‘The Warrant Officer’ pub  that the Wild Card Brewery have  just taken over on Higham Hill Road is always a great shout.  School catchments are also brilliant with Hillyfield Primary being just 0.2 miles away and makes this a fantastic family home

Located on a quiet road moments from Woolwich Common, this impressive new build property boasts three double bedrooms and a 2000 sq ft garden all finished to an exacting standard throughout. Modern and minimal, this property has been thoughtfully designed to the highest of specifications to ensure a comfortable, sizable living environment. The ground floor kitchen is a bright and welcoming open plan space comprising of a generously sized lounge/sitting room and a modern kitchen containing premium worktops and market leading appliances. The space is perfect for entertaining guests with features like integrated appliances, skylights and bi-folding glass doors which open on to the charming fully landscaped rear garden, perfect for summer BBQ's and evening cocktails. The property is built with underfloor heating on the ground floor and nest thermostats throughout, ensuring the climate is always exactly as desired. It's a multi-functional and fluid space that can be molded to suit a range of ideas for hosting. The high quality presentation continues upstairs with three spacious bedrooms and two bath/shower rooms on the first floor. The two double bedrooms are fully carpeted with built in bedside lights. The rear double bedroom boasts large French doors and an abundance of natural light courtesy of the beautiful Juliet balcony. The master bedroom features a three piece en-suite bathroom containing a rainfall shower over the large tub, hanging toilet and a Bluetooth mirror to enjoy some relaxing music during a bath. Similarly the family bathroom is well proportioned and benefits from a shower enclosure as well as Bluetooth enabled fan and mirror. The second floor boasts a vast and bright bedroom with plenty of built in storage. With Ethernet connectivity points placed in each room, poor internet will never be an issue, putting your mind at ease if ever working from home. The property is thoroughly insulated and with an Energy Efficiency Rating of B, you can have peace of mind that you won't be largely impacted by the current energy cost crisis. The large private garden has already been fully landscaped and is ready to be enjoyed. Some of its many features include modern brickwork, beautiful cedar fencing, a brand new patio, lengthy flowerbeds, a sizable lawn and outdoor lighting. A unique advantage of the property is the 161 sq ft newly constructed outbuilding. This isn't your usual outhouse, it has been built to the highest of standards, fitted out with electrics, heating, lighting, Ethernet point, and a modern WC. It has the potential to be used as an office to work from home, a private gym or even a games room - the possibilities are endless.

Living / Dining / KitchenDesigned for modern living, with the option to really make the space your own, with two colour palettes to choose from, the Nature or Urban. The individually designed kitchens are a seamless blend of looks and functionality, featuring a range of the latest Bosch appliances. BedroomsWith ceiling height windows, modern detailing and a soft carpet, Fall asleep in luxurious, cosy surroundings and wake to morning sunlight. It's the bedroom of your dreams. While the parks' magnificent play area will keep children amused for hours. Residents can also keep fit on the tennis courts or simply jog along the park's pleasant pathways. Berkeley are working in long term partnership with London Wildlife Trust to continually encourage biodiversity within Cator Park. Handsome bay-fronted end of terrace half-house with a west-facing garden, just eight minutes from Peckham Rye Station and Bellenden Road. You’re even closer to Peckham Rye Park and Common’s 113 acres... yours at the end of the road! The property has a cool pared back style (white walls, stripped floors and doors - for example) and side access, and there’s potential to extend too. Permit-parking is on-street for residents. From the hall, take a right for your generous front reception room, of over 14 feet by over 11 feet. High ceilings, sash windows in the bay, and a central wood-burner impress. Your second reception (open to your first reception; there’s also a door from the hall) is over 12 feet by over 10 feet, and a very natural dining room. A sash window here looks onto the garden. Both receptions have custom-made shutters on their lower sash window panes. Beyond this room is the double-aspect kitchen of over 12 feet by nearly 8. Modern white fitted units and solid wood counters feature, and you’ve a practical tiled-floor. A part-glazed back door delivers you to the garden from here. Up the stairs and your windowed bathroom is set to the rear of the house, with both bath and shower. The (also windowed) w.c. is independent, next door. Two bedrooms complete the tour: these are over 12 feet by over 7 feet, and over 14 feet by over 13 feet. You’ve got sisal flooring in the first bedroom, and the second has stripped and painted boards. Peckham continues to be rather an epic place to call home. The restaurant, bar, shop and cafe offering is particularly strong, more often than not independently-run, and welcomes all ages. We particularly rate Artusi, Review, Ganapati, Levan, The Begging Bowl, Tonkotsu, Mr Bao, Miss Tapas, Peckham Bazaar, Forza Wine, Peckham Levels, and The Bussey Building and Copeland Park complex. Lordship Lane, in the other direction, has great spots and shopping as well. We like Franklin’s, Terroirs, SMBS, William Rose, Mons and Chener Books. Useful handy high street shops and banks are found on both Peckham’s Rye Lane and East Dulwich’s Lordship Lane. Nunhead’s fairly close too - for its cute high street and glorious Victorian Cemetery. On East Dulwich Road - a few minutes - just before you get to lovely Goose Green, you have a handy Tesco store and a classy parade of shops including a Hop Burns & Black, ice cream parlour and exciting newcomer cafe/bar: The Brougham. East Dulwich leisure centre is also on this stretch.Local schools include The Belham, Bellenden Primary and The Villa (Nursery and Pre-Prep.). Chain free and ready to go!Tenure: Freehold

The bathroom is contemporary in style with an over bath shower plus separate attachment, and large profile wall tiling. Rye Lane is also close for more shopping options (fruit & veg markets, banks and supermarkets), Peckham Levels, and The Bussey and Market Buildings. In the summer months, think rooftop and go vertical for Frank's and Forza Wine. Peckham's already firmly on the map, but there's even more to come - current regeneration projects include the Peckham Rye Station redevelopment. We're also very excited about The Peckham Coal Line. For further options, Camberwell, East Dulwich and Herne Hill are all close. Kids? Local schools include The Belham Primary, Bellenden Primary, and The Villa Nursery and Pre-Preparatory School.

A delight for the senses, this striking four-bedroom home has been beautifully restored and rests in a quiet north London enclave close to Bounds Green.Brickworks Says - Boldly redecorated with great love and care, this Victorian terraced house is a treasure trove of historic detailing and contemporary design touches. They combine to create a near-perfect, modern family home. Sumptuous and draped in colour, the ground floor is a dream to entertain in. The cosy and atmospheric bay-fronted living room connects with the luminous light-filled kitchen/diner extension with doors opening onto the garden oasis, complete with its own wood cabin. The considered design means each 'zone' feels self-contained yet provides a lovely, inter-connected flow.  Upstairs, the thoughtful layout continues. There are two large double bedrooms, an exquisitely designed bathroom with a soaking tub on the first floor, and a further two bedrooms, one en-suite, in the loft extension. Currently set up as a dressing room, the fourth bedroom would work equally well as a dedicated home office. Perched on the outskirts of the city, Bounds Green profits from lush parkland in all directions, a vibrant neighbourhood and excellent transport connections, whisking you to Central London in around 20 minutes. For all these reasons and more, it's easy to understand why this pocket of London is such a draw for families, young and old.The Owners Say - We adore this beautiful home that we have so lovingly created and will absolutely miss everything the area has to offer. We are incredibly lucky to be a short walk away from both underground (Piccadilly Line) and overground (Great Northern Rail). We have an abundance of green spaces close by and are in the catchment for an outstanding primary school which is quite literally at the end of the road. Our local pub, The Ranelagh, is excellent, as are the local friendly coffee shops such as White Fig and dog-friendly Hot Milk. The Organic store near Bounds Green Tube is very well stocked, and the rather splendid Myddleton Road market is where you can pick up everything from Artisan bakes to vintage finds. We're incredibly lucky to have wonderful neighbours all along the street. From coffee mornings to festive drinks, the Stanley Road community spirit runs deep. We have had some wonderful, memorable, happy years living here and shall greatly miss it.Points To Consider - The EPC gives a current Energy Efficiency Rating: C and a potential Energy Efficiency Rating: BIn the Borough of Enfield, the house falls into Council Tax Band D (£1,841.71 in 2022).The current owners have entirely updated the house. Large ticket items include a loft extension, creating two new bedrooms, and an ensuite- bathroom. The new principal bedroom on the top floor has many thoughtful touches, including rimless plastered-in recessed spotlights and 'hidden' storage. Downstairs, they built an open plan kitchen/diner extension with polished concrete floors and underfloor heating, plus a new WC and utility room. All the bathrooms have underfloor heating. Furthermore, they have replaced the boiler and added new windows throughout, including Velux windows in the loft bedroom. Outside, they've landscaped the front and back gardens and retiled the front path. In short, the house is being handed over in impeccable condition inside and out. Current monthly utility costs run at gas £56, electricity £70 and water £26.The house is being sold chain free.About Brickworks - Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: to bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home. Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us: brickworkslondon.comThe Legal Bit - While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

This fantastic four bedroom house backs onto the wide open spaces of Gunnersbury Park and has all the ingredients for a great family home.Upon entering through the smart front door you come to the bay windowed front reception with parquet flooring, this is open plan to the full width dining room and useful guest wc.  You then are lead on to the eye catching extended kitchen with central island and full width bi folding doors to the decked patio.The first floor has two double bedrooms, a single bedroom and a stylish family bathroom.  The loft has been converted to provide a further double bedroom with an en suite shower room.The rear garden has been well landscaped providing both a patio and Astro turfed lawn and there is a well built garage which could easily be converted to a home office.We love the fact this house backs onto Gunnersbury Park and is well located for a multiple choice of excellent school and transport options.

GUIDE PRICE £830,000 - £850,000 .Offered for sale on a CHAIN FREE basis and located in this popular tree lined residential road ideally places for easy access to both South Woodford and Wanstead Amenities including independent shops, an era of restaurant's and Central Line Stations.The property was built in 1989 by the existing owner and then the accommodation was greatly increased by a full width rear extension plus a Garage conversion to now boast a fantastic Open plan family room (28'6 Ft x 19'9 Ft) with views of the Landscaped rear Garden, there is a separate modern fitted Kitchen as well as an independent Utility room and Ground Floor W.C. The first floor features Three Double Bedrooms and a Contemporary Shower Room, We understand from the vendor that their is also potential for a first floor extension.

Top 3 things you love about your home1. The overall space available in the property.  We feel that what you can pay for a 2 bed flat round the corner you can get a 4 bedroom house with a front and back garden - it's a no brainer really! 2. Is a very secure house and I happily walk back alone late at night / stay in the house on my own overnight which can't always be said for other London places I have lived. 3. Love the garden - a saviour in lockdown - is a sun trap and enough space to sunbathe and have a few people over for a BBQ. Overall the property is great for entertaining - indoors and outdoors. Three things we love about the area.1. The community atmosphere on the estate is lovely and we actually know and trust our neighbours with a key.  Given the estate is on the edge of zone one it is surprisingly quiet and tranquil. When we wake up and look out of the bedroom window we see a lot of green which is unusual in such a central location and given we are on a council estate.  2. So many places nearby to exercise outdoors or have a picnic - not just Highbury fields which is a short stroll away, but also Paradise Park (and the lovely free city farm there with a great vegetarian café) and Arundle Square.  There are lots of play areas within a short walking distance - one almost directly outside the front door and for swings and more variety there is Thornhill Square, Arundle Square, and Paradise Park. Can get to Soho in 20 minutes and Kings Cross development in 10.  All the major stations are easy to get to, between Caledonian Rd tube (5 mins walk) and H&I (8 mins walk).  Great choice with the underground lines (Piccadilly and Victoria) as well as the overland trains which can take you all over London. 3. Great local coffee shops and pubs nearby - Southpaw coffee shop is the smallest coffee shop in London and our closest. Q&A1. Why are you selling? We purchased in 2015 for £725k but now need to move closer to family.  This house will be missed.  We have had a wonderful time here. 2. What's the area like? The immediate area is quiet but within moments you can be in the bustling heart of Islington.  Walking distance to Upper Street - great for getting to the many bars and restaurants, screen on the green, and the Almeida. Also - local find - the pleasance comedy theatre near Caledonian Road where you can get headlining acts doing their 'work in progress' for just £5!  Also nearby - Market Road tennis courts and gym which are local authority owned but do great classes.  on a Sunday we head to Hampstead Heath for a coffee and a walk. 3. What is parking like? Can park on the estate (if you buy a pass) or on the street - also need to buy a pass. As a rough estimate my car (an Iago costs about £125 per annum for the street parking - graded though depending on the omissions your car produces). 4. Is there bike storage? Yes for 3 adult bikes at the front of the house, plus room to store all the bike tools and equipment you could need next to it. 5. How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? the estate is pedestrianised and so there is no traffic noise 6. I'm currently working from home, how does that work in this property? It is fantastic.  Have, at times, had 3 adults all working here full time during the pandemic  (in separate rooms) and all successfully managed it.  We are able to pop out and have a choice of lots of nearby coffee shops and cafes to get lunch and within moments can be at Paradise Park for a quick stroll around and fresh air at lunch.  Dry cleaners nearby too.  Always very quiet so can have windows open and be on calls.  In the summer a lot of work is done from the garden. 7. What's the internet like? super band broadband.   I have done multi-day court hearings from home. 8. What's the boiler like? Good - not really sure what to say about this.  The house is very warm as it is well insulated and so the heating bills are modest.  Incredibly cosy house during the winter. 9. Are we able to do any work/extensions? I did the extension in 2012. Could turn the dressing room into a 5th bedroom if you boxed off the door to the bathroom.

Freshly Decorated Four Bedroom Home With Garage, Balcony and Sunny Garden. CHAIN FREE. This handsome four bedroom townhome, over three bright, newly redecorated floors, sits in the neatly designed and popular Vestry Mews development. The accommodation comprises an eat-in kitchen with utility room, large reception, three lovely double bedrooms, study / nursery room, WC and two bathrooms. A sunny balcony, garden and handy garage are all cherries on the cake.You're within walking of Camberwell's eclectic bounty of bars, cafes. The Camberwell Grove Conservation area is a delight and just around the corner. Bellenden Road is as easily walkable and offers a real ‘villagey’ vibe. Denmark Hill and Peckham Rye stations each have fast, frequent Victoria services and the fab London Overground Line which offers a handy Jubilee Line connection from Canada Water.Security gates from Vestry Road lead into the Mews where you meet well maintained rows of similarly attractive properties. A generous hall welcomes you with a tiled floor and crisp neutral décor. A handy guest WC to your left sits next to storage space under the stairs. The kitchen is straight ahead with plenty of cabinet and counter space. Double doors open to the garden where you'll enjoy a sunny, mature spot for some vino and al-fresco dining. Back inside you find an adjoining utility room, with space for multiple home appliances and access to the garage.  Up on the first floor is a generous rear-aspect living space running the full width of the entire building. Double doors open onto the balcony which enjoys views over the garden. There's a nicely proportioned bedroom completing this floor with fitted storage and a pleasant aspect. On the second floor you’ll find a light, bright landing with access to two more fantastic bedrooms. The master room boasts an adjoining en-suite and air conditioning for hot summer days. A neat study completes the tour and would equally make a fine nursery or single bedroom.  Both Peckham Rye and Denmark Hill stations (zone 2) are inside a 10 minute walk for services to London Bridge and Victoria and a whole variety of buses run into town along Peckham Road, just five minutes away. The London Overground will whisk you from Clapham Junction, through Queens Road and up to Shoreditch, Hoxton and Islington. Lucas Garden is a lovely leafy place to unwind. It has a popular play area and it's a real favourite of local dog walkers. Vestry Road has a pharmacy, restaurant and a well-stocked grocery store. Camberwell and its many bars and restaurants are but a short ramble - we love the Hermit's Cave, The Camberwell Arms and the Sun of Camberwell. Bellenden Village supplies the fantastic 'Victoria Inn' and 'Ganapati'. The popular Villa pre-prep and nursery is down the road and the Dulwich Foundation schools are a 12-minute drive away.

A stunning collection of newly converted homes in Walthamstow Village.This handsome Victorian building dates back to the 1870’s and was constructed by The Fuller Family, the same family that has completed the recent renovations. Following 150 years of family ownership, the site at Beulah Road has now been expertly redeveloped to provide 5 new homes, right in the heart of Walthamstow Village. The Fuller family commissioned award-winning Dow Jones Architects to develop plans that maximised the space whilst seeking a sympathetic design to complement the local neighbourhood. Each property has been beautifully finished with tasteful design features that highlight the age of the building. This end of terrace house has a sumptuous selection of original period features combined with a stylish kitchen/dinner, modern bathroom suite, private rear courtyard garden and large basement.Note: There is currently no parking available with this property.Explore - Beulah Road is widely regarded as one of the best streets to live on in E17 and it’s easy to see why. You are perfectly perched, right in the heart of Walthamstow Village, just touching distance of Orford Road. Walthamstow Village is one of the most charming and oldest villages in London and is renowned for its local produce shops and historic buildings. Orford Road is the main strip that runs through the Village and has an awesome selection of independent businesses. You have no less than four pubs all within walking distance, several places to eat and drink such as The Castle, Eat 17, Froth and Rind and Orford Tapas as well as the award-winning Spar to pick up those much-needed essentials. Throw into the mix Wildcard Brewery, Pillars Brewery and The Real Al Company / Trap Taproom, Mothers Ruin Gin Palace and Gods Own Junkyard at the Ravenswood Estate, the Ancient House and St Mary’s Church. You really do have everything at your disposal! And if you do ever feel the need to venture further afield, you have excellent transport links nearby. Walthamstow Central Station is just half a mile away with Victorian line tube and Overground trains into Liverpool Street.

Large Four Bedroom Victorian Home in Need of TLC - CHAIN FREE.Whilst this four bedroom period home needs a complete refurbishment, it offers a wonderfully proportioned interior, high ceilings, a sprinkling of period features and a location to get really excited about. The accommodation, over two bright floors, comprises a huge double reception, kitchen, three lovely double bedrooms, a fourth single bedroom and bathroom. The rear garden is a decent size. Transport links are ubiquitous and close by. Queens Road is but two minutes away for swift London Bridge services and the fab London Overground line. That'll have you strutting down Shoreditch High Street in no time. New Cross is about ten minutes for the other branch of the London Overground and further services.A walled front garden leads off the road where you'll enjoy some original cornice work on the exterior. Your inner hall is notably wide and offers access, through either of two doors, to that huge double reception. One could easily separate them into two fine sized rooms. Double doors lead from the rear of the space to the garden and there's an original feature fireplace to the front. Further down the hall you find a kitchen which too has garden access. The bathroom adjoins to the rear of the kitchen. Heading upward you find a long, spacious landing. Three of your bedrooms are healthy doubles and there's a fourth single room facing front. London Bridge services from Queen's Road Station take a mere 10 minutes! In addition, The London Overground Line offers services to Clapham, Canada Water (for the Jubilee Line), Shoreditch and Islington.  This is a well connected location with good bus links into town from the end of the road - the 436 will take you all the way to Paddington and once in Peckham you have the option of the ubiquitous number 12.  The 177 takes you up and down Queen's Road/New Cross Road all the way up to Greenwich/Deptford and the river. As York Grove is closed at one end, it's extremely quiet and certainly one of the most sought after in the immediate area. Peckham Rye and and Telegraph Hill parks are both 15 minutes walk. Edmund Waller and John Donne primary schools (outstanding and good Ofsted ratings) are within range. Shopping and leisure couldn't be easier with Peckham High Street and Camberwell close by. On your doorstep are the acclaimed Peckham Library, the Peckham Pulse Leisure Centre and boho amenities of Bellenden Road with cafés, bars and restaurants plus a good bookshop and boutiques - it's a pleasurable way to spend a Saturday afternoon! Kender Primary is a short stroll for the kids too. Even closer are the cafes and eateries of Queens Road. Kudu promises amazing food and Beer Rebellion has some fantastic craft beers. Other hotspots include Mama Dough, Well & Fed and the newly opened Peckham Cellars for fine wine. For coffee there's Blackbird Bakery and Well&Fed, and for excellent cocktails there's Smokey Kudu which is in the neighbouring railway arch to Blackbird. York Grove is also in the catchment area for the friendly and active ARARA residents association. It's a fab way to meet all your lovely neighbours!
