Galloways are delighted to offer this three-bedroom end of terrace house to the market. The property has a contemporary fitted kitchen, two reception rooms, two bathrooms, and the potential to extend into the loft space and the rear subject to planning permissions and consent. The property does require some work to the garden and garage. Located within the catchment of St Julian's Primary school.Safeguarding Your InformationImportant information regarding cybercrime. It has come to our attention that computer hackers are seeking to target property transactions to access funds. As we understand it, they will either hack a phone, tablet, or PC, maybe by sending out a random email that mistakenly gets opened, or even whilst opening a website, which gives them access to that machine. The reason for us mentioning this to you is to alert you that once they have gained access, they can monitor email correspondence, without you knowing, throughout a transaction. Then, at a relevant point, e.g. just before the exchange of contracts, they can send an email to a client mirroring that of their solicitor asking for funds to be transferred to a certain bank account. That money then, of course, disappears. Fortunately, we have not had such an instance but, feel it important to highlight the fact that if you do receive an email requesting funds, it is worth checking with the person concerned by phone that it is genuine and the bank details are correct, before sending money. This could, of course, affect other areas of finance beyond the property. Solicitors are starting to highlight this point now, but for safety, we would urge you to be vigilant and check before sending money or passing on any personal details regarding any bank or credit card information.The Property Misdescriptions Act 1991These particulars are set out as a general outline in accordance with the Property Misdescriptions Act (1991) only for the guidance of intending purchasers or lessees and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Details are given without any responsibility, and any intending purchasers, lessees or third parties should not rely on them as statements or representations of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to the correctness of each of them. Lease details, service charge, ground rent are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed by your solicitor. We believe you may benefit from using the services of our solicitors, independent financial advisors and surveyors, the Providers, who are known as Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, Hawke Financial Services and MAP Surveyors. Galloways always refer sellers and purchasers to Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with the named companies. Should you decide to use Lewis Nedas Law, Bargate Murray Solicitors, you should know that we would receive a referral fee of £180.00 inc VAT from them for recommending you to them. It is with great pleasure that we offer for sale this most appealing semi detached family home which occupies an excellent sized plot on arguably The Heatons premier and most sought after road. The property retains much of the charm and character of its era, sadly lacking in todays more modern constructions, and in our opinion is sure to appeal to even the most discerning of buyers. The property has been thoughtfully extended by our vendor to the ground floor and rooms include a hall, three super reception rooms, a beautifully refitted kitchen diner and a downstairs shower room. From the hall stairs lead down to a very useful range of cellar rooms, one of which is used as a utility room. An elegant staircase on the ground floor leads to the first floor where there are three bedrooms, a bathroom and a further staircase leads to the second floor and the fourth bedroom. Gas central heating is installed and powered by a Vaillant combination boiler located in the cellar. There is a driveway providing off road parking for several vehicles and leading to a detached double garage to the side. The property occupies a wider than average plot and this is reflected in the beautiful rear garden which is extremely well stocked and affords an excellent degree of privacy. Princes Road is convenient for local shops, bars, restaurants, cafes, sports facilities and schools of high repute. For commuters Heaton Chapel train station is less than a one mile walk away and operates into both Stockport and Manchester centres. NO CHAIN INVOLVED!

THE GRASS IS DEFINITELY GREENER AT GREEN PASTURES  Built in the late 1970's by Hampson & Kemp this executive development, of mainly detached homes, was way ahead of its time.  Designed as a North American concept, with a wonderfully proportioned first floor lounge you will discover a unique contemporary home.  Not only have you got the first floor lounge, you also have a large downstairs sitting room open plan to a spacious dining area.  It is here where you'll also properly appreciate the size of the plot with a huge south facing garden in an elevated position above what has now become part of the Pennine walk (accessed by a footpath nearby).Also, downstairs there is a luxury kitchen, whilst you have integral access to a double garage and an excellent utility room.  Back upstairs, you'll find a principal bedroom which is 18'7 x 16'5 with a luxury ensuite shower room which enjoys underfloor heating, a family bathroom of similar specification also with underfloor heating, a further double bedroom and two more bedrooms to complete over 2000 square feet of living space (including the garage).The location in this immensely popular village, is within a short walk to the Metrolink with bus transport equally convenient and the motorway network and international airport so accessible, as is the railway station at East Didsbury and the mainline Manchester to London line in Stockport. THE STORY OF CEPHAS LINNEY  Cephas Linney hales from the Victorian period and was a notable character in the Heaton Mersey community. He was a coal merchant, removals specialist and well respected philanthropist. His gravestone resides in the Congregational church near to where he once lived.  A local pictorial history book shows the houses that Cephas built with his brother on Mersey Road. They had adjacent semi's and proudly named them Mersey Villas, completed in 1892 as the date stone declares and were the first homes to be built on that side of Mersey Road.  The area has changed and Mersey Road is now an eclectic mix of charming family homes, within the prized Conservation area, that are so sought after. Cephas would be delighted to see his home today where the character still prevails with the sash windows in abundance and the cornices, picture rails and ornamental bosses still in all their glory.  Today the corner plot tells a different story; the old stables have gone, replaced with elegant new homes, but the drive retains the cobbles that once carried Cephas' coal over them. It is also a three storey home these days with an additional en-suite split level bedroom with adjacent dressing area to add to a beautiful first floor bedroom with feature fireplace, another double bedroom with yet another fireplace and generous rear fourth bedroom. Downstairs there is a stunning lounge with another sumptuous cast iron open fireplace, then a superb fitted kitchen with integrated Neff appliances and large island with granite worktops, a dining room, utility room and WC. To complete the picture there are three cellar chambers with good head height with heat, light and power. The corner garden plot has been landscaped with Indian stone split level patio area, pet and child friendly artificial turf, the original cobbled area which can provide off road car parking and a bespoke garden studio in anthracite grey which is fully double glazed and insulated with light and power.  Its versatility means it could  be used as a home office, playroom or as per its current arrangement a delightful gym.Mersey Villas is within walking distance of Priestnall Secondary, St Johns, Didsbury Road and St Winifred's primary schools, Heaton Mersey Common with its 11.5 acres of woodland and the village centre.  The international airport, main London to Manchester rail line, the Metrolink and the motorway network are all a short drive away.Altogether a delightful family home, a little piece of local history and a super addition to the marketplace.  THE ACCOMMODATION COMPRISES   GROUND FLOOR   STORM PORCH  Original tiled floor. ENTRANCE HALL 13' 6" x 3' 11" (4.11m x 1.19m) Half glazed front door with glazed panels above. Excellent opportunity to purchase this substantial detached family home on the prestigious Green Pastures in Heaton Mersey, offered to the market for the very first time since being bought as new by the current owner over 40 years ago. Backing onto greenery, promising a substantial floorplan internally with bedrooms, two bath/shower rooms, and two living rooms, and with further opportunities to extend to the next owner’s own specification, this true Heatons gem will not be gracing the market for long with internal inspections warranted to appreciate the home on offer.Ideally-situated in an equidistant position between Heaton Moor and Didsbury villages both of which offer a vast array of local amenities and within walking distance to East Didsbury Metro/Rail stations, Green Pastures is also comfortably situated away from the busy main roads in a particularly leafy area of the desirable residential setting of Heaton Mersey. Zoned for reputable primary and secondary schools, the street is an ideal choice for growing families looking for their forever home.Entering through the front porch, the ground floor is briefly comprised of: internal entrance hallway with useful downstairs WC, open-plan kitchen/breakfasting room including attractive fitted units, cupboards, a range of integrated appliances and ample room for a small breakfasting table, a spacious open-plan L-shaped living/dining room area that opens directly out onto the rear patio via sliding doors and including its own integrated storage cupboard under the stairs, a separate study area currently used for extra storage, and a much larger-than-average integral double garage that offers a versatile space for either extra storage, parking, or would be ideal for development into an extra reception room, work space, or annexe. Single flight stairs to the first floor grant access to all four bedrooms each of which are well-proportioned that are ideal for the growing family. The largest of the rooms to the rear boasts its own en-suite shower room and integrated wardrobes over looking the substantial garden to the rear. The second and largest of the reception rooms may also be found on this floor spanning almost 18’ in depth and benefiting from its own south-facing balcony directly off the sliding doors that enjoys the sun through the day. A separate play/study room to the rear overlooking the garden offers yet another versatile space that is ripe for all sorts of uses. Completing the floor is the family bathroom comprised of a white three-piece suite with integrated cupboard. Externally, there are mature gardens and a larger-than-average paved driveway to the front offering the benefit of off-street parking. To the rear, the immense landscaped garden backs onto greenery adding to the privacy and idyllic feel of the home and is comprised of a mixture of patio and lawn with a covered area below the play/study room at the rear of the first floor.

No1 Castlefield will sit proudly at an exciting new gateway to Manchester city centre providing 419 stylish apartments which will appeal to investors and homebuyers alike.This landmark development  will help signpost the south west approach to the city, benefiting from the close proximity to the Cornbrook Metrolink Interchange where plans are being drawn up for a world class transformation of the area.The red brick façade of street facing apartments at our new development respectfully complements the scale and appearance of the neighbouring buildings while the site is sympathetically framed by a 16 storey tower at the rear, crowned with private roof terraces. Broad passageways are formed between the surrounding four blocks providing a sense of space and access to attractive courtyards. A striking aspect of the development is the innovative rooftop houses with their private terraces and access to landscaped gardens.Stepping inside, the interiors are designed to meet the expectations of today's city living with a consistent and stylish contemporary approach which will appeal across the range of homes on offer.No1 Castlefield is a desirable new development which reflects the continuing growth and confidence within the city and offers all the advantages that easy access to its attractions can bring.No1 Castlefield offers an appealing choice of accommodation comprising one, two and three bedroom apartments, two and three bedroom duplexes, and top floor duplex penthouses with roof gardens are a feature of the development. The distinctive rooftop houses offer a modern take on the traditional terraces in the area.  The accommodation is spread across four attractive blocks including the signature tower. This carefully designed internal space, formed with glass, allows a sense of the outdoors all year round - and, when the weather's fine, sliding panels enable you to feel the sun on your face.The scheme also allows for 138 underground parking spaces, with commercial units providing active street frontages. All apartments will be hallmarked by the clean, contemporary lines and attractive living spaces that distinguish our developments. Quality fittings and fine finishes combine seamlessly to provide a real sense of coming home, while our trademark commitment to outdoor space means that every resident has the opportunity to get out, relax and unwind.THE LOCATION:Castlefield is an inner city oasis of quaint cobbled streets, canals and waterside al fresco wining and dining. Britain's first Urban Heritage Park - with its attractive canal basin, open spaces, converted mills, bridges and viaducts - has become one of the city's most sought-after residential areas. It is particularly popular with professionals who combine the undoubted lifestyle benefits with close proximity to the city centre and excellent road and rail access.  With a heritage dating back to Roman times, Castlefield today offers vibrant, modern waterside living, complemented by appealing bars, restaurants, music and entertainment.  Among the attractions are the celebrated Castlefield Bowl outdoor arena, The Castlefield Gallery and the popular Museum of Science and Industry.Castlefield is quite simply a haven at the heart of the city offering a more relaxed pace of life - but you can be sure that, when the bright lights of the city centre beckon, yoU always be close at hand.

Property description An attractive Edwardian Semi - detached family home retaining a host of period features, located within a short stroll to Didsbury Village and large local parks. Exceptionally rare opportunity to purchase this vastly extended and extensively improved detached family residence on the sought-after street of Alexandra Road in Heaton Norris. Leaving little to be desired inside and out with a large rear garden, double-storey rear and a side extension, the property is in a ‘turn-key’ condition set in the heart of a coveted residential area that is especially attractive to growing families, particularly with the popular Norris Bank Primary School just around the corner. Internal inspections are considered essential to appreciate the accommodation on offer with early viewings highly recommended to avoid disappointment. Alexandra Road is ideally situated in the heart of the popular residential area of Heaton Norris, which is highly regarded for its reputable local schools, green spaces and excellent transport links via the M60 Ring Road and A6 into Manchester. The property also has easy access to Heaton Moor Road via Green Lane, which promises a wealth of bars, pubs, and retail outlets. Entering through the front porch, the ground floor is briefly comprised of: large entrance hallway with understairs storage, versatile snug/play room to the front with characteristic bay window, living room area to the rear that could serve a variety of other purposes too, a separate utility area plumbed-in, a partially-tiled downstairs shower room consisting of a white three-piece suite including a walk-in shower. Surely the main highlight of this property is the immaculate open-plan T-shaped kitchen/family room to the rear that features stunning granite worktops, shaker-style units, breakfast bar, a range of integrated appliances and is well lit by a dual aspect window/skylight combination with bi-fold doors leading directly onto the rear garden.Turning stairs to the first floor landing which grants access to all upstairs rooms, including five well-proportioned bedrooms that feature four comfortable doubles and a versatile smaller room to the front currently used as an office/work-from-home space. The family bathroom completes the floor with modern tiling, a four-piece suite including a free-standing bath, and a useful integrated cupboard for storage.Externally, there is ample opportunity to the front for off-street parking on the larger-than-average driveway. To the rear, the delightful garden is two tiered across modern paving and a lawn that enjoys the sun in varying parts through the day. The property backs on to a large open green space, adding to the appeal of this well-appointed home.

We have been advised by the vendors that the property is Freehold.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

A BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED, EXTENDED SEMI DETACHED home, offering WELL BALANCED ACCOMMODATION, situated at the HEAD OF A QUIET CUL DE SAC within WALKING DISTANCE OF DIDSBURY VILLAGE. 1615 sq ft. The accommodation consists of an entrance hallway with downstairs WC, bay fronted living room opening into the dining room with patio doors to the rear garden, an extended, open plan dining kitchen and an integral garage. The first floor reveals four well-proportioned bedrooms served by an ensuite to the master and a stylish fitted family bathroom. Externally there is a driveway providing ample off road parking and a landscaped, private garden to the rear. An exceptional semi-detached family home, offering beautifully presented, perfectly balanced accommodation extending to an impressive 1615 sq ft. The property has been thoughtfully extended to the side and rear and is positioned at the head of a quiet cul-de-sac within walking distance of both Didsbury and West Didsbury villages and in the catchment area for local reputable schools.The accommodation reveals a bright and welcoming entrance hallway with stairs to the first floor, AquaHeat underfloor heating which continues throughout the ground floor and a downstairs WC. The living room is positioned to the front and measures with bay window to the front flooding the room with natural light, an opening leads through to the dining room with patio doors leading out to the rear garden. To the rear is generously sized open plan and extended dining kitchen with piped surround sound, two Velux windows and double doors allowing direct access to rear garden. The kitchen is fitted with a comprehensive range of contemporary wall and base units with granite work surfaces over, integrated Neff appliances and a door leading into the larger than average integral garage with utility and a Hörmann up and over door.The first floor reveals three double bedrooms and a further good sized single, all offering ample space for fitted or freestanding furniture. The master bedroom is served by a stylish en suite shower room with underfloor heating and new Aquadart Venturi fittings with Niagara Observa rainfall shower. The property is further served by a modern family bathroom with a four piece suite with underfloor heating, new Aquadart Venturi fittings with Niagara Observa rainfall shower, a roll top bath, wash basin and WC. In addition, further benefits include: a Worcester 2000 boiler fitted in Dec 2019 within warranty, LED lighting throughout and a security system with PIRs.Externally the property is approached via a block paved driveway returning the full width of the frontage allowing access to the integral garage and providing ample off road parking. To the rear is an enclosed, private landscaped garden, mainly laid to lawn with a newly laid Indian Stone patio area and an elevated decked sun terrace, suitable for summer barbeques and al fresco dining.

An ATTRACTIVE, THOUGHTFULLY EXTENDED semi detached FAMILY HOME, discreetly positioned on an EXCLUSIVE CUL DE SAC within a MOMENTS STROLL of DIDSBURY VILLAGE. 1440 sq ft. The accommodation consists of an entrance hallway, dining room with bay window, extended kitchen opening into the living room with double doors to the rear garden, a separate sitting room, downstairs WC and utility room. The first floor reveals three double bedrooms and a fourth single, served by an ensuite shower room and a family bathroom. Externally there is a driveway to the front and a stunning PRIVATE GARDEN to the rear. Video Tour:  A well-presented semi-detached family home which has been thoughtfully extended to create a magnificent family home, with spacious and well balanced accommodation extending to 1440 sq ft. Positioned on an exclusive cul de sac within a moments stroll of both Didsbury and West Didsbury villages and within the catchment area for local reputable schools.The accommodation consists of; a bright and welcoming entrance hallway with an under stairs storage cupboard and stairs leading to the first floor. To the front of the property is the generously sized dining room with a bay window flooding the room with natural light, overlooking the garden frontage. To the rear is the extended, modern kitchen, fitted with a comprehensive range of wall and base level units with an integrated oven and gas hob with space for further appliances. An opening leads through to the living room benefiting from a feature fireplace and a door providing access to the attractive rear garden. Further accessed from the entrance hallway is a second spacious sitting room with a large window overlooking the rear garden, a utility room and a downstairs WC.The first floor reveals four well-proportioned double bedrooms, three of which offer ample fitted wardrobes and the master suite benefits from a modern en suite shower room providing a shower, wash basin and bidet. The property is further served by a family bathroom with eaves storage and a separate WC. In addtion is a large boarded loft space with lighting.Externally to the front is flagged with a mature garden alongside. To the rear is an stunning, private garden, mainly laid to lawn with well stocked borders and an Indian stone patio area, ideal for al fresco dining and entertaining.  In addition is gated access to Sandileigh Avenue.

A rare opportunity to purchase a substantial five bedroom family home in a popular Didsbury location. A fantastic five bedroom, two bathroom, period semi detached property that has been greatly improved By the current owners including cellar conversion, extended kitchen and ensuite bathroom.The very well-planned internal accommodation comprises briefly: entrance hallway with mosaic tiled floor, lounge with large feature bay window to front aspect and fireplace. This central hub enjoys the building?s lancet windows and includes a new set of French doors that open on to a privatecourtyard. On the second floor is a luxurious main bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and en suite. There is also a useful eaves storage space.

We are instructed to invite offers in excess of £550,000 for this 5 Bedroom end terraced of three which is situated with easy walking distance of the popular Monton town centre. Bridgfords are delighted to market this deceptively spacious family home offering great versatility and space. Accommodation includes a large dual aspect living room which can be open plan or split to three rooms, 22ft open plan family room and fitted kitchen and utility room at ground floor level. Stairs ascend from the spacious entrance hall to provide four bedrooms and a family bathroom with separate WC. Stairs ascend to the final floor which provides an attic room/fifth bedroom. Externally the property has a driveway for ample off road parking and a private rear garden. The property also has great scope for conversion/extensions subject to the necessary planning constraints. Planning permission has previously been granted for an extension. Bridgfords would strongly recommend a viewing of this charming home.Manchester Road is a sought after road within easy walking distance of Chorlton Village with its bars, restaurants and boutique shops. Chorlton provides easy access to a wide range of amenities along with fantastic public transport links with both St. Werburgh’s and Chorlton Metrolink Stations providing access to Manchester City Centre and Media City. Manchester Road is also on the 86 bus route to the City Centre.

NO VENDOR CHAIN! LOCATE ESTATE AGENT are delighted to bring to the market this extended well presented four bedroom family home located on the popular Stretford Road in Urmston. The impressive layout of the property offers an abundance of space with several reception rooms and four good sized bedrooms. The accommodation comprises of entrance hallway incorporating the downstairs WC, bay fronted living room, rear sitting room, shower room, dining room and breakfast kitchen. The property would make an ideal family home and is available to view by contacting the Locate team at our Urmston office.

A SUBTANTIAL, FOUR DOUBLE BEDROOM SEMI DETACHED property with SOLAR PANELS, which has been thoughtfully EXTENDED and MODERNISED throughout creating a EXCEPTIONAL FAMILY HOME. Located within strolling distance of DIDSBURY VILLAGE, Fletcher Moss Park and both the train and Metrolink stations at East Didsbury. 1428 sq ft. The living accommodation briefly comprises of: entrance porch, hallway with downstairs WC/cloaks, sitting room with bay window and an open plan & extended family living kitchen with bi-fold doors to the rear garden. The first floor reveals four double bedrooms bedrooms with an ensuite to the master bedroom and a stylish four piece family bathroom. Externally the property has OFF ROAD PARKING to the front, whilst to the rear is a fully ENCLOSED LANDSCAPED GARDEN.A magnificent, substantial semi-detached property which has been thoughtfully extended and modernised throughout creating an exceptional family home benefiting from solar panels with 12 years left on the feed in tariff. Positioned on a popular residential road, located within strolling distance of Didsbury village, Fletcher Moss Park, both the train and Metro link stations at East Didsbury as well as being within the catchment area of popular primary and secondary schools. Extending to an impressive 1428 sq ft the beautifully presented accommodation consists of: a porch, entrance hallway with stairs to the first floor, under stairs storage and a downstairs WC/cloaks. There is a bright and spacious sitting room with a large bay window to the front aspect. To the rear is the spectacular open plan family living kitchen, which is flooded with natural light via two skylights and bi-folding doors which open to the attractive rear garden. Within the family living kitchen is ample space for a table and chairs, suitable for both dining and entertaining. The kitchen area is fitted with a comprehensive range of stylish wall and base units, complemented by granite work surfaces over and integrated appliances including: two double ovens, a dishwasher, wine fridge, a five ring gas hob and microwave, as well as having space for a washing machine and an American fridge/freezer. The first floor reveals a generously sized master bedroom with a contemporary en suite shower room, three further double bedrooms, two of which have ample space for freestanding furniture with the fourth bedroom benefiting from fitted wardrobes. The property is served by a stunning four piece family bathroom, providing a bath, walk-in double shower, vanity wash basin and a WC. Externally the property is approached via a block paved driveway providing ample off road parking. Whilst to the rear is a fully enclosed, private landscaped garden, laid with artificial lawn and a patio area providing a perfect space for entertainment and al fresco dining.

AMAZING THREE / FOUR BEDROOM DETACHED HOUSEABSOLUTE PRISTINE CONDITION THROUGHOUTDEFINITELY ONE FOR THE VIEWING LIST We are extremely pleased to have taken instruction in the marketing of this beautifully presented detached house which offers deceptively spacious accommodation with a potential of four very generous double bedrooms and two of them having the advantage of en-suite facilities. The property is situated at the start of Prestwich Park Road South, just off Bury New Road, and is extremely convenient for many amenities:  The village centre with its increasingly eclectic mix of bars, cafes and restaurants together with its many independent and corporate retailers is only a short walk away. The metrolink has its nearest station in the village centre and Manchester City Centre is about 15 minutes away and is easily accessibly by either car, bus or tram. For those needing to travel further afield, the M60/M62/M66 motorway networks are all on the Prestwich/Whitefield border at jct 17 of the M60. There are gardens to both the front and rear of the property, and as the property occupies an elevated position the front garden is tiered from the pavement upto the front door with a paved footpath connecting the two, the garden itself, is well stocked and maintained. To the right hand side of the garden is a detached double garage with a 'remote control operated' sectional rollover door to the front and a separate access door to its rear, which leads to the side of the property. We are informed that the garage benefits from a power, lighting and water supply and also has a mezzanine style floor internally which is ideal for storage. In recent years the property has been substantially upgraded, with most rooms having been replastered, skimmed and redecorated, all three bathrooms and the kitchen have been refurbished and all the external barge boards, soffats, downpipes and gutters have been replaced in plastic. The property is heated by gas central heating and is fully double glazed throughout. As you access the property through the front door the accommodation is as follows: You are straight into the reception hall and to the right hand side, are three doors which give you access to, first of all, the first of the double bedrooms with its fitted furniture to two elevations and patio doors with a juliette balcony overlooking the front garden, the next door leads you into the well equipped utility room, which houses the central heating boiler, is plumbed for a washing machine and vented for a dryer. The last of the three doors takes you into the partially tiled family shower room with its wc and wash hand basin in white and a separate walk in shower enclosure. There is also a built in cloaks cupboard adjacent to the shower room. On the opposite, left hand side of the hallway is the first of two doors, which will take you into a lovely spacious lounge area, with its feature hole in the wall gas fire and its patio doors to the front, the lounge opens into the dining room where you will find another set of patio doors overlooking the front garden. All the rooms at the front of the property have the advantage of large patio doors leading out into the garden. From the dining room there is access through to the spacious kitchen at the rear, which is fitted with grey fascia'd base and wall storage units, complimenting worktops and an inset sink unit there is an integrated 'range' style gas cooker with an extraction unit above which is to be included. To the rear right hand side of the kitchen is a door that returns you back into the lounge. At the rear left hand side of the property is the largest of the bedrooms, and its certainly not the size you would expect, at nearly 7 metres in length, it has a lengthy run of quality furniture to one wall and to the opposite side is its en-suite bathroom, which has fully tiled walls and floor and inset downlights into the ceiling. It boasts a modern four piece suite in white, with a shower over the bath.  The next and final room on this floor is currently used as an office, but dependent on your circumstances would be ideal as either the fourth reception area or fourth bedroom and at over 14 sq meters, could certainly be classed as a double room. Like the majority of the rooms on this floor it also has patio doors, which lead out to the conservatory at the rear, which in turn has a door leading out into the garden. To the rear right hand side of the reception hall is the staircase which now takes you to the next floor, formerley the loft and with all the necessary building regs approval, this is now another substantially sized double bedroom with vellux rooflights to the pitched ceiling, it has an en-suite shower room with a white suite and step in corner shower enclosure and to the far side of the bedroom is an adjoining room which would be ideal as either a dressing room, home office or perhaps even a nursery. Sometimes words and photographs do not give full credit to the property and we feel that this property certainly falls into that category, consequently we would recommend contacting the office and making an early appointment to view as we are confident this property will not be on the market for long.

An EXCEPTIONALLY PRESENTED semi detached, which has been COMPREHENSIVELY UPDATED and REMODELLED, creating a WONDERFUL FAMILY HOME, located close to both DIDSBURY and WEST DIDSBURY villages. 1237 sq ft. The accommodation consists of an entrance porch, hallway with downstairs WC, living room with an opening into the extended family dining kitchen with double doors and bi-fold doors leading out on to the rear garden. The first floor reveals three well proportioned bedrooms served by a stylish family bathroom. Extending an impressive 1237 sq ft, providing perfectly balanced family accommodation consisting of: a porch with access through to the bright and welcoming entrance hallway with stairs to the first floor and a downstairs WC. To the front is the spacious living room with a curved bay window flooding the room with natural light with plantation shutters and a newly fitted wood burning stove. Double oak folding doors open into the dining room with bi-folding doors leading out to the hardwood terrace and an opening through to the extended kitchen which has a pitched roof with Velux windows, double doors to the rear garden, and is fitted with a comprehensive range of stylish units complemented with Quartz work-surfaces over, a Walnut breakfast bar and integrated appliances including: a fridge/freezer, oven, gas hob, microwave, dishwasher, wine fridge and washing machine. The first floor reveals three generously sized bedrooms, including two doubles with the master benefiting from a curved bay window to the front elevation, the second bedroom offers bespoke fitted wardrobes and the third bedroom, which is a well-proportioned single, also benefits from bespoke fitted storage.  The property is served by a contemporary bathroom suite with electric underfloor heating, extensive tiling, a freestanding bath, walk-in shower, vanity wash basin and WC. A truly spectacular home which has undergone extensive refurbishment within the last 6 years with further benefits including: new windows and doors throughout, full re-wire and re-plumb, electrics and plumbing run into the loft to allow for conversion, new radiators, fully re-plastered, Grohe taps throughout, plantation shutters to the front windows, new boiler (with 5 years guarantee remaining), loft boarded, CCTV and alarm installed (including garage), outdoor security lights fitted and a new garage door. Welcome to Bridgwater cottage This charming and picturesque, three bedroom period terraced cottage, which enjoys an idyllic position being located in the heart of the Historic Worsley Village and close to the Village green. The cottage is a 'stone’s throw' from the Bridgewater Canal and the local bars and restaurants, The Marriott golf & country club is less than a mile away and The Trafford Centre is only a short drive away. Despite the beautiful location, the cottage is ideally located for commuting to Manchester City Centre, Salford Quays and throughout the North West. The area is excellently served by schools, colleges and universities, with the ever popular Bridgewater school being within walking distance. The cottage has retained much original character and offers flexible and deceptively spacious accommodation, which briefly comprises; reception hall, lounge, dining room, a fitted kitchen, rear inner hallway, a utility room and a guest wc. On the first floor of the house you will find the master bedroom, with an en-suite shower room, two further bedrooms and a bathroom. There are delightful fenced and gated, mature and established cottage gardens to the front and a small courtyard utility area to the rear. There is a communal parking area to the rear of the cottage. The cottage also benefits from central heating and double glazing. An early internal inspection is recommended.

Situated on a sought after, tree lined road, this traditional three bed semi-detached property has an abundance of character. From the stained glass entrance porch, to the traditional high ceilings throughout, the gorgeous bay windows and open coal fire this is the perfect family home. Entering the property, a bright hallway leads off into the two reception rooms. The front with stained glass bay window and open fire. The dining room has a feature gas fire and French doors leading out into the suntrap of the south facing rear garden. The dual aspect kitchen ticks all the boxes and is ideal for those looking to add their own stamp. The separate outhouse is great for storage /utility room. Upstairs the landing with stained glass window continues the light and airy feel to the home. There are three good size bedrooms. The master benefiting from bay window and fitted wardrobes, the second double benefiting from views over the wonderful garden and enough space to use as a home office. A generous third bedroom with stained glass window. Externally, the property boasts a good size rear garden, with lawn and pathways around the mature borders as well as a patio area where you can relax or entertain.Situated within a stone throws of Chorlton's vast amenities which include independent restaurants, bars and shops such as the famous Barbakan Delicatessen and the Unicorn Grocery store. Additionally, the location is just a short walk to the Metrolink station providing fast access to the city centre, Media City and Manchester International Airport. A stroll down the road to Longford Park or Chorlton Meadows and easy access to several cycle paths. An excellent range of schools nearby.

A BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED bay-fronted semi detached property which has been SUBTANTIALLY EXTENDED, creating a SUBPERB, IMPRESSIVELY PROPORTIONED family home. Located in a highly sought after location only a stone's throw away from East Didsbury metro link and a short walk away from Didsbury, Heaton Mersey and Burnage villages.Extending to a substantial 1704 sq ft, this beautifully presented family home offers to the ground floor: an entrance porch leading into the hallway with attractive tiled flooring, stairs to the first floor, under stairs storage, utility room off and a downstairs shower room providing a shower, vanity wash basin and WC. There is a bright and spacious living/dining room measuring in excess of 25ft with stripped original floorboards, a bay window to the front elevation with a built in window seat with storage and a feature fireplace. French doors lead through to the conservatory which has double doors opening on to the decked terrace. Further accessed from the entrance hall and living room is the stylish, generously sized breakfast kitchen with tiled flooring and patio doors to the rear garden. Externally there is ample off road parking to the front via a block paved driveway. To the rear is a sizeable enclosed garden, mainly laid to lawn with a raised decked area with a pergola over and a further full width decked patio ideal for al fresco dining and entertaining.

Internally the property comprises; welcoming entrance hallway with modern downstairs wc, front living room with attractive bay-window and feature fireplace. A truly superb extended living/dining kitchen with central island, integrated Bosch appliances, Bi-fold doors  and built-in Dali ceiling speakers completes the ground floor accommodation. To the first floor there are three bedrooms including two large double bedrooms and a further good-size single bedroom. A refitted stylish Laufen bathroom serves all three bedrooms. Externally to the front there is a driveway providing ample off-road parking, gated side access which leads to the detached garage which boasts electricity and water, currently used as a home gym. Convenient and popular location close to all local amenities, local schools,  walking distance to Fletcher Moss gardens, Parrs wood cinema complex and Didsbury train station for the commuter.

If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

Surrounded by local parks and green space, shops and amenities, and with Levenshulme Train Station just a short 7 minute walk away; Poplar Villa is perfectly situated for anyone looking to make the most of what the area has to offer.As you walk up the path to this lovely double fronted family home, you are surrounded by private front and side gardens with laid to lawn areas, children's barked play area and ample space for seating and entertaining outdoors. Internally, the property briefly comprises of: bright entrance hall with high ceilings leading in to the lounge with dual aspect windows, bay window and feature fireplace with surround. Immaculate 3 bed detached house in sought after area with no onward chain. This beautiful home on the edge of Hale has been renovated to a high standard by current owners. Briscombe are delighted to offer for sale,  a beautifully presented, 2 bedroom cottage located on the prestigious Mill Brow in Worsley. SET WITHIN WORSLEY CONSERVATION AREA  AND OFFERED AS FREEHOLD, STUNNING PERIOD FEATURES, SET OVER THREE FLOORS, TWO RECEPTION ROOMS, REAR FACING CONSERVATORY, NOT OVERLOOKED TO THE REAR, MASTER BEDROOM WITH SHOWER ENSUITE, FIVE PIECE FAMILY BATHROOM, CLOSE TO MOTORWAY NETWORKS TO MANCHESTER CITY CENTRE/SALFORD QUAYS/MEDIA CITYBoasting stunning features including wooden beams to the ceiling and exposed brick walls this stunning and historic two bedroomed cottage offers a versatile living space over three floors. Situated on prestigious Mill Brow, Worsley the property was historically known as a home for 'waifs and strays'. Briefly comprising of a front accessed entrance hall with hand sink and guest w.c situated to the far side. Three exposed brick steps lead to the first reception room situated on the ground floor and currently utilised as the main lounge whilst fitted with a feature fireplace and inset gas fire. A second reception room to the rear elevation allows access to the kitchen via a feature stone and exposed brick staircase to the lower ground floor. Fitted with wooden wall and base units the kitchen/diner allows space for appliances and continues to a brick built conservatory with apex roof and double Upvc doors. Via an oak and glass feature staircase, the first floor landing allows access to the loft space via a hatch in the ceiling, the vendor advises that the sizeable loft allows for standing room and could offer the potential for further scope. The master bedroom benefits from built-in storage and a shower en suite, a second double bedroom is situated to the front elevation. The family bathroom is fitted with a five-piece suite comprising of a corner spa bath, shower unit, w.c and two hand wash basins. Externally, the property provides on-road parking to the front whilst the rear of the property remains not over looked with views over Worsley woods, whilst allowing for a lawn with borders and decorative stone patio area. Worsley Village, situated well for access to Manchester City Centre, Salford Quays and Media City, offers a selection of bars, restaurants and a tea room. Locally you will find The Marriott Hotel and Country Club with golf course, a firm favourite of many.

**THREE BEDROOMS PLUS LOFT ROOM WITH ENSUITE** This beautifully presented semi-detached property is located in the sought after area of South Swinton and within the Broadoak Catchment area. With accommodation spanning three floors, a large detached garage with remote control electric door, off road parking and large open plan living area, this house is sure not to disappoint! What’s more is this fantastic home comes with the added benefit of no onward chain!Step inside and explore the wealth of accommodation on offer in this beautifully appointed home. The downstairs is largely open plan and neutral in décor, yet still retains that cosy feeling. Carefully thought out in design, there are 4 rooms to this floor that are all open to each other, including a bay-fronted lounge with feature fireplace, spacious dining area, modern fitted kitchen and snug seating area, all of which are light and bright throughout. From the seating area you will find double doors that open onto the rear garden which is low maintenance in nature featuring a spacious patio area and artificial lawn. You can also access the detached garage from the garden, which cleverly houses a utility area, keeping it separate from your living space. The garage itself is larger than average, comfortably housing a car if needed, along with plenty of storage space and cupboards. Here you will also find the boiler. As you venture back inside and up to the first floor you will find 3 bedrooms, two doubles and a single, all of which feature shutters for that added privacy and high ceilings, creating a feeling of light and space. There is also a modern fitted shower room to this floor. From the landing area there is a staircase leading up to the converted loft space which is currently being used as a fourth bedroom with ensuite shower room, ideal for a guest suite, or perhaps even a home office!The location is simply spot on here with great local amenities and access to the motorway network allowing easy reach of Manchester City Centre, MediaCityUK and beyond. You are also within walking distance of both Monton and Worsley village for those who like to explore local cafes, restaurants, and shops, and for those who enjoy a weekend stroll, the loop line, and Bridgewater Canal are all within walking distance. For those with young families this house sits comfortably within the catchment area for Broadoak Primary School. DESCRIPTION  This two storey, end-townhouse on Springfield Lane is part of the innovative Irwell Riverside development by Urban Splash. Completed around 2018, these houses offer spacious riverside homes within a few minutes' walk of the city centre. Set over two floors and 1000sqft of living space, the entrance level has an impressive open plan living area with fitted kitchen and a WC. The Kitchen is fully integrated with side window and has a large island perfect for today's lifestyle of cooking and socialising simultaneously. The living area at the back has double patio doors out to the large rear garden and because it's an end-terrace house, it's wider and offers an additional side alley, ideal for storage. The garden is also beautifully landscaped with plants and a decked area perfect for dining and entertaining guests.The upstairs level has two good-sized double bedrooms and an additional room which could be used as a study or nursery. The study/nursery leads onto a balcony to the front of the house, the front double bedroom has a  large picture window with window seat and the back bedroom which is the largest has floor to ceiling windows offering lovely views over the rear garden. There is a main bathroom on this floor with a three piece suite and because it's end terrace it benefits from a window which most of the other houses don't have. All the rooms upstairs including the main bathroom have pitched roofs offering a bright and airy feel. . There is also parking to the back of the house, which is wider than most other houses, offering space for three cars (size dependant).Springfield Lane is just across from the River Irwell canal towpath and is only a ten minute walk to Victoria station offering great transport links. Deansgate is also 10 minutes away offering plenty of bars, shops and restaurants to enjoy. The property has easy access onto Trinity Way perfect for those needing to commute out of the city centre. GENERAL  Rental Yield: 5.1% (Based on expected rental of £1600pcm)Service Charge: £200paGround Rent: £250 paLease: 247 years from 2016Council Tax Band: B, Aprx £1,567.17 paManagement Company: RMG LIVING/DINING AREA  Wooden flooring, large window to the front of the house, double patio doors and single door to the rear garden, wall heaters, spotlights, sky installed and phone/tv point. KITCHEN  Open plan kitchen comprising integrated dishwasher, integrated fridge with freezer compartment, , four ring hob with extractor over, built-in oven, large island unit, sink with mixer tap  double glazed window, spotlights, splashback and wooden flooring. REAR GARDEN  Accessed from the living area, the garden has a decking area, landscaped planted and stone area, side alley and a gate at the bottom which leads to the parking and secure bin storage. STAIRS/LANDING  Carpeted stairs and flooring to the landing, storage cupboard, cupboard housing boiler and spotlights. BACK BEDROOM  Two large full-height double glazed windows, carpeted flooring, wall heater, pitched roof and spotlights. FRONT BEDROOM  Large double glazed picture window with window seat, carpeted flooring, wall heater, pitched roof and spotlights. STUDY/NURSERY  Double glazed door to the balcony, carpeted flooring, wall heater, pitched roof and spotlights BATHROOM  Three piece bathroom comprising bath with shower attachment over, WC, sink with mixer tap, built-in storage, wall mirror, heated towel rail, lino flooring, partially tiled walls, double glazed frosted window, pitched ceiling and spotlights. PARKING  There is parking for three cars (size dependant) to the rear of the property.

**FOR SALE BY INFORMAL TENDER** Introducing a rare opportunity to purchase a substantial 1920's semi-detached property in need of full modernisation situated on a popular road only moments from Northenden village and transport links. This stylishly presented property is situated in a quiet corner of the development, and boasts a larger than average private garden. With West Didsbury tram station just a 4 minute walk away and the cafes, bars and local shops that West Didsbury has to offer just a short 8 minute stroll away; this property is ideal for anyone wanting a quiet yet extremely convenient location. Lovingly decorated and maintained by it's current owners; the property is ready to move in to.The property comprises of; entrance hallway leading to a separate bright lounge with exposed brickwork, log-burner, large bay window to the front and French doors out to the garden. To the other side of the hallway; a modern kitchen with integrated appliances, under-stairs storage, open dining space and French doors out to the garden - an ideal area to entertain.To the first floor; a master bedroom spreading the full length of the property and providing space for a superking size bed, ample storage and dressing area if desired. The two windows on both sides of the room make the room bright and airy. Across the hall; a second king size bedroom with dual aspect windows, modern tiled bathroom with WC, wash basin and a bath with shower over. Externally, the property boasts a large secluded garden with laid to lawn area as well as a patio space for outdoor dining. To the front of the property there is off road parking.

To the front of the utility there is a garage with up and over door.To the first floor there are three bedrooms and a bathroom with four piece white suite.Externally there is a fantastic size sunny rear garden that is mostly laid to lawn with patio seating area. IMMACULATE THROUGHOUT.... Wow....A Substantially Extended Semi Detached Home in South Swinton that is simply move in condition! Entering into a gorgeous hall with a feature herringbone wood floor and a beautiful stained glass entrance, the 1920's build offers lovely high ceilings and original features, a very stylish and private lounge to the front. It is well placed for major transport links making it easy to commute across the North West. Well positioned for Moorside Schools.

With Reddish Vale Country Park, local amenities and well regarded schools all within a stones throw; this three bedroom home is ideal for anyone looking for a spacious home in a quiet yet convenient location. Reddish North train station is just a 15 minute walk away, providing access in to the City Centre and beyond.The property briefly comprises of: entrance hall leading through to the modern fitted kitchen with a range of wall and base units, integrated appliances and serving hatch to the dining area. The family lounge, to the rear, boasts sliding doors and views of the mature garden, aswell as opening up in to the dining room; a perfect space for family life.To the first floor: the master bedroom boasts fitted wardrobes and views over the garden. The second double bedroom also benefits from fitted wardrobes and space for double bed. The third, well proportioned bedroom, provides ample space for single bed and wardrobe space. The tiled family bathroom boasts three piece suite with shower over the bath.Due to it's prime position at the end of the quiet cul-de-sac, Beckside benefits from off road parking to the front for multiple cars and a separate brick built single garage. An EXCEPTIONALLY PRESENTED semi detached FAMILY HOME, with a STUNNING EXTENDED KITCHEN, and a LARGE GARDEN, located within strolling distance of Withington village and Fog Lane Park. 929 sq ft. Rare opportunity to purchase this vastly improved and extended two bedroom mid-terraced home on Chapel Street offering generous accommodation over four floors, including a useable cellar area, delightful garden room to the rear and large garden to the rear. Having been tastefully updated throughout by the current owners blending character and contemporary seamlessly, the property leaves little to be desired with an internal inspection warranted to appreciate the home on offer. Early viewings come highly recommended for this exceptional property! Chapel Street is ideally-situated in the popular residential area of Heaton Mersey in an equidistant position between Heaton Moor and Didsbury villages both of which offer a vast array of local amenities and within walking distance to East Didsbury Metro/Rail stations. Entering through the ground floor, the property itself is briefly comprised of: cosey living room to the front with exposed brickwork in the chimney breast with a log-burning fire and characteristic floor tiling, a contemporary shaker-style kitchen in-keeping with the rustic feel of the property featuring fitted units, cupboards, and cupboards, which leads directly onto the impeccable garden room in the extension to the rear that opens directly out onto the rear garden with bi-folding doors, which is west-facing and enjoys sun through the afternoon.To the first floor, there is a comfortable double bedroom to the front boasting original floorboards, fireplace and large windows/high ceilings allowing for a light and airy feel, with a family bathroom to the rear comprised of a modern four-piece suite including a walk-in shower. To the top floor, the second bedroom includes exposed beams and a fireplace adding to the charm of the room which is well-lit by a skylight. To the cellar, there is a useable space with electric that could function as a work-from-home space or merely as extra storage. Externally, the rear garden is comprised of a mixture of decking and lawn making for a wonderful space to enjoy the summer months especially with it being west-facing and enjoying the sun through the day. A shed to the end of the plot also offers further opportunity for storage.

A fantastic opportunity to acquire this chain free home which occupies a hugely desirable corner plot position on this popular residential road. With a large driveway frontage, it also benefits from a second driveway positioned behind the garden with a gate giving access.The accommodation comprises an entrance hallway with a useful understairs storage cupboard, the bay fronted lounge which now opens through to the dining room with a feature fire surround and double doors opening to the rear garden.  The generous kitchen is fitted with a comprehensive range of floor and wall units and houses an integrated oven, 5 ring gas hob and extractor hood, and provides space for a dishwasher, fridge, freezer and washing machine.On the first floor the landing leads to 3 well proportioned bedrooms and an attractive family bathroom.Externally the property makes the most of its corner position with generous gardens to both the rear and side of the house.  There is a driveway frontage, and the second driveway accessed from around the corner with gate through to the rear of the garden.

Clive Anthony are pleased to offer for sale this extended, three bedroom semi detached property being situated on the popular Winchester Avenue in Prestwich. This home briefly comprises; entrance hall, spacious lounge, dining room, morning room, kitchen, three bedrooms and a bathroom. There is a front driveway and garden as well as a rear courtyard. The property is well situated for local shops, schools, public transport links and with easy access into Prestwich Village and onto the motorway networks. An early viewing is strongly advised as properties in this location are in high demand. Ground FloorThe entrance hallway has a stairway leading to the first floor landing and provides access to the lounge and morning room. The spacious lounge provides ample space for lounge furniture, has a double glazed bay window with front views and feature fireplace. The morning room allows space for a table with chairs, allows space for an undercounter freezer and houses the floor mounted boiler. It also provides access to the kitchen and dining room. The modern kitchen includes a range matching wall and base units with co-ordinating work surfaces, sink with mixer tap, ‘Baumatic’ electric oven/grill, five ring gas hob with extractor above, allows space for a washing machine, dishwasher and under counter fridge. The dining room allows ample space for a dining table with chairs, has a feature wood/coal burning fireplace and a doorway that leads out to the rear courtyard. First FloorThe landing provides access to the three bedrooms and the bathroom. The master bedroom is a large double room with fitted wardrobes and a feature bay window. The second double bedroom allows space for freestanding bedroom furniture and has a double glazed window. The third bedroom allows space for freestanding furniture and has a double glazed window with rear views. The bathroom comprises of a corner bath, walk in shower enclosure with plumbed in shower, low level w.c, pedestal hand wash basin, fully tiled walls with complementary flooring and a frosted window. OutsideTo the front there is a driveway and garden, access can be gained down the side of the property to a rear courtyard. Additional InformationWe have been informed the property is Freehold with a chief ground rent of £5 per annum ( subject to solicitors confirmation)Council Tax Band CThe loft is accessed off Bedroom three which has a retractable ladder, is boarded and has lighting. It also houses the water tank.Gas central heating with radiators throughout provided by the boiler which is located in the morning room.

Right in the heart of Monton village lies this gorgeous three-bed terraced house with the added bonus of a converted loft room, ideal for a guest suite or home office. A periodic home with original features enhanced by stylish interiors, this spacious house is the ideal set up for a modern family.Enter the tasteful front garden, in to the house and you’ll be delighted with the immaculate presentation and stylish décor choice. First up is the large lounge, brightened up with daylight from the bay windows and high ceilings. The fitted cupboards and traditional fire place really add that extra wow factor to the room as well. Continue through into the second reception room, which is currently being used as a playroom, but traditionally set up as a dining area, this room is also a good size and benefits from a large window and skylight that allows and abundance of natural light to flood the room. From here you can access the kitchen which comes complete with an array of fitted units providing a great amount of storage, and a full range of integrated appliances such as dishwasher, full size fridge/freezer, washing machine and double oven. Plus there is space for a breakfast table if you wish. To this floor you will also find a handy under stairs storage cupboard. Another added bonus to this gorgeous period home is the South-West facing rear garden providing a nice little suntrap. With artificial lawn, planted boarders and a paved area, it’s ideally set up as a lovely green space which is also low maintenance. As you venture upstairs to the first floor you will find three bedrooms, the main bedroom spanning the full width of the property providing a lovely space to unwind in at the end of a long day. The second room is also double in size, whilst the third bedroom would accommodate a single bed or could be used as a home office. There is a 3 piece modern bathroom with fully tiled walls, a wall-mounted towel rail and handy storage units as well.Loft Room - Not only do you have three bedrooms, but this period home also benefits from a converted loft space which is accessed via a spiral staircase from the landing. This is a great additional room that could easily be used as a guest suite, or if you find yourself amongst those now working from home, it would be great as an office keeping your work and home life that bit more separate. There are two velux windows here providing a great deal of natural light and all important fresh air!Location - Situated in Monton Village amongst all the amenities the high street has to offer, and with easy access to Manchester City Centre, MediaCityUK and Intu Trafford Centre you are ideally placed for both urban and suburban living. Eccles Train Station and Metrolink are close by, and the motorway network is less than a 2 minute drive allowing for an easy commute or for travelling further afield. This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold.This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.Referral ArrangementsThe Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted.Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive payment for the recommendation and you will be informed of any referral arrangement and payment prior to any services being taken by you. Front walled lawned garden, shared side access to the rear, spacious rear south facing garden with paved and lawned areas, garden shed ideal for storage.Tenure - The vendor has confirmed the property is Leasehold with a term over 999 years remaining and a yearly payment of £5.00Stamp Duty - In England and Northern Ireland you're liable to pay Stamp Duty when you buy a residential property, or a piece of land, costing more than £125,000 (or more than £40,000 for second homes).This tax applies to both freehold and leasehold properties  whether you're buying outright or with a mortgage.ExampleIf you buy a house for £275,000, the SDLT you owe is calculated as follows:0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £25,000 = £1,250Total SDLT = £3,750Buyers of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties, will have to pay an extra 3% in Stamp Duty on top of current rates for each band.This increased rate applies to properties bought for £40,000 or more.FIRST TIME BUYER RELIEF If you're a first-time buyer in England or Northern Ireland, you will pay no Stamp Duty on properties worth up to £300,000. For properties costing up to £500,000, you will pay no Stamp Duty on the first £300,000. You will pay Stamp Duty on the remaining amount, up to £200,000. If the property you are buying is worth over £500,000, you will pay the standard rates of Stamp Duty and will not qualify for first-time buyer's relief.Higher rates for additional propertiesFrom 1 April 2016, you will usually have to pay 3% on top of the normal SDLT rates if buying a new residential property means you will own more than one.You wont pay the extra 3% SDLT if the property you are buying is replacing your main residence and that has already been sold.**IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT GOVERNMENT GUIDELINES THE PROPERTY IS CURRENTLY EXEMPT FROM STAMP DUTY TIL MARCH 2021 SUBJECT TO PERSONAL CIRCUMSTANCES**

Welcome to a very well-presented three bed detached property located in the ever popular area of Hulme. The property sits in a prime location, within a stones throw of Manchester city centre, as well as sitting close to a range of other amenities and transport links! The vendors have advised us that the property is FreeholdStamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

This is a very popular Lanes-built three bedroom semi-detached family home in one of the most highly sought after north Manchester locations. ACCOMMODATION COMPRISES: HALL: LOUNGE: Attractive bayed room to the front of the property with lovely feature fireplace. Auction Method: The auction for this property will take place as an "Auction Event" behind closed doors with a live auctioneer and will be streamed online in real-time. The property will be sold alongside several other lots. Bids must be placed remotely please see the below section on "Registration Process". The auction can be watched in real-time on the auction date through SDL Property Auctions' website on their home page. The auction date applicable for the property is displayed underneath the property description. It is not possible to provide a precise timeslot when this property will be auctioned on the day, because there are other lots being sold. You are required to undertake identity checks before you can be authorised to bid. You must also provide your payment details. If you do not provide this information, your registration will not be processed. When you place your bid, you are deemed to have agreed to SDL Property Auctions' Buyers Terms (England & Wales) which are available on SDL Property Auctions website.  Auction type - Unconditional with Variable Fee If you are the highest bidder, you must exchange legally binding contracts for the sale when the auction for the property comes to an end. You must then pay the applicable fees and deposit. You must complete the sale within 15 business days unless the Special Conditions of Sale contained within the Legal Pack state otherwise.  Auction Fees The following non-refundable fees apply: Buyer's Fee- payable on exchange of contracts. This is calculated as a percentage of the actual purchase price of the property. Either: (a) 4.8% (including VAT) of the purchase price, for properties up to and including £250,000 (b) 3.6% (including VAT) of the purchase price for properties sold for over £250,000 The Buyer's Fee is subject always to a minimum of £6,000 (including VAT). The Buyer's Fee does not contribute to the purchase price. There may be additional fees listed in the Special Conditions of Sale, which will be available to view within the Legal Pack. You must read the Special Conditions carefully before bidding. Any additional fees are included at the seller's discretion, not on the instruction of SDL Property Auctions, and will be in addition to any fees payable to us. SDL Property Auctions has limited control over the content of the Special Conditions of Sale.  Deposit On exchange of contracts, you must pay a non-refundable deposit equal to 5% of the actual purchase price of the property, subject to a minimum of £5,000. The deposit contributes towards the purchase price.  Payment Method: Applicable fees must be paid immediately after a winning bid has been placed. Payment by cash or cheque will not be accepted. Prior to the auction, you will receive an email from the auctioneer to register your card details with third-party provider, Stripe. Your card details will be stored on their secure online payment platform. Payment will only be taken from you in the event of a winning bid. In this case, you will be contacted by a representative of the auctioneer to make payment. If you cannot be contacted within 24 hours after the auction ends, the auctioneer reserves the right to charge your card.  Legal Pack Before bidding, you must view the legal pack for the property. This is the collection of legal documents that apply to the sale. The documents will include but are not limited to: Special Conditions of Sale, title documents from the Land Registry and Energy Performance Certificate. The legal pack can be viewed on SDL Property Auctions website by searching for the property. On the property details page there is a sub-heading "Legal Packs". Follow this link, and you will then be directed to create an account with Auction Passport to view the documents. The legal pack can change at any time up until the auction starts so you must check for the most recent version of the legal pack. An addendum may be issued outlining any late changes. At the point of placing your bid, you are deemed to have read the legal pack in its entirety, including any changes. Failure to check for changes to the legal pack will not be a valid reason for withdrawing from the sale. It is strongly recommended that you instruct a qualified professional to review the legal pack and raise any necessary enquiries before bidding.  Special Conditions of Sale The property is sold subject to any Special Conditions of Sale. These are contractual conditions that are included by the seller of the property - they are not part of SDL Property Auctions' terms and conditions. The Special Conditions of Sale are legally binding. You are taken to have read and accepted these at the point of bidding, even if you have not done so. The Special Conditions of Sale are available to read in the legal pack.  Registration Process: To register to bid on the property, visit the SDL Property Auctions website and submit your remote bid. The lot number can be found against the Lot Details of the property. Prospective buyers must register no later than 12pm the day before the auction date. If you register after the cut-off, it cannot be guaranteed that your registration will be processed.

This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold.This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.Referral ArrangementsThe Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you.
