Welcome to Parrin Lane, where you'll find a beautiful 3 double bedroom, semi-detached gem located just outside Monton Village. A perfect balance between old and new, this period property has been modernised beautifully throughout. Offering an abundance of space, this family home has everything you could ever need and want with a bay front, cellar and off-road parking (complete with electric vehicle charging point) – and that’s just for starters.The characteristic bay front invites you over as you walk towards the front of the property before entering a homely oasis. Built generously with 2 front rooms, one acts as a cosy living room, ideal for movie days in the rain, while the other looks onto the kitchen as an open dining room. As you peer through the diner, filled with light and offering a fireplace with log burner, you step into a beautifully designed kitchen which has been kitted out with quality materials, handy larder cupboard and an island. Flooded with light, not only does this area benefit from large windows but also boasts a wall of bi-folds, maximising the use of space and unique design. The already large kitchen and living area pours out onto the patio as the floor to ceiling glass doors pull back and you are met with quarried tiles, allowing you to welcome the outside in or enjoy a bit of al fresco dining. On the second floor you have a family bathroom and 3 wonderfully sized double bedrooms – ideal for family life, visitors or even an office space. Each bedroom offers plenty of light and has a lush, airy feel, perfect for relaxing and unwinding at the end of a long day.This characteristic property also benefits from a cellar, off road parking for 2-3 cars, electric vehicle charging point and original features throughout, while the garden is surrounded by a combination of beautiful red brick and modern fencing, and the decking area offers the perfect patch for your BBQ this summer.For those who enjoy the outdoors, the Bridgewater Canal is just a few minutes walk away providing a lovely backdrop for those weekend strolls. Monton Village is also within walking distance, offering all the local amenities you could need with an abundance of bars, shops and restaurants for you to work your way through! For those travelling further afield, the motorway network is close at hand, allowing an easy commute to Manchester City Centre, MediaCityUK and beyond!Contact our Monton office for more information and your chance to view!Important Notice - These particulars are not intended to nor do they form a contract or any part of a contract. The vendor has confirmed the property is Freehold.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

Bringing to market this beautiful three bedroom terrace property in an amazing location.In brief the accommodation comprises Lounge, Dining Room, Kitchen, 3 Double Bedrooms, a Family Bathroom and also enjoys cellars which offer the potential for further conversion. Externally the property enjoys a courtyard garden and an additional garden and parking area to the rear. In addition the house benefits from double glazing and a gas central heating system.Dane Bank is a popular area of Denton due to its primary schools and good transport links. It is ideally located for junction 24 of the M60 which will get you to Manchester Airport, the Trafford Centre and beyond. It is bordered on one side by the A57 which is perfect for Manchester City Centre or the Peak District national park and South Yorkshire. Local bus routes include the 201/202 which connects to Manchester Piccadilly. Trains can be accessed from Reddish North station. There are 2 local primary schools Danebank Primary and Denton West End. Secondary schools include Egerton Park Community College, St Thomas Moore and Audenshaw School for Boys. There are also a selection of local pubs and shops as well as Denton Golf course.Houses in this area are extremely popular and this property is a blend of space, character and potential. The property represents an excellent purchase for a family buyer and must be viewed internally in order to be fully appreciated.

Neighbourhood is a welcoming and diverse community of sustainably designed homes. A collection of ninety-five three-bedroom homes, contemporary in design, each one is built to a high specification. Sustainable features include electric car charging points, low energy and light infused spaces and bike storage. With green credentials, fully landscaped areas and private roof terraces. Neighbourhood offers a new green community space within an urban location for family and friends to enjoy.Neighbourhood is the combined vision of Step Places and Salix Homes. Created by, and for, the environmentally conscious, the homes offer modern-day living space in beautifully fitted surroundings, designed to bring comfort and joy. Neighbourhood continues our commitment to constructing exceptional homes.KEY FEATURESBlock paved driveway with electric car charging points enabled, Privacy screens on driveway, Fully alarmed and security lighting, Bike stores. Three stories, ground floor WC master bedroom with en suite and private roof terrace.All Neighbourhood homes are fitted with superfast broadband, car charging points, air source heat pumps, zonal heating systems, fresh air recycling systems and smart meters.LOCATIONConveniently located, only a five-minute walk to your nearest tram stop opens up fast access to the cities of Salford and Manchester whenever you need it. Schools, colleges and universities make high standards of education available for all ages in your immediate locality. From nurseries and pre-school to academies to sixth-form college and university, children and adults have easy access to their chosen path of learning from nearby Neighbourhood.Your local shops - barbers, convenience stores, florists, pharmacies, eateries and local pubs - are a few minutes’ walk from Neighbourhood. Schools and parks are within a short walking distance. Trams, trains and planes connect you with ease from Neighbourhood to Manchester and the rest of the world. Manchester Airport is 11 miles and a 20 minute drive away.BUYING OPTIONSHELP TO BUYHelp to Buy is a government backed scheme available in England and Wales that allows you to buy a home with just 5% deposit. With Help to Buy, you’ll get an equity loan of up to 20% of the cost of a new home; this is interest free for 5 years. Here’s how the scheme works Deposit 5% Government loan 20% Mortgage 75% You’ll need to obtain a mortgage of at least 75% of the full price of your new home.SHARED OWNERSHIPShared Ownership is part buy and part rent, buy between 25% - 75% of the market price and pay rent on the rest. Who? Everyone! As long as you are employed, have a household income of less than £80k and do not own another property. What would the rent be? You will pay 2.75% rent per annum on the unowned share. For example on £150k, if your mortgage is 50%, your rent would be £172 pcm on the remaining 50% (These are only indicative figures and are subject to market change and mortgage approval).OUTRIGHT OWNERSHIPBuying a new home outright at Neighbourhood? Choose your 100% owned home Reserve your new home with £500 Mortgage approval. Legal process and completion . Generally mortgages are based on a 10% deposit.*

It is well located for public transport links including the metro link, Heaton Park and is easily accessible to Prestwich Village and the motorway networks. The property briefly comprises of entrance way, spacious lounge and a fitted dining kitchen. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms and a modern spacious family bathroom. There is an attractive rear courtyard with a block paved patio ideal for alfresco dining. Properties in this location are selling fast and an early viewing is strongly recommended. What The Owner Says"We moved to Milton road from the city centre over 8 years ago intending to only stay for a short while. It has been a fantastic home for us. With both Heaton Park, Prestwich village and St Marys Park all within short walking distance it has been the perfect location to bring up our young family. The road has a fantastic community feel with other young families and couples on the street, especially around Halloween and other national holidays. It will be hard to say goodbye, but we can't wait to see it be another great home for someone else.  We've just had fibre to door broadband installed on the street, so you can get up to 2GB a sec broadband connections - which is amazing for working from home!" Ground FloorThe entrance way leads to the spacious lounge with ample room for sofas and further furniture, feature living flame gas fire set in an attractive ornate surround and laminate flooring.  The dining kitchen has ample space for a table and chairs and includes fitted wall/base units and work surfaces, integrated oven and four ring gas hob, space for a  fridge/freezer, dryer and washing machine, laminate flooring, rear access door.  First FloorThe master bedroom is a large double room with space for free standing furniture and carpeted flooring. The second bedroom is also a double room with space for free standing furniture and carpeted flooring. The modern bathroom is a three piece suite includes a panelled bath with shower, low level toilet and wash hand basin and attractive tiling. OutsideThere is a front garden with a brick boundary wall and a pathway leading to the front door.Attractive rear courtyard with a block paved patio which is ideal for summer barbecuing and alfresco dining. There is also a most useful brick stores. Additional InformationThe vendor informs us the property is Leasehold 999 year from build with a nominal ground rent (subject to solicitors confirmation)Gas fired central heating system via a Worcester combination boiler which is housed in the kitchen. Council Tax Band AThe loft is accessed off the landing via a retractable ladder which the vendor informs us is part boarded.

**REDUCED FOR QUICK SALE**A SPACIOUS WEST FACING ONE BEDROOM RETIREMENT APARTMENT FOR AGED 70 PLUS WITH WALK-OUT BALCONY, SITUATED ON THE THIRD FLOOR WITH LIFT. Broadfield Court was purpose built in 2016 by McCarthy & Stone for retirement living. The development consists of 48 one and two-bedroom retirement living plus apartments for the over 70s and 14 retirement living apartments for the over 60s. There is a CQC registered Estates Manager and team available from 7am until 11pm for help and support on site and a 24-hour emergency call system provided via a personal pendant alarm and with call points throughout. The development includes a Homeowners' lounge and landscaped gardens and an on-site Bistro serving hot food through the day, ideal for meeting new people or entertaining family and friends. There is even a guest suite for visitors who wish to stay (additional charges apply). There is also a useful laundry room and car parking – permit scheme applies, check with the Estate Manager for availability. What The Ower SaysMy Mum moved here from Kent, to be closer to extended family. She found Broadfield Court a welcoming safe and comfy environment to live in and with all the facilities and help available on tap with friendly staff, she felt really pampered.The Bistro was an inviting place for her to meet new people quickly and to receive family and friends. The guest apartment was perfect for visitors who needed to stay over and as a keen gardener in her younger days, she loved sitting in the grounds.My mum hopes the next occupant will be as happy as she was at Broadfield Court. Local Area Broadfield Court is situated in Prestwich, well located close to the shopping precinct and convenience shops on Rectory Lane and Bury New Road. Adjoining this new precinct is Marks & Spencer Simply Food, and close by a large Tesco Extra Supermarket. There are also Sedgley Parks shops, which include a Sainsburys local, Lidl and a Post Office just South of the site. The property is very prominent on Bury New Road, which is one of the main arterial routes in and out of Manchester city centre. The town has some very good residential areas close by including, Prestwich Park, Sedgley Park, Broughton Park and Whitefield. Kitchen Fully fitted kitchen with tiled floor. Stainless steel sink with mono block lever tap. ACCOMMODATION HALL LOUNGE/DINING ROOM KITCHEN SHOWEROOM 3 BEDROOMS BATHROOM/WC GARDEN TO THE FRONT AND YARD TO THE REAR GAS CENTRAL HEATING (Not tested) uPVC DOUBLE GLAZED WINDOWS VIEWING DATES 09th March 4.30 - 5.0016th March 9.00 - 9.3023rd March 4.30 - 5.0029th March 9.00 - 9.30Auction Method: The auction for this property will take place as an "Auction Event" behind closed doors with a live auctioneer and will be streamed online in real-time. The property will be sold alongside several other lots. Bids must be placed remotely please see the below section on "Registration Process". The auction can be watched in real-time on the auction date through SDL Property Auctions' website on their home page. The auction date applicable for the property is displayed underneath the property description. It is not possible to provide a precise timeslot when this property will be auctioned on the day, because there are other lots being sold. You are required to undertake identity checks before you can be authorised to bid. You must also provide your payment details. If you do not provide this information, your registration will not be processed. When you place your bid, you are deemed to have agreed to SDL Property Auctions' Buyers Terms (England & Wales) which are available on SDL Property Auctions website.  Auction type - Unconditional with Variable Fee If you are the highest bidder, you must exchange legally binding contracts for the sale when the auction for the property comes to an end. You must then pay the applicable fees and deposit. You must complete the sale within 15 business days unless the Special Conditions of Sale contained within the Legal Pack state otherwise.  Auction Fees The following non-refundable fees apply: Buyer's Fee- payable on exchange of contracts. This is calculated as a percentage of the actual purchase price of the property. Either: (a) 4.8% (including VAT) of the purchase price, for properties up to and including £250,000 (b) 3.6% (including VAT) of the purchase price for properties sold for over £250,000 The Buyer's Fee is subject always to a minimum of £6,000 (including VAT). The Buyer's Fee does not contribute to the purchase price. There may be additional fees listed in the Special Conditions of Sale, which will be available to view within the Legal Pack. You must read the Special Conditions carefully before bidding. Any additional fees are included at the seller's discretion, not on the instruction of SDL Property Auctions, and will be in addition to any fees payable to us. SDL Property Auctions has limited control over the content of the Special Conditions of Sale.  Deposit On exchange of contracts, you must pay a non-refundable deposit equal to 5% of the actual purchase price of the property, subject to a minimum of £5,000. The deposit contributes towards the purchase price.  Payment Method: Applicable fees must be paid immediately after a winning bid has been placed. Payment by cash or cheque will not be accepted. Prior to the auction, you will receive an email from the auctioneer to register your card details with third-party provider, Stripe. Your card details will be stored on their secure online payment platform. Payment will only be taken from you in the event of a winning bid. In this case, you will be contacted by a representative of the auctioneer to make payment. If you cannot be contacted within 24 hours after the auction ends, the auctioneer reserves the right to charge your card.  Legal Pack Before bidding, you must view the legal pack for the property. This is the collection of legal documents that apply to the sale. The documents will include but are not limited to: Special Conditions of Sale, title documents from the Land Registry and Energy Performance Certificate. The legal pack can be viewed on SDL Property Auctions website by searching for the property. On the property details page there is a sub-heading "Legal Packs". Follow this link, and you will then be directed to create an account with Auction Passport to view the documents. The legal pack can change at any time up until the auction starts so you must check for the most recent version of the legal pack. An addendum may be issued outlining any late changes. At the point of placing your bid, you are deemed to have read the legal pack in its entirety, including any changes. Failure to check for changes to the legal pack will not be a valid reason for withdrawing from the sale. It is strongly recommended that you instruct a qualified professional to review the legal pack and raise any necessary enquiries before bidding.  Special Conditions of Sale The property is sold subject to any Special Conditions of Sale. These are contractual conditions that are included by the seller of the property - they are not part of SDL Property Auctions' terms and conditions. The Special Conditions of Sale are legally binding. You are taken to have read and accepted these at the point of bidding, even if you have not done so. The Special Conditions of Sale are available to read in the legal pack.  Registration Process: To register to bid on the property, visit the SDL Property Auctions website and submit your remote bid. The lot number can be found against the Lot Details of the property. Prospective buyers must register no later than 12pm the day before the auction date. If you register after the cut-off, it cannot be guaranteed that your registration will be processed.

Viewings highly recommend to appreciate this loved family home.Entrance Porch - 0.74m x 1.35m (2'5 x 4'5) - Entrance porch leading to hallHall - Carpeted, stairs off, window to top of stairs, door leading into lounge.Lounge - 3.15m x 4.04m (10'4 x 13'3) - Front facing into bow window, carpeted, feature electric fire, radiator, tv point, under stairs storage cupboardKitchen/Diner - 3.78m x 5.00m (12'5 x 16'5) - Rear facing with window and vertical blinds, modern range of fitted wall and base units in Grey finish with complimentary wooden worktops. Inset sink and drainer with mixer taps over, built in single electric oven and gas hob with extractor hood over, tiled splashback, laminate flooring, plumbing for washer, spotlights, built in storage cupboard, neutral decor, patio doors to rear garden with vertical blinds.Stairs - Leading not all first floor rooms, carpeted, window to top of stairsBedroom 1 - 2.74m x 3.10m (9'0 x 10'2) - Front facing into bow window, carpeted, radiator, tv point, shelving, neutral decor.Bedroom 2 - 2.95m x 3.10m (9'8 x 10'2) - Rear facing window with vertical blinds, carpeted, radiator, tv point, shelving, neutral decor.Bedroom 3 - 2.06m x 1.80m (6'9 x 5'11) - Rear facing window with vertical blinds, carpeted, radiator, tv point, boiler.Family Bathroom - 1.52m x 1.80m (5 x 5'11) - Front facing with window, three piece bathroom suite in white comprising of sink, toilet and bath withy shower over, radiator, partly tiled walls, vinyl flooringExternally - Front driveway for 2 cars and paved path, gated side access to private rear garden with split level decked area.Tenure - The vendors have confirmed the property is Leasehold for 999 years starting from July 1942 with a Ground Rent of £5.00pa.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

This property is for sale by Reeds Rains auctions powered by i am-sold Ltd.This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with traditional auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. We do not require the purchaser to exchange contracts immediately, however from the date the Draft Contract is received by the buyers solicitor, the buyer is given 56 days in which to complete the transaction, with the aim being to exchange contracts within the first 28 days. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Viewing highly recommended.Entrance Porch - 1.14mx0.81m (3'9x2'8) - Front access, carpeted, entrance into lounge.Lounge - 3.38mx4.19m (11'1x13'9) - Front facing window, vertical blinds, carpeted, radiator, TV point, electric fire with surround and hearth, stairs off to first floor, neutral decor, access to kitchen.Kitchen - 3.68mx4.19m (12'1x13'9) - Rear facing with window, roller blinds, sliding patio doors leading out to rear, vinyl flooring, radiator, range of wall and base units in wood effect with complimentary worktops, black tiled splashback, stainless inset sink with mixer tap over and drainer, free standing gas hob with oven and grill, plumbing for washer, neutral decor, under stair cupboard storage.Stairs - Carpeted, leading to landing with side facing window, storage/boiler cupboard, access to all first floor rooms.Bedroom 1 - 3.38mx4.19m (11'1x13'9) - Front facing window, vertical blinds, carpeted, radiator, TV point.Bedroom 2 - 3.25mx1.96m (10'8x6'5) - Rear facing with window, vertical blinds, carpeted, TV point, neutral decor.Family Bathroom - 2.11mx2.13m max (6'11x7' max) - Rear facing with window, three piece bathroom suite in white, combination WC and sink basin in wood effect, electric shower over bath with shower screen, heated towel rail, vinyl flooring, panelled walls, neutral decor.Externally - Front artificial grass area, side access to rear, rear garden finished with an artificial lawn.Tenure - The vendor has confirmed the property is Freehold.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

St Anne's Place is bringing three bedroom houses and apartments to Audenshaw, Greater Manchester, for first time buyers to find the dream home they've been looking for. With a mix of house types to meet a variety of needs, St Anne's Place has something for everyone.  For first time buyers looking for low maintenance living with an easily manageable property, an apartment is the perfect fit with all rooms conveniently located on one floor without compromising on space. For those who are looking for extra space to accommodate their lifestyle, our three bedroom properties have scope to turn a spare room into an office to balance and home life or a spare room to host guests.  In addition to properties constructed with the contemporary first time buyer in mind, St Anne's Place is in a superb location with both rural and urban living accessible by car or public transport. With Manchester City Centre accessible just a short drive away, residents can get amongst the hustle and bustle and make the most of the night life, restaurants and eateries as well as The Trafford Centre and Manchester Arndale for a day spent shopping. These properties will all be offered through Shared Ownership with the minimum share being 50%. For more information please contact our sales team today

Shared Ownership is a part-buy, part-rent scheme for people who can't afford to buy 100% of a home. You'll need a minimum level of income/savings depending on the value of the home you want to buy.

Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold. The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change
